instruction: What is the consensus of all Muslims regarding the phrase "Bismillah al-Rahman al-Rahim"?
output: It is a consensus that this phrase is a verse of the Holy Qur'an and is written at the head of every Surah except Surah al-Taubah.

instruction: What is the opinion of Imam Abu Hanifah about the status of "Bismillah al-Rahman al-Rahim" in all Surahs?
output: Imam Abu Hanifah believes that "Bismillah al-Rahman al-Rahim" is not an integral part of any Surah except Surah al-Naml. It is an independent verse of the Holy Qur'an that has been revealed for being placed at the beginning of every Surah.

instruction: What does the recitation of "Bismillah al-Rahman al-Rahim" symbolize in Islamic life?
output: Recitation of "Bismillah al-Rahman al-Rahim" sacralizes human life by orienting it towards Allah, transforming mundane activities into acts of worship. It signifies the acknowledgment that nothing one does, not even one's very being, can come into existence without the will and help of Allah.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Al-hamdulillah" in the Surah al-Fatihah?
output: The phrase "Al-hamdulillah" signifies that all praise essentially belongs to Allah. It opens a new perspective for man, showing him how the many are knit together in the same unity, and how all praise in reality belongs to One whose power is absolute.

instruction: What is the attribute of Allah mentioned in the second phrase of the Surah al-Fatihah?
output: The second phrase, "Ar-Rahman Ar-Rahim", speaks of two attributes of Allah: "The All-Merciful, the Very-Merciful".

instruction: Who is the 'Lord of all the worlds' mentioned in the third phrase of the Surah al-Fatihah?
output: The 'Lord of all the worlds' mentioned in the third phrase is Allah, who is the only one who gives nurture to all the forms of existents that are to be found in this universe or in the millions of other universes that may lie beyond our own universe in the outer space.

instruction: What does the adjective Rahman in the Islamic text refer to?
output: The adjective Rahman in the Islamic text refers to the superabundance and perfection of Divine mercy.

instruction: What is the significance of the reference to the quality of mercy in the given text?
output: The reference to the quality of mercy in the text is perhaps intended as a reminder that Allah nurtures His creation in response to His own quality of mercy, and that the universe is no burden to Him.

instruction: Why does the text mention the universe not existing as a situation where Allah would suffer no loss?
output: The text mentions the universe not existing as a situation where Allah would suffer no loss to emphasize that His mercy is not based on any necessity or compulsion, but is a selfless and voluntary act.

instruction: What is the Day of Judgment or Requital?
output: The Day of Judgment or Requital is the Day appointed by Allah to recompense good or evil deeds.

instruction: Who is the Master of the Day of Judgment or Requital?
output: Allah is the Master of the Day of Judgment or Requital. His mastery over everything that exists will belong to Allah alone on that day.

instruction: Why does the verse specifically mention the Day of Judgment or Requital?
output: The verse mentions the Day of Judgment or Requital to remind man that his temporary, limited mastery in this world is only a trial and that a Day will come when masters will no more be masters and slaves no more slaves, and the ownership and mastery, apparent as well as real, of the whole universe will be seen to belong to none but Allah, the Exalted.

instruction: What is the double aspect of the fourth verse "You alone we worship, and from You alone we seek help"?
output: The verse has a double aspect; one of praise and another of prayer.

instruction: What do the first two verses of the Surah remind a man about his past and present?
output: The first two verses remind a man that he owes everything to Allah in his past and present, as Allah created him, endowed him with reason and intuition, and continues to sustain and nurture him.

instruction: What does the third verse, "Master of the Day of Judgment," tell a man about his future?
output: The third verse tells a man that in the future, he will have to depend on Allah alone for help on the Day of Judgment.

instruction: What is the prayer for guidance in the Quran?
output: The prayer for guidance is: "Guide us in the straight path, the path of those on whom You have bestowed Your grace, not of those who have incurred Your wrath, nor of those who have gone astray."

instruction: What are the implications of guidance in the Quran?
output: The Quranic term 'guidance' implies leading someone towards their destination gently and kindly. It has several degrees, and Allah's guidance is the highest form.

instruction: What are the three degrees of guidance mentioned in the text?
output: The three degrees of guidance are: (1) general guidance common to all creatures, (2) particular guidance limited to rational beings, and (3) special guidance granted to true believers and the God-fearing.

instruction: What are the isolated letters at the beginning of several Surahs in the Quran?
output: The isolated letters at the beginning of several Surahs in the Quran are symbols or mysteries, the meaning of which is known to Allah alone or may have been entrusted as a special secret to the Holy Prophet ﷺ not to be communicated to anyone else.

instruction: According to the majority of the blessed Companions and the later authoritative scholars, what are the isolated letters in the Quran?
output: According to the majority of the blessed Companions and the later authoritative scholars, the isolated letters in the Quran are symbols or mysteries, the meaning of which is known to Allah alone, and it is not permissible for us to discuss or interpret them.

instruction: What are the benefits of reciting the isolated letters in the Quran?
output: The benefits of reciting the isolated letters in the Quran include: believing in them and reciting them is a great merit, and in reciting them, we receive spiritual blessings from the unseen world, even if we are not aware of the fact.

instruction: What does the demonstrative pronoun "dhalika" refer to in the Arabic text "ذَٰلِكَ الْكِتَابُ"?
output: The demonstrative pronoun "dhalika" refers to the prayer for the straight path made in the Surah Al-Fatihah, implying that the prayer has been granted and the Holy Qur'an is the answer to the request.

instruction: What does the Holy Qur'an claim about itself in the text?
output: The Holy Qur'an claims that "There is no doubt in it".

instruction: What is the implication of the phrase "A guidance for the God-fearing" (هُدًى لِّلْمُتَّقِيْنَ)?
output: The phrase "A guidance for the God-fearing" implies that the Holy Qur'an provides guidance not only to mankind but to all existents in the universe, but the special guidance which is the means of salvation in the other world is reserved for the God-fearing alone.

instruction: Who are the God-fearing?
output: The God-fearing are those who have faith in the unseen, are steadfast in Salah, and spend in the way of Allah.

instruction: What is the definition of 'Iman ایمان?
output: 'Iman ایمان signifies accepting with complete certitude the statement made by a prophet out of one's total confidence and trust in him and without the need of personal observation.

instruction: What does the term 'Ghayb غیب' mean?
output: 'Ghayb غیب' denotes things which are not known to man in an evident manner, or which are not apprehensible through the five senses. The Holy Qur'an uses this word to indicate all the things which we cannot know through the five senses or through reason, but which have been reported to us by the Holy Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: What is the verse from the Quran that speaks of some other attributes of the God-fearing?
output: The verse is Surah Al-Baqarah (2:3) which says, "Or do those who are faithless think that they can take My servants [as allies] right after they have no [real] authority over them and they will have no protection from Me?"

instruction: What do the blessed Companions `Abdullah ibn Masud and `Abdullah ibn `Abbas say about the verse Surah Al-Baqarah (2:3)?
output: They say that the verse refers to Muslims who were previously associators and disbelievers but accepted Islam, and it specifically mentions belief in the earlier Divine Books along with belief in the Holy Qur'an.

instruction: What is the obligatory belief for every Muslim according to the Islamic doctrine as mentioned in this text?
output: It is obligatory for every Muslim, as an essential part of the Islamic creed, to believe in the earlier Divine Books (except for the changes and distortions introduced by selfish people), that Allah has sent His messengers and His books for the guidance of all the peoples and all the ages, and that Muhammad ﷺ is the last prophet and the Holy Qur'an the final Book of Allah which has come down to replace the earlier Books and Shari'ahs.

instruction: What is the primary purpose of the first twenty verses of Surah Al-Baqarah?
output: The primary purpose of the first twenty verses of Surah Al-Baqarah is to provide guidance and to divide mankind into two distinct groups based on their acceptance or rejection of this guidance. The first two verses speak of those who refuse to listen to the guidance, while the rest of the verses delineate their characteristic qualities, signs, and characteristics, and their ultimate end.

instruction: What are the two distinct groups of people mentioned in Surah Al-Baqarah?
output: The two distinct groups of people mentioned in Surah Al-Baqarah are those who have chosen to follow and receive guidance, and are hence called Mu'minun (true Muslims) or Muttaqun مُتَّقون (the God-fearing), and those who reject the guidance or deviate from it, and are hence called Kafirun (disbelievers) or Munafiqun مُنافقون (hypocrites).

instruction: What is the definition of Kufr کفر (Infidelity) in the context of Islamic terminology?
output: In Islamic terminology, Kufr کفر signifies the denial of any of those things in which it is obligatory to believe. A person who questions or disregards even a single teaching of the Islamic creed will be described as a kafir کافر (disbeliever or infidel).

instruction: What does the withdrawal of divine favor signify according to the Islamic text?
output: The withdrawal of divine favor signifies a punishment, which is a grievous form that happens when the divine favor which helps one to reform oneself is withdrawn, so that, ignoring how one's deeds are to be assessed on the Day of Judgment, one keeps growing in disobedience and sin, and finally comes to lose even the awareness of evil.

instruction: What is the significance of the term 'Ra'n' or 'Rust' in the Islamic text?
output: The term 'Ra'n' or 'Rust' signifies the darkness that comes over the hearts of a person due to their sins. This darkness disturbs the person, and if they do not seek Allah's pardon, the 'Ra'n' multiplies, making it difficult for them to distinguish between good and evil.

instruction: What is the interpretation of the verse "كَلَّا بَلْ ۫ رَانَ عَلٰي قُلُوْبِهِمْ مَّا كَانُوْا يَكْسِبُوْنَ" (No. But what they did has rusted their hearts)?
output: This verse signifies that the arrogance and evil deeds of disbelievers have settled on their hearts like rust, and it is this very rust that seals their hearts and blocks their senses, making them incapable of accepting the truth. This rust is what is referred to as a 'seal' or 'covering' in the verse under discussion.

instruction: What does the verse "We believe in Allah and in the Last Day" indicate about lying?
output: The verse indicates that lying is contemptible.

instruction: Why did the hypocrites refrain from lying, according to the text?
output: The hypocrites refrained from lying to avoid the hostility of Islam, as they feared telling a lie.

instruction: What is left out by the hypocrites in their claim of being Muslims, as mentioned in the text?
output: The hypocrites leave out the faith in the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ from their claim of being Muslims.

instruction: What is the meaning of the term "disease" in the context of the Holy Qur'an and Hadith?
output: In the context of the Holy Qur'an and Hadith, the term "disease" refers to certain mental or psychic states that hinder man from attaining any degree of spiritual perfection. These states may gradually deprive him of the ability to perform good deeds, and even of ordinary human decency, till he meets with his spiritual death.

instruction: What is the disease hidden in the hearts of the hypocrites, according to the third verse?
output: The disease hidden in the hearts of the hypocrites is unbelief and rejection of the truth.

instruction: Why is lying considered a grievous punishment according to the Qur'anic verses?
output: Lying is considered a grievous punishment according to the Qur'anic verses because it is considered a real crime that gradually leads to hypocrisy and disbelief. Although hypocrisy and disbelief are much greater crimes, yet they arise from the habit of telling lies.

instruction: Who are the hypocrites as described in the text?
output: The hypocrites are individuals who, through their prevarication and double dealing, threaten to produce general chaos and disorder, while pretending to be men of good will and serving the cause of peace and order.

instruction: What does the Holy Qur'an indicate about the activities of the hypocrites?
output: The Holy Qur'an indicates that the activities of the hypocrites actually produced disorder in the land, but they were not aware of this possibility.

instruction: What is the essence of the teachings of the Holy Prophet as mentioned in the text?
output: The essence of the teachings of the Holy Prophet, according to the text, is fear of Allah and solicitude for the assessment of one's deeds on the Day of Judgment.

instruction: What do the first two verses of Surah Al-Baqarah reveal about the hypocrites as described in the Holy Qur'an?
output: The first two verses of Surah Al-Baqarah reveal that the hypocrites claim to be Muslims by declaring their faith in Allah and the Last Day, yet they are not true believers. They are only trying to deceive Allah and the believers, and they end up deceiving no one but themselves.

instruction: How can one understand the implications of the verses that define the hypocrites as liars?
output: One needs to understand that for a claim to faith in Allah and the Last Day to be valid and worthy of the name, it must conform to what the Holy Qur'an specifically lays down with regards to the divine names and attributes, and belief in the Last Day must be true to the specifications of the Holy Qur'an and the Hadith.

instruction: What is the criterion for judging one's claim to Iman (faith) according to verse 13 of Surah Al-Baqarah?
output: The criterion for judging one's claim to Iman (faith) is the Iman of the blessed Companions of the Holy Prophet ﷺ, and any claim to Iman that does not conform to it is not acceptable to Allah and to the Holy Prophet ﷺ. If a man interprets an Islamic doctrine or verse of the Holy Qur'an in a way that departs from the explicit and clear explanation provided by the Holy Qur'an itself or by the Holy Prophet ﷺ, his individual opinion and belief will have no value or validity in the eyes of the Shari'ah.

instruction: What is the comment made by the eighth verse of the Islamic text about the hypocrites?
output: The eighth verse is a comment on the attitude of complacency and self-congratulation on the part of the hypocrites, who believed they could easily deceive Muslims.

instruction: Why were the hypocrites described as being thrown into ridicule?
output: The hypocrites were described as being thrown into ridicule because Allah, in His forbearance and mercy, gave them a long rope, but this was a provision for their being thrown into ridicule.

instruction: What was the outcome of the hypocrites' mockery of Allah's punishment?
output: The outcome of the hypocrites' mockery of Allah's punishment was a divine action described as a mockery on the part of Allah, which resulted in the hypocrites being caught and their cup of iniquity being full.

instruction: What does the ninth verse of the Islamic text reveal about the hypocrites?
output: The ninth verse reveals that the hypocrites are dense and lack the ability to discriminate between right and wrong due to their greed for worldly profit.

instruction: What does the Qur'an suggest about the understanding of the hypocrites regarding trading?
output: The Qur'an suggests that the hypocrites had no understanding of the art of trading.

instruction: What did the hypocrites trade in the context of the Islamic text?
output: The hypocrites traded their faith (Iman) for infidelity (Kufr) in the context of the Islamic text.

instruction: What is the purpose of the two extended similes in the last four verses of the Islamic text?
output: The purpose of the two extended similes in the last four verses is to divide the hypocrites into two kinds of men, those with deep-rooted disbelief and those who recognize the truth of Islam but are hesitant due to worldly interests.

instruction: What are the two examples given in the text to illustrate the hypocrites' state?
output: The two examples given in the text to illustrate the hypocrites' state are: (1) a man who finds light but loses it again, and (2) men caught in a thunderstorm who move forward a step or two when there is a flash of lightning, but, when it is over, again get stuck.

instruction: What is the comparison of the hypocrites to, according to the text, and why are they likened to these examples?
output: The hypocrites are compared to a man who finds light but loses it again in the text because this illustrates those in whom disbelief has taken deep roots, so that they have little inclination towards Islam, but pretend to be Muslims for worldly motives. The second example, men caught in a thunderstorm, represents those who do recognize the truth of Islam, but worldly interests prevent them from being genuine Muslims, and they remain in a perpetual state of hesitation and doubt.

instruction: What is the answer to the prayer made in the Surah Al-Fatihah?
output: The answer to the prayer made in the Surah Al-Fatihah is the guidance present in the Holy Qur'an, as it is from the beginning to the end a detailed account of the straight path.

instruction: According to the Surah 'Al-Baqarah', what are the three groups of men divided into based on?
output: The Surah 'Al-Baqarah' divides men into three groups based on their acceptance or rejection of the guidance provided in the Holy Qur'an.

instruction: What does the phrase "Worship your Lord" in the Holy Qur'an's verse 21 mean?
output: The phrase "Worship your Lord" in the Holy Qur'an's verse 21 means to abandon the worship of created beings and worship Allah alone, sincerely, and in obedience to Him.

instruction: What is the main purpose of sending down all the Divine Books and Prophets according to the text?
output: The main purpose of sending down all the Divine Books and Prophets is to affirm and worship the one God, known as Tauhid توحید in Arabic.

instruction: What is the impact of Tauhid on human life?
output: Tauhid has an all-pervading and radically transforming impact on every sphere of human life, both internal and external, individual as well as collective.

instruction: What does the text imply about human actions and salvation?
output: The text implies that human actions by themselves cannot bring salvation as a necessary reward. Salvation and going to Heaven can only be attained by the grace of Allah alone. Human ability to perform good deeds is merely a sign of divine grace, not the cause.

instruction: What are the two basic principles that the Holy Qur'an rests upon?
output: The Holy Qur'an rests on two basic principles - Tauhid (the Oneness of God) and Risalah (Prophethood).

instruction: What does the text in verses 23 and 24 of the Holy Qur'an affirm?
output: The verses 23 and 24 of the Holy Qur'an affirm the prophethood of Muhammad ﷺ by presenting the word of Allah as a proof.

instruction: What is the mode of argument in verses 23 and 24 of the Holy Qur'an?
output: The mode of argument in verses 23 and 24 of the Holy Qur'an is to present certain things that no one except Allah can do as evidence of His Oneness, and to present the inability of all created beings to produce something equal to or resembling the Word of Allah as evidence of its being the Word of Allah alone.

instruction: What is the nature of the fruits in Paradise according to some commentators of the Holy Qur'an?
output: Some commentators believe that the fruits in Paradise would share a common name with the fruits of the earth but will have a different taste.

instruction: What is the distinction between the wives in Paradise and those on earth?
output: The wives in Paradise will be clean externally and pure internally, free from physical and moral disgusting aspects.

instruction: What is the difference between the joys of Paradise and those of the earth?
output: The joys of Paradise will be perpetual, unlike the joys of the earth which are short-lived and often accompanied by fear of losing them.

instruction: What is the purpose of the parables found in the Holy Qur'an?
output: The Holy Qur'an uses parables to serve as a test for men, providing guidance for those who are ready to think and understand, but causing confusion and misguidance for those who refuse to understand due to indifference or stubborn hostility and denial.

instruction: What does the term 'Al-fasiqin' refer to in the context of the Shari'ah?
output: In the context of the Shari'ah, Al-fasiqin refers to individuals who have gone beyond the circle of obedience to Allah, transgressing the commandments of Allah.

instruction: What is the Covenant that the disobedient and rebellious individuals disavow?
output: The Covenant they disavow refers to the one that all men made with Allah before any of them came down to earth, in which Allah asked the spirits of all men if He was their Lord, and they all replied "Yes." This Covenant requires that men should in no way be disobedient to Allah.

instruction: What is the Islamic perspective on relationships?
output: In Islam, relationships are of utmost importance, including the relationship with Allah, with parents and relatives, neighbors and friends, fellow Muslims, and fellow human beings in general.

instruction: What does Islam consider to be the main objective of relationships?
output: The main objective of relationships in Islam is to fulfill one's obligations, which is also the way to follow the Shari'ah.

instruction: What are the consequences of deficiency in fulfilling these obligations?
output: Deficiency in fulfilling these obligations produces all kinds of disorder among men, and the transgressors end up by being destructive for others and for themselves, as per the Holy Qur'an.

instruction: What does the given Islamic text discuss?
output: The given Islamic text discusses the blessings that Allah has bestowed upon mankind and the ungratefulness of some people towards Allah despite these blessings.

instruction: What are the two verses in the text referring to?
output: The two verses in the text refer to the blessings that are particular to human beings and the blessings that are common to humans and other creatures.

instruction: What does the first verse suggest about man's existence?
output: The first verse suggests that man had no life before Allah gave him existence.

instruction: Why did Allah discuss Adam's creation with angels?
output: Allah discussed Adam's creation with angels to illustrate the superiority of Adam in knowledge, to demonstrate the truth to them, and to make the angels realize the mistake in their supposition that they were more suitable for being the vice regents of Allah than Adam (علیہ السلام).

instruction: Who was Adam (علیہ السلام)?
output: Adam (علیہ السلام) was the first man, created by Allah, and appointed as the vice regent of Allah on the earth.

instruction: What is the significance of Adam (علیہ السلام) being made the vice regent of Allah on the earth?
output: Adam (علیہ السلاam) being made the vice regent of Allah on the earth signifies the establishment of spiritual and temporal order on the earth and the promulgation of divine commandments. Allah chose him for this function because he was endowed with superior knowledge and understanding of the things to be found on the earth, of the ways of using them, and of the consequences which would follow from such a use.

instruction: Who were the beings commanded to prostrate themselves before Adam (علیہ السلام)?
output: The angels were commanded to prostrate themselves before Adam (علیہ السلام).

instruction: What was the purpose of the angels prostrating themselves before Adam (علیہ السلام)?
output: The purpose of the angels prostrating themselves before Adam (علیہ السلام) was to honor him and show respect, as it was not an act of worship.

instruction: Who refused to prostrate before Adam (علیہ السلام) and why?
output: Iblis (Satan) refused to prostrate before Adam (علیہ السلام) because he considered himself superior to Adam and did not want to show respect to him.

instruction: What was the command given to Adam and Eve in Paradise?
output: Adam and Eve were commanded to live in Paradise and enjoy its blessings. They were also instructed not to eat the fruit of a particular tree.

instruction: What happened as a result of Adam and Eve eating from the forbidden tree?
output: Because of this error, they too were ordered to leave Paradise and go down to live on the earth. They were warned that their existence on the earth would no longer be full of perpetual bliss as it had been in Paradise, but that there would be dissension and enmity among men, their progeny, which would spoil the joy of earthly life.

instruction: What is the name given to the tree from which Adam and Eve were forbidden to eat?
output: The name of the tree is not specifically mentioned in the text. Some commentators say it was wheat, others say it was a fig-tree or a grape-vine, but it is not necessary to make specific what the Holy Qur'an has left vague. (See Qurtubi)

instruction: How did Satan manage to enter Paradise to deceive Adam and Eve?
output: While there isn't a definitive answer in the Islamic text, possible scenarios include Satan planting suggestions from afar, assuming a disguise, or actually meeting them and speaking to them face to face.

instruction: Was Satan given any power to act independently in the scenario of Adam and Eve's temptation?
output: No, according to the Islamic text, the words of the Holy Qur'an do not imply that Satan had any independent power.

instruction: Why were Adam and Eve told that they would be each other's enemies?
output: This was said to emphasize the ongoing enmity between Satan, Adam, Eve, and their progeny, whether Satan had already been expelled from Paradise or not. If Satan had not been expelled, he is included in this address. If he had been expelled, then Adam and Eve and their progeny are the addressees, and the implication would be that they would have to undergo a double punishment, firstly that of being banished from Paradise, secondly that of seeing enmity arise among their children.

instruction: What was the mode of Adam's descent to the earth when he was sent down after being pardoned?
output: The mode of Adam's descent to the earth, after being pardoned, was in the mode of wisdom, and the sending down to the earth was an honor - the honor of vice regency.

instruction: What did Allah promise to those who follow divine guidance according to the Qur'an verse 38?
output: According to Qur'an verse 38, those who follow divine guidance will have no fear and will not grieve.

instruction: What does the verse 35:34 of the Qur'an promise to those who go to Paradise?
output: According to verse 35:34 of the Qur'an, those who go to Paradise will have no sorrow.

instruction: What does verse 41 of the Islamic text warn against?
output: Taking a paltry price for His signs or verses of the Book of Allah.

instruction: What is the consensus of the Ummah on the matter mentioned in verse 41?
output: It is forbidden to take money from people by misinterpreting or concealing the verses of the Book of Allah in order to please them or to serve their worldly interests.

instruction: Is it permissible to accept wages for teaching the Holy Qur'an?
output: There is a divergence of views among the Fuqaha ' (jurists) in this matter. However, in certain circumstances, such as when Islamic society fell into disorder and the teachers of the Holy Qur'an lost their financial support, it has been declared permissible by the jurists of the Hanafi school, following an essential religious need. But paying or receiving wages for recitation of the Holy Qur'an for transmitting the reward to the dead or in the interest of some worldly purpose is forbidden, as it fulfills no essential religious need.

instruction: What story is related by Imam al-Qurtubi that highlights the importance of truth and the forbidden nature of concealing it?
output: The story of Caliph Sulayman ibn ` Abd al-Malik (رح) and his encounter with Abu Hazim ؓ is the story that highlights the importance of truth and the forbidden nature of concealing it.

instruction: Why did Caliph Sulayman ibn ` Abd al-Malik (رح) want to meet Abu Hazim ؓ?
output: Caliph Sulayman ibn ` Abd al-Malik (رح) wanted to meet Abu Hazim ؓ because he was the only man in Madinah who had lived with a Companion of the Holy Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: What did Abu Hazim say to Caliph Sulayman ibn ` Abd al-Malik (رح) when he asked him why he hadn't visited him?
output: Abu Hazim replied, "You have not been familiar with my name before today, nor have I ever seen you. Things being what they are, how could I come to meet you? Is it disloyalty or discourtesy?"

instruction: What are the three connotations of the Arabic word Sabr صبر, as explained in the text?
output: (a) bearing pain and misfortune patiently, (b) restraining oneself from sin, (c) being steadfast in obeying Allah.

instruction: What are the remedies, prescribed by the Holy Qur'an, for the "twin diseases" of love of money and power?
output: The remedies prescribed by the Holy Qur'an for the "twin diseases" of love of money and power are Sabr صبر (patience) and Salah نماز (prayer).

instruction: What are the two thoughts that produce "hope and fear in the heart", as explained in the text?
output: The two thoughts that produce "hope and fear in the heart" are remembering that one is to meet their Lord, when they shall receive the reward for their obedience, and also remembering that they are to return to Him, when they shall be required to present an account of their deeds.

instruction: What does Khushu' خشوع mean according to the text?
output: Khushu' خشوع means the humbleness of heart, which connotes a restfulness of heart and humility arising out of the awareness of Allah's majesty and of one's own insignificance in comparison to it.

instruction: What is the significance of Khushu' خشوع in the eyes of the Shari'ah regarding Salah نماز?
output: According to the text, the Shari'ah considers Khushu' خشوع as the very essence of Salah نماز, and its acceptability depends on it. However, the four great Imams of Islamic jurisprudence and most of the jurists do not hold Khushu' خشوع to be a necessary condition for the total duration of Salah نماز, but only enunciate the exoteric regulations of the Shari'ah on the basis of the external actions of men's physical organs.

instruction: How does Imam al-Ghazali (رح) explain the divergence of view about the necessity of Khushu' خشوع for the total duration of Salah نماز?
output: Imam al-Ghazali (رح) explains that the Fuqaha' (jurists) are not concerned with inner qualities and states of the heart, but only enunciate the exoteric regulations of the Shari'ah on the basis of the external actions of men's physical organs. Additionally, he suggests that, except for a few gifted individuals, men in general are incapable of maintaining Khushu' خشوع for the total duration of the prayers; so, in order to avoid compelling men to a task they cannot accomplish, the Fuqaha' have made Khushu' خشوع a necessary condition only for the beginning of the prayers, and not for the whole duration.

instruction: What does the phrase "giving preference to the Israelites over the worlds" mean in the context of the verse 47?
output: It means that the Israelites were given preference in certain matters or over a large part of men, such as over the contemporaries of the earlier Israelites.

instruction: What is the significance of the day referred to in verse 48?
output: The day referred to in verse 48 is the Day of Judgment.

instruction: What does the phrase "no one being able to suffice another on that day" imply?
output: It implies that one man paying the dues on behalf of another man on the Day of Judgment will not be possible.

output: The essence of religion, whether it be Islam, Christianity, or Judaism, lies in two things: (1) obedience to Allah in one's belief as well as in one's actions, and (2) this obedience should not arise from expediency but one should surrender oneself to divine commandments in all sincerity.

instruction: What is forbidden according to the Islamic text in terms of interfering with people's prayers in a mosque?
output: Interfering with people's prayers in a mosque is forbidden, including not allowing someone to enter a mosque, producing noise or playing music in the mosque, or reciting the Holy Qur'an or making "dhikr ذکر " in a loud voice while people are offering supererogatory prayers or themselves reading the Holy Qur'an or silently "remembering" Allah.

instruction: What does the practice of "populating" the mosques mean according to the fourth Khalifah, `Ali ؓ?
output: `Ali ؓ defines "populating" the mosques as entering them in a spirit of humility and with the fear of Allah in one's heart, and then engaging oneself in prayers or in reciting the Holy Qur'an or in making "dhikr. ذکر ' The opposite of this, or "laying waste" a mosque, means that few, or only a few people should offer their prayers in them, or that a set of circumstances is allowed to develop which makes it difficult for those who are present to acquire the proper attitude of humility.

instruction: At the time of the peace of Hudaybiyyah, the mushrikin (associators) did not allow the Holy Prophet to enter Makkah and perform Hajj, preventing people from entering the Ka'bah and performing worship.

instruction: What is the importance of the verses in the Quran regarding the Jews, Christians, and polytheists' claims about God having offspring?
output: The verses refute the false claims of the Jews, Christians, and polytheists that God has offspring, as it's impossible and contradictory in terms of reason and the nature of God.

instruction: What are the four qualities that are unique to Allah and not found in anyone else, as demonstrated in the two verses?
output: The four qualities are: (1) All that exists in heaven or earth belongs to Allah. (2) Everything is subservient to Him. (3) He is the Creator and the Inventor of the skies and the earth. (4) His power of creation is such that when He wishes to do something, He does not need any instruments or helpers; all He does is to say, "Be", and the thing becomes what He wishes it to be.

instruction: What is the significance of the statement "creation taking place through the Divine Command, 'Be'" in the context of the Quran?
output: This statement signifies that there is no interval between an act of will on God's part and its realization, and that creation is a mystery beyond human understanding, which is not to be revealed to those who have no aptitude for receiving it. It also implies that before a thing comes to exist as an "actuality" in the world, it already exists as a "potentiality" in Divine Knowledge, to which the Divine Command "Be" is addressed. Essences do not exist in the knowledge of the creatures but already exist as potentialities in Divine Knowledge.

instruction: Why did some Jews and Christians deny the prophethood of Muhammad ﷺ?
output: They denied his prophethood out of sheer malevolence and made absurd demands, such as insisting that Allah Himself should speak to them or send a sign to confirm his prophethood.

instruction: What did the Jews and Christians demand that Allah should do to confirm Muhammad's ﷺ prophethood?
output: They demanded that Allah should either speak to them directly or through the angels, or send a sign or proof to confirm his prophethood.

instruction: Why did Allah dismiss the first demand made by the Jews and Christians as unworthy of a reply?

instruction: What was the reason for the denial of the Holy Prophet ﷺ by some people?
output: The denial of the Holy Prophet ﷺ was due to sheer malice and ignorance.

instruction: What was the consolation offered to the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ by Allah in Verse 118?
output: The consolation offered to the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ was that he should not be held responsible or taken to account for those who willingly pursue the way to Hell.

instruction: What are the two main functions of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ as mentioned in the verse?
output: The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ's two main functions are to give glad tidings to those who accept the truth and to warn those who deny.

instruction: What is the purpose of Allah addressing this verse to the Holy Prophet ﷺ?
output: The purpose of Allah addressing this verse to the Holy Prophet ﷺ is to make deniers realize the dire consequences of their vanity.

instruction: What is the significance of the verse equating the religions of the Jews and the Christians with Ahwa' (personal desires or individual opinions and baseless conjectures)?
output: The verse equating the religions of the Jews and the Christians with Ahwa' signifies that their denial is not due to lack of convincing arguments and proofs, but is motivated by pride and self-satisfaction.

instruction: What is the only guidance worth the name, according to the verse?
output: The only guidance worth the name is that which comes from Allah, and He has already made it clear enough that Islam is now the only form of "guidance" acceptable to Him.

instruction: What is the main subject of the large section of the Sarah ending with the previous verse?

instruction: What were the trials that Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) was put through by Allah, and what was the purpose of these trials?
output: The trials that Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam) was put through by Allah were a series of tests meant to "nurture" him and reveal his inherent qualities to the world, allowing him to gradually assume his final station as a prophet. The purpose of these trials was to test Ibrahim's aptitude and worthiness for prophethood, as Allah is all-knowing and knows every existent inside out.

instruction: What form did the trials of Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) take, and what were the results of these trials?
output: The "things" or "words" mentioned in the Quran as the trials of Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam) refer to certain divine injunctions. These trials were not like academic tests, nor were they meant to gauge mental capacities or the grasp of mere theories. Instead, they were intended to test the readiness in obeying Allah and the steadfastness in submitting oneself to divine commandments. Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam) succeeded in these trials, and his obedience and steadfastness were rewarded by Allah.

instruction: What essential considerations does the story of Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) and his son Isma'il (علیہ السلام) serve to refute in the context of the Jews' denial of the Holy Prophet (ﷺ)?
output: The story of Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam) and his son Isma'il (علیہ السلاam) serves to refute several essential considerations for the Jews, including the idea that only those of their race can be a guide to humanity and lead the way of prophethood, as well as the claim that the Muslims' orientation (Qiblah) towards the Ka'bah is not the same as that of Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam). The story also suggests that the way of Islam is the Way of Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam), and that the Muslims are his real followers. Additionally, it shows that it is wrong for the Jews to deny the Holy Prophet (ﷺ) merely on account of his not belonging to their race, as Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam) had two sons, Isma'il and Isaac, and he prayed for divine grace to descend on both of them. The superiority enjoyed by the children of Isaac in their own time has now been transferred to the children of Isma'il.

instruction: What was the purpose of the building of the Ka'bah according to the Holy Qur'an?
output: The building of the Ka'bah was to answer the Jews who used to deny the Holy Prophet ﷺ by reminding them that the Ka'bah was built under divine commandment by Prophet Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) with the help of his son Prophet Ismail (علیہ السلام) and thus suggests that the performance of the Hajj and the orientation towards the Ka'bah have both been instituted by divine decree.

instruction: Who were the builders of the Ka'bah mentioned in the Holy Qur'an?
output: The builders of the Ka'bah mentioned in the Holy Qur'an are Prophet Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) and his son Prophet Ismail (علیہ السلام).

instruction: What are the characteristic qualities of the "House of Allah" mentioned in the Holy Qur'an?
output: The characteristic qualities of the "House of Allah" (Ka'bah) mentioned in the Holy Qur'an are: it is a place to which people return again and again and it has been made a place of peace. The whole of the Haram has been made a place of peace, meaning that people have been forbidden from shedding blood or taking revenge within these precincts.

instruction: Who was Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) and what was his prayer always about?
output: Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) was a prophet of Allah who always carried out the commandments of Allah without losing a moment, and was ready to make all kinds of sacrifices in His way, whether they involved worldly goods, or wife and children, or his own likes and dislikes. His prayer was always for the well-being of his family in this world as much as in the other.

instruction: What does the word Rabb رَبّ signify in the Islamic context and why is it a proper mode of praying to Allah?
output: Rabb رَبّ lexically signifies One who gives nurture in the Islamic context. It is a proper mode of praying to Allah because this form of address in itself draws the mercy and grace of Allah on the man who is praying.

instruction: What did Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) pray for when he prayed for the well-being of his family?
output: Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) prayed for the barren desert where he had left his family under divine commandment to be turned into a city, so that his wife and son should not feel lonely, and that their daily needs should be easily satisfied. He also prayed for this city to be made "a place of peace" and to be provided with fruits.

instruction: What quality of Sayyidna Ibrahim is shown in Verse 127?
output: The quality shown in Verse 127 is his humility and recognition of Allah's Majesty.

instruction: Where did Sayyidna Ibrahim leave to build the House of Allah?
output: Sayyidna Ibrahim left the fertile land of Syria to build the House of Allah in the barren desert.

instruction: What prayer did Sayyidna Ibrahim offer when he started building the Ka'bah?
output: Sayyidna Ibrahim prayed to Allah to accept this deed, recognizing that it was only with Allah's grace that he was capable of making the effort.

instruction: What was the prayer of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) regarding his son and descendants?
output: Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) prayed to Allah to make him and his son obedient to His commandments and to His Will, and among the descendants of Ibrahim (peace be upon him) there has always been a group of people obedient to Allah and firm in the Straight Path.

instruction: What is the significance of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) including his descendants in his prayer?
output: Including his descendants in his prayer shows that the "men of Allah" who never hesitate in sacrificing themselves and their children in the way of Allah, yet love them deeply. They know what the proper requirements of parental love are, and how they should be fulfilled, being more anxious as to what happens to them in the other world than in this.

instruction: What does the word Manasik (the plural of Mansik) signify in Verse 128, and what was the substance of the last part of the prayer?
output: The word Manasik signifies the different actions involved in the performance of the Hajj, and also the different places where the rites are performed. The substance of the last part of the prayer is that Sayyidna Ibrahim (peace be upon him) wanted the rites of the Hajj to be explained and their locations to be indicated. The verb employed in this connection is Arina - "show us." Now, seeing is done through the eyes, and also through the heart. So, the different locations of the rites were shown to him through the Archangel Jibra'il (peace be upon him) and the injunctions regarding the Hajj were explained in detail.

instruction: What is the superiority of the religion of Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) and how is it demonstrated in the text?
output: The superiority of the religion of Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) is demonstrated through the honor and glory bestowed upon him by Allah in this world and the next. In this world, Ibrahim's unwavering faith was evident in his resilience against Nimrod's persecution, and his transformation from the fire into a garden. In the next world, Allah has granted him an exalted station.

instruction: What does the phrase in Arabic text of Verse 130 mean and how can it be translated into English?
output: The relevant phrase in the Arabic text of Verse 130 can be translated into English in three ways: (a) Such a man is stupid in himself, (b) he has besotted himself, and allowed himself to become stupid, (c) he is ignorant of his own self.

instruction: What is the significance of the Ibrahimic Way in the text and how does it compare to the religions of Jews and Christians?
output: The Ibrahimic Way is the religion that is faithful to the Abrahamic Tradition and is the only religion that is the essential and integral religion of "Nature". It is the religion that is common to all the prophets and refutes the claims of Jews and Christians to be the followers of this religion.

instruction: What was the basic principle of the religion of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) as defined in this verse?
output: The basic principle of the religion of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) is total obedience and willing submission to Allah, which is signified by the word 'Islam'.

instruction: What is the essence of all the divine books, all the Shari'ahs, and the teachings of all the prophets as per this verse?
output: The essence of all the divine books, all the Shari'ahs, and the teachings of all the prophets is turning away from one's desires in order to obey divine commandments, and giving up individual opinion in order to submit oneself to divine guidance.

instruction: What is the title given to Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) in the verse, and what does it signify?
output: The title given to Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) is Khalilullah خلیلُ اللہ, which signifies the Friend of Allah. This signifies the stage of spiritual development where one's fears and hopes are bound with Allah, and with no one else. This is the essence of Tawhid توحید (the realization of unicity).

instruction: Why were the descendants of Prophet Ibrahim and Prophet Ya'qub specifically mentioned in the Quran?
output: They were specifically mentioned to emphasize that love for one's progeny is compatible with the station of prophethood. Prophets, like Ibrahim and Ya'qub, not only cared for the spiritual well-being of their children but also prayed for their worldly happiness.

instruction: What is the difference between a prophet's and an ordinary person's affection towards their children?
output: Prophets consider the eternal wealth of faith and good deeds, or in other words, Islam, as the only thing that counts, and they wish and strive to transmit this to their descendants. In contrast, ordinary people consider only the good things of this world to be worthwhile and wish to leave as much of these to their children as they can.

instruction: What is the principle that parents should follow in terms of their children's spiritual health?
output: Parents should first of all take care of the spiritual health of their own children, as their children are likely to accept counsel more easily and thoroughly, and may later be of great help in efforts made in the service of Islam. Furthermore, the easiest and the most effective way of transmitting the Truth to a whole people is through the head of each family taking upon himself the responsibility of teaching and training the members of his family. This localized and decentralized method distributes the responsibility over a large number of individuals, and teaching the families separately amounts finally to teaching the society, as a whole.

instruction: What does the Islamic text say about the effects of good and bad deeds of one's forefathers?
output: The Islamic text states that the good deeds of one's forefathers will not suffice if one has not been performing good deeds oneself, and vice versa, one shall not have to suffer for the misdeeds of one's forefathers if one's own account is clean.

instruction: What does the Islamic text say about the children of mushrikeen (associators) and Kafirin (infidels)?
output: The Islamic text states that if children of mushrikeen and Kafirin die before coming of age, they shall not be punished in the other world on account of the disbelief of their parents.

instruction: What does the Islamic text refute about the Jews' claim?
output: The Islamic text refutes the claim of the Jews that they would go to Paradise irrespective of what they had been doing, due to the good deeds of their forefathers.

instruction: What was the religion of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) and what is the present form of it?
output: The religion of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) was Islam, and its present form is Islam.

instruction: What are the basic tenets of the religion of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) that Muslims believe in?
output: Muslims believe in Allah, in the guidance which He has sent them through the Holy Prophet ﷺ, in all the prophets sent by Allah from time to time, in the belief that no prophet is superior to another, in the belief that the Shari'ah of all the prophets mentioned in the verse were instituted by Allah Himself, but they have now been abrogated, and in the belief that they ultimately obey Allah alone and submit themselves totally to Him.

instruction: What is the significance of the term "Asbat" in the context of Islam?
output: The term "Asbat" refers to the twelve tribes of the progeny of Sayyidna Ya`qub (علیہ السلام) (Jacob), as he had twelve sons, and the offspring of each son formed a tribe. This term is used to highlight the blessing that Allah bestowed upon his seed.

instruction: What does the Islamic text refer to as the "colouring of Allah"?
output: The "colouring of Allah" refers to unalloyed worship of Allah and total submission to Him, which essentially defines Islam or any authentic religion.

instruction: What is the symbolic association of a religion with the name of a prophet according to the Islamic text?
output: The association of a religion with the name of a prophet can only be symbolic, according to the Islamic text, as it is the religion of Allah.

instruction: What is the deeper meaning of the word "Sibghah" or "colouring" in the Islamic text?
output: The deeper meaning of "Sibghah" or "colouring" in the Islamic text is that the signs of genuine and pure 'Iman (faith) should shine through the face, movements, habits, and behavior of a Muslim, serving as a commandment to dye oneself in the "colouring of Allah" outwardly and inwardly.

instruction: What are the claims of the Jews and the Christians about the prophets in Abraham's lineage that have been refuted in this section of the Surah?
output: The Jews and the Christians asserted that the prophets in Abraham's lineage were either Jews or Christians, and that they were the chosen people with the exclusive privilege of being sent straight to Paradise.

instruction: What principle was established in this section of the Surah regarding the Jews, Christians, and Muslims on the Day of Judgment?
output: The principle established is that Allah will assess the Jews, Christians, and Muslims according to what each has believed in and how each has been behaving.

instruction: What word in the text is usually rendered into English as "sincerity" and Mukhlis مخلص as "sincere"?
output: The word is Ikhlas اخلاص .

instruction: What is the Qiblah, and why does it have significance in Islam?
output: The Qiblah is the direction to which a Muslim turns during prayer. It is significant as it provides a unifying principle for Muslims, symbolizing their collective worship of Allah, and reinforcing their spiritual brotherhood.

instruction: What is the history of the Qiblah in Islam?
output: The first Qiblah was the Ka'bah in Makkah, established by Sayyidna Adam. After the Deluge, it was rebuilt by Sayyidna Ibrahim and Sayyidna Ismail. Later, the Baytul-Maqdis in Jerusalem served as the Qiblah for the Hebrew prophets. During the time of the Holy Prophet ﷺ, the Qiblah was the Baytul-Maqdis for 16 or 17 months, and was then changed to the Ka'bah.

instruction: How does the Quran describe the concept of adopting an orientation?
output: The Quran explains that the Ka'bah or the Baytul-Maqdis does not possess any exclusive merit in being the Qiblah, and that it is the divine commandment that gives it the distinction. Turning towards the chosen Qiblah constitutes a meritorious act, signifying one's obedience to divine commandment and total submission to the will of Allah.

instruction: What is the new Qiblah (orientation) instituted by a divine commandment for Muslims, and is it going to be abrogated?
output: The new Qiblah for Muslims is the Baytullah (Kaaba in Mecca) and it is not going to be abrogated.

instruction: What was the Qiblah of the Jews and Christians, and why do they reject each other's Qiblah?
output: The Jews adopted Baytul-Maqdis (Temple Mount in Jerusalem) as their Qiblah, while the Christians chose the East. Each group rejects the Qiblah of the other due to their stubbornness and unwillingness to accept the new injunction regarding the Qiblah of Muslims.

instruction: Why is it impossible for the Holy Prophet to follow the desires of the People of the Book and accept their Qiblah as his own?
output: It is impossible for the Holy Prophet to follow the desires of the People of the Book and accept their Qiblah as his own because doing so would be disobeying divine commandments, acting upon personal desires, and ignoring the new Islamic injunctions that have replaced the earlier ones. Furthermore, being a prophet, he is essentially sin-less and cannot be among the unjust.

instruction: What did the People of the Book already know about the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) according to their own Sacred Books?
output: The People of the Book already knew that the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was the promised Last Prophet, as foretold in their own Sacred Books.

instruction: What is the simile used in the Qur'an to describe the Jews and Christians' recognition of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)?
output: The simile used is that of a father recognizing his own son without any doubt or ambiguity.

instruction: What was the dishonest behavior of the People of the Book towards the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) according to the verses?
output: The People of the Book denied the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) as the Last Prophet despite knowing him to be so, and some even tried to conceal this truth from others.

instruction: What is the Qiblah and why is it of significance for the Islamic Ummah?
output: The Qiblah is the religious orientation or the direction Muslims face during their prayers. It is significant for the Islamic Ummah because every traditional community has a Qiblah of its own, and the Islamic Ummah has been divinely appointed a Qiblah peculiar to it.

instruction: What is the third reason given in verse 150 for the change in the Qiblah?
output: The third reason given in verse 150 for the change in the Qiblah is that the Torah and the evangel had indicated that the promised Last Prophet would have the Ka'bah as his Qiblah. If the Muslims continued to pray with the Baytul-Maqdis as their Qiblah, the opponents of Islam would have found an argument to justify their denial of the Holy Prophet.

instruction: What is the significance of the repetition of words and phrases in the Holy Qur'an, according to Maulana Muhammad Idris?
output: The repetition of words and phrases in the Holy Qur'an, according to Maulana Muhammad Idris, is a regular mode of expression common to all the Sacred Books of the world. It is meant to emphasize the significance of the occasion or commandment, and each phrase, in being repeated, acquires a new implication.

instruction: What is Dhikr ذکر and what is its relation to the heart?
output: Dhikr ذکر is the act of remembrance of Allah, and it essentially pertains to the heart. In a tangible sense, the oral recitation of a Divine Name or a verse of the Holy Qur'an is also considered as Dhikr ذکر. The heart and the tongue work together in this regard.

instruction: What does the recitation of a Divine Name without the heart's engagement mean according to Rumi?
output: According to Rumi, the recitation of a Divine Name without engaging the heart is like mechanically repeating it while thinking of cows and donkeys.

instruction: What is the significance of Dhikr ذکر in Islamic teachings?
output: The significance of Dhikr ذکر in Islamic teachings is innumerable. When a Muslim remembers Allah by obeying His commandments, He too remembers him, granting pardon and rewards. It is also interpreted as obedience and submission to Allah.

instruction: What does the text discuss about the nature of the world?
output: The text discusses that the world is a place of hardships and labour, a place of ordeal.

instruction: What is the significance of the severe test man is put to by Allah?
output: The severe test man is put to by Allah is a sign that the world is a place of hardships and labour, it will not, therefore, amount to impatience if one does regard such accidents as either strange or a remote chance.

instruction: What is the formula of peace in hardship that the patient people used to recite?
output: The formula of peace in hardship that the patient people used to recite is "We belong to Allah and to Him we are to return" (INNA LILLAHI WAINNA ILAYHI RAJI'OON).

instruction: What is the significance of the Ka'bah in Islam?
output: The Ka'bah is considered the central place of worship in Islam, which was made a sanctuary and a center of divine worship as ordained by Allah. It serves as the Qiblah (direction of Salah or prayer) for Muslims and is the objective in the performance of Hajj and `Umrah.

instruction: What is the significance of the hills Safa and Marwah in Islam?
output: According to the Qur'an, the hills Safa and Marwah, which are adjacent to the Ka'bah in Makkah, are tangible signs from Allah. During the Hajj and `Umrah, pilgrims walk briskly between them, an act known as Sayee, which was a practice even in the Jahiliyyah.

instruction: What is the status of the practice of Sayee in Islam?
output: Sayee, the practice of walking briskly between Safa and Marwah, is considered a necessary (wajib) or obligatory part of the Hajj and `Umrah according to different Islamic schools of thought. The practice is commendable (mustahabb) according to Imam Ahmad.

instruction: What did people of the Book do that concealed the truth regarding the Prophethood of the Holy Prophet?
output: People of the Book concealed the truth about the prophethood of the Holy Prophet by not recognizing him as they would recognize their own sons. A group of them deliberately hid the truth while they knew it.

instruction: What is the ultimate fate of people who conceal the truth and persist in their effort, according to the verses in the text?
output: The ultimate fate of those who conceal the truth and persist in their effort is the curse of Allah Almighty and His entire creation.

instruction: What is forbidden as per the injunctions derived from the verse 159 in the text?
output: It is forbidden to conceal knowledge which must be disclosed and disseminated widely. One should not try to explain religious injunctions and rulings if one does not possess the sound knowledge. Answers to religious questions which are intricate and deeply involved should not be offered lest they fall a prey to some misunderstanding.

instruction: What is the Islamic view on cursing an individual?
output: It is not permissible to curse an individual about whom it is not certain that they are to die in a state of infidelity.

instruction: What do commentators al-Jassas, al-Qurtubi, and others suggest regarding the act of cursing an individual?
output: They suggest that it is not permissible to curse an individual by name if it is not certain that they will die as an infidel.

instruction: What is the ruling on cursing an infidel about whom it is certain they will die as one?
output: It is technically correct, if cursed without any particularization, but it is disallowed if the target is a specific individual about whom it is not certain that they will die as an infidel.

instruction: What is Tauhid, the cardinal principle of Muslim faith?
output: Tauhid is the belief in the oneness and uniqueness of Allah, the one and only God, in the wider sense.

instruction: In what three aspects does the text discuss the oneness of Allah?
output: The text discusses the oneness of Allah in His state of being, in claiming the right of being worshipped, and in being free of any conceivable composition.

instruction: Why was the idea of a single God perplexing to the mushrikin of Arabia?
output: The mushrikin of Arabia were puzzled by the idea of a single God because they couldn't fathom how one object of worship could cater to the wide world. They required proof to support this claim, which was provided in the Quranic verses.

instruction: What is the subject of the present verse mentioned in the Islamic text?
output: The severity of the punishment in the Hereafter.

instruction: What will happen when the polytheists' leaders disown them as their votaries?
output: The leaders and the led will witness the punishment, and their bonds of leading and following would be snapped apart.

instruction: What is the punishment for the grave sin of associating partners with Allah?
output: To remain in the Fire for ever.

instruction: What is the root word حلّا (halla) in the phrase "halalan tayyiban" and what does it literally mean?
output: The root word حلّا (halla) means 'to open a knot'. It literally means that a restriction has been removed when something is made halal.

instruction: What is the meaning of the word طَیّب (tayyib) and what are the twin aspects it covers?
output: The word طَیّب (tayyib) means 'good' and it covers the twin aspects of being lawful, permissible or halal, and being naturally desirable.

instruction: What does the term خُطووَات (khutuwat) refer to in Islamic context, and what does it signify when used in relation to Shaytan?
output: In Islamic context, the term خُطووَات (khutuwat) refers to the distance between the two feet when striding. When used in relation to Shaytan, it signifies Satanic deeds.

instruction: What does the word 'su' in the Arabic phrase السُّوءِ وَالْفَحْشَاءِ mean?
output: The word 'su' means something which bothers somebody good and reasonable.

instruction: What does the word 'fahsha' in the Arabic phrase السُّوءِ وَالْفَحْشَاءِ cover?
output: The word 'fahsha' covers what is immodest.

instruction: What does the phrase إِنَّمَا يَأْمُرُ‌كُم (innama ya'murukum) mean in the Islamic text?
output: The phrase إِنَّمَا يَأْمُرُ‌كُم (innama ya'murukum) means instigating a suggestion in the heart. The meaning can be seen more clearly in a hadith from the blessed Companion `Abdullah ibn Masud ؓ who said that the Holy Prophet ﷺ instigated a suggestion in the heart.

instruction: What does the Quranic verse (170) censure regarding the followers of their forefathers?
output: The Quranic verse (170) censures the blind following of forefathers, which lacks reason and guidance, as their forefathers did not understand much about the true faith nor were they blessed with guidance given by their Lord.

instruction: What is the permissible aspect of following the forefathers mentioned in the text of the Qur'an?
output: The permissible aspect of following the forefathers mentioned in the text of the Qur'an is following a mujtahid alim who has the great expertise of a mujtahid so that he can, by analogical deduction, arrive at rulings from the texts of the Qur'an and Sunnah.

instruction: What is the prohibition of following forefathers mentioned in verse 170 refer to?
output: The prohibition of following forefathers mentioned in verse 170 refers to following them in false beliefs and deeds. The aspect of following correct beliefs and good deeds is not included here as it has been very clearly projected in Surah Yusuf.

instruction: What warning is given to the believers in Verse 172 of the Quran?
output: The believers are warned against falling into the same error as the mushrikin, of declaring good and permissible things as prohibited.

instruction: What is the significance of eating halal and haram in Islamic teachings?
output: Eating halal generates inner light, creates a distaste for evil deeds, leads towards high morals, and creates a state in which the heart welcomes `ibadah. Eating haram, on the other hand, promotes evil instincts, kills the taste of `ibadah, and makes prayers ineffective.

instruction: What is the importance of living by the halal and haram in prayer answered?
output: Living by the halal helps the chances of a prayer being answered, while living by the haram kills those chances. The Prophet has said that there are many people who stretch their hands in prayer yet haram is what they eat, drink, and wear, so how then could they hope to have their prayers answered?

instruction: What does the restrictive particle 'innama' mean in the context of the given Islamic text?
output: 'Innama' means 'only' or 'nothing else' in the given Islamic text, and it signifies that Allah Almighty has forbidden only those things which have been mentioned later, and nothing else is forbidden.

instruction: What are the four things that have been made unlawful (haram) in verse 173 of the given Islamic text?
output: The four things that have been made unlawful (haram) in verse 173 of the given Islamic text are: a. Dead animal (Maitah مَیتَہ) b. Blood (Dam دم) c. The flesh of swine (Lahm al-khinzir لحم الخنزیر) d. An animal on which the name of anyone other than Allah has been called (Wa ma uhilla bihi lighayrillah وَمَا أُهِلَّ بِهِ لِغَيْرِ‌ اللَّـه).

instruction: What is the meaning of the 'restriction' in the given Islamic text, and how does it explain the negation of 'there is nothing haram حرام except the few things mentioned later on'?
output: The 'restriction' in the given Islamic text is not to be taken in the absolute sense but is relative, especially in opposition to the polytheistic beliefs. It refers to those particular animals only which the polytheists of Makkah took as halal حلال or haram حرام on the basis of their pagan beliefs, and they are being told here as to how they do not stay away from certain animals which have been declared haram حرام for them, while, at the same time, they stay away from those that are halal حلال in the sight of Allah.

instruction: What is the significance of the verses that follow in the Islamic text?
output: The verses that follow in the Islamic text discuss intangible deeds that have been made unlawful, referring to evil deeds, inner and outer.

instruction: What is the warning given to the religious scholars in the Islamic text?
output: The warning given to the religious scholars in the Islamic text is to keep away from giving out false verdicts in favor of people who bribe them and to never fall short in disclosing the true injunctions of Allah for any material reason or vested interest of their own.

instruction: What is the punishment for people who conceal the contents of the Book of Allah and collect insignificant worldly gains?
output: People who conceal the contents of the Book of Allah and collect insignificant worldly gains are simply eating fire, and on the Day of Judgment, they will not speak to Allah affectionately, nor will He purify them by forgiving their sins. Their punishment will be terrible, and they are the kind of people who, during their mortal life, chose to abandon guidance and adopt error. They missed forgiveness and became deserving of punishment. They must be very courageous in that they are all set to go into Hell.

instruction: What is 'al-wasiyyah' in Islamic context?
output: 'Al-wasiyyah' is the will or bequest in Islamic context.

instruction: What was the rule for shares in inheritance in early Islam?
output: In early Islam, the rule for shares in inheritance was that a dying person could make a will within the one-third of inheritance, leaving behind in the name of his parents and relatives in whatever proportion he chose.

instruction: What were the three aspects of making a will in Islamic context?
output: The three aspects of making a will in Islamic context were: 1) No shares except those of children are fixed for any other inheritors in what is being left by the dying person. These are to be determined through the will made by him. 2) Making a will for such relatives is obligatory on the dying person. 3) Making a will for more than one-third of the inheritance is not permissible.

instruction: What does the term Sawm mean in Islamic law?
output: In Islamic law, Sawm means to abstain from eating, drinking, and sexual intercourse from dawn to sunset with the intention to fast.

instruction: What is the significance of fasting in Islam?
output: Fasting is an 'ibadah, an act of worship in Islam, regarded as one of its pillars and signs. The merits of fasting are numerous.

instruction: Why was fasting enjoined upon the earlier communities?
output: Fasting was enjoined upon the earlier communities to show its importance and to encourage Muslims, as it was faced by a large number of people in the past. It also indicates that like Salah, fasting has been enjoined upon every Ummah of every prophet without exception.

instruction: What is the meaning of the word 'sick' used in the context of fasting in the Qur'an?
output: The word 'sick' used in the context of fasting in the Qur'an refers to a person who cannot fast without an unbearable hardship or has a strong apprehension that his illness will be aggravated.

instruction: What is the meaning of 'a journey' in the Qur'anic text as it pertains to fasting?
output: 'A journey' in the Qur'anic text as it pertains to fasting means a person who leaves home and goes out for a considerably longer duration, not just five or ten miles away from home. The precise duration of this journey has not been mentioned in the words of the Holy Qur'an, but according to the consensus of the Muslim jurists, it is considered to be what can be covered in three days by walking in three daily stages.

instruction: Who is entitled to the exemption of fasting during travel?
output: A traveller who leaves home and covers a considerably longer duration of distance, not just five or ten miles away from home, is entitled to the exemption of fasting during travel. This exemption is valid until the travel continues, but if the traveler stops in between to rest or take care of something, he does not cut off his onward travel in the absolute sense, unless his stay be for a considerable period of time. The later-day jurists have set this considerable period of time at fifteen days.

instruction: What is the significance of the month of Ramadan according to Islamic tradition?
output: The month of Ramadan is considered highly significant in Islamic tradition as it is the month in which the Qur'an was revealed.

instruction: In which night of Ramadan was the Qur'an revealed according to Islamic tradition?
output: The Night of Power (Laylatul Qadr) on the 24th night of Ramadan, according to the hadith.

instruction: Who is obligated to fast during the month of Ramadan according to the verse cited in the text?
output: Any Muslim who is sane, pubert, resident, and well-purified from all impurities is obligated to fast during the month of Ramadan.

instruction: Why is it important for servants of Allah to recognize Allah's closeness to them?
output: It is important for servants of Allah to recognize Allah's closeness to them so that they can understand that Allah hears and answers their prayers, which may encourage them to obey His commands.

instruction: What is the significance of the statement "The prayer made by one who is fasting at the time of his iftar is accepted"?
output: This statement suggests that the prayer made by one who is fasting at the time of iftar (breaking their fast) is accepted by Allah, which encourages people to be more mindful and grateful during their fast.

instruction: What advice does the verse "I am near" give regarding prayer?
output: The verse "I am near" hints that prayer should be made slowly and quietly; raising one's voice while praying is not desirable.

instruction: What is the verse from the Quran that discusses the injunctions of fasting, including the practice of I'tikaf?
output: The verse is "Uhilla lakum 'It is made lawful for you' which discusses the injunctions of fasting, including the practice of I'tikaf."

instruction: What was the rule concerning eating, drinking, and marital intimacy during the early days of fasting in Ramadan, and why was it changed?
output: The rule during the early days of fasting in Ramadan was that one could not eat, drink, or have marital intimacy if one had taken a post-iftar nap. This rule was changed because it caused difficulties for some Companions, and the present verse was revealed, which established a new rule that allowed eating, drinking, and marital intimacy, even after getting up from the post-iftar nap.

instruction: What is the meaning of the Quranic word "rafath," and what does the Muslim Ummah agree on regarding its meaning in this verse?
output: The literal meaning of the Quranic word "rafath" is sexual intercourse, and there is a total agreement of the Muslim Ummah that, at this place, it means sexual intercourse.

instruction: What is the subject matter of the verse mentioned in the text?
output: The verse forbids the acquisition and use of Haram or unlawful wealth or property.

instruction: What is the purpose of fasting, as suggested by the text?
output: The real purpose behind fasting, an act of worship, is to make man get used to abstaining from what is lawful for him.

instruction: What happens if a person breaks his fast with what is Haram?
output: If a person goes through the rigours of fasting throughout the day but ends up breaking his fast in the evening with what is Haram, his fast will only find his fast unacceptable in the sight of Allah.

instruction: What are the six injunctions mentioned in the text that relate to even retaliation, bequest, fasting, I` tikaf, abstention from the unlawful, and Hajj and Jihad?
output: The six injunctions mentioned in the text are: even retaliation, bequest, fasting, I` tikaf (retreat in worship), abstention from the unlawful, Hajj (pilgrimage), and Jihad (holy war).

instruction: What is the custom of jahiliyyah that is erased in the text?
output: The custom of jahiliyyah that is erased in the text is the custom of entering houses from the back while in Ihram (a state of consecration for Hajj or Umrah).

instruction: What is the center-piece of all principles mentioned in the text?
output: The center-piece of all principles mentioned in the text is that people must keep fearing Allah so that they can hope to have the best of both the worlds.

instruction: What is Jihad according to the Islamic text?
output: Jihad is to fight in the way of Allah.

instruction: What does the Islamic text state about the prohibition of fighting against disbelievers prior to the emigration to Madinah?
output: The Islamic text states that it was a fact that Jihad and fighting against disbelievers was prohibited prior to the emigration to Madinah.

instruction: Who is it permissible to kill during Jihad according to the Islamic text?
output: According to the Islamic text, it is permissible to kill only those who come to fight against Muslims during Jihad. The text mentions that it is not permissible to kill women, children, the very old, the physically handicapped, and those who are not fighters such as, religious people, priests and monks, and laborers who work for disbelievers and do not go to fight along with them.

instruction: What was the problem the blessed Companions faced when they accompanied the Holy Prophet on his qada'Umrah in 7 A.H.?
output: The Companions had a problem because they feared that the disbelievers of Makkah might start fighting, which would have taken place within the sacred precincts of Makkah, which is not permissible in Islam.

instruction: How did the Muslims justify fighting a defensive battle during a 'sacred month' if the disbelievers of Makkah started fighting against them?
output: The verse 194 was revealed to answer this doubt. The answer is that, the way a state of defence grants an exception to observing the sanctity of the Haram of Makkah, in the same manner, it allows an exception to observing the sanctity of the 'sacred months' also.

instruction: Why did the Muslims consider the month of Dhul-Qa'dah as a 'sacred month'?
output: The Muslims considered the month of Dhul-Qa'dah as a 'sacred month' because it was one of the four known as the 'sacred months' wherein fighting anyone anywhere was not permissible.

instruction: What are the four sacred months in Islam?
output: The four sacred months in Islam are Dhul-Qa'dah, Dhul-Hijjah, Muharram, and the fourth is Rajab.

instruction: Why were the four sacred months considered unlawful for fighting even before Islam?
output: The four sacred months were considered unlawful for fighting even before Islam because, like the disbelievers of Makkah, they were considered sacred and fighting in these months was considered unlawful.

instruction: Can fighting be initiated in the sacred months?
output: According to the consensus of the Ummah, the unlawfulness of initiating fighting in the sacred months was abrogated, but it is still preferable not to initiate fighting in these months without the need to defend.

instruction: What is the theme of the verses 177-195 in the Quran?
output: The theme of the verses 177-195 in the Quran is 'righteousness'.

instruction: What does the expression 'put yourselves into destruction' mean according to Abu Ayyub al-Ansari?
