instruction: What did Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) pray for his wife and son when he could no more see them from behind the hill on his journey to Syria?
output: He prayed that they be blessed with peace and provided with fruits.

instruction: What was the significance of the prayer made by Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam) that they may establish Salah?
output: The prayer was that they become particular and punctual with their Salah as it is a cumulative receptacle of everything good and blissful in life.

instruction: What does the term 'afidah' in the prayer of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) mean and what is its significance?
output: The term 'afidah' is the plural of 'fuwad' (heart) and it means 'make hearts of a number of people yearn towards them.' It was used in the prayer to reduce inconvenience as it would have caused if all the people of the world converged on Makkah.

instruction: What is the significance of the word 'Qatiran' in the Islamic text?

instruction: Who were the first addressees of the Glorious Qur'an and the Holy Prophet ﷺ?
output: The first addressees of the Glorious Qur'an and the Holy Prophet ﷺ were Banu Ismail, the children of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him).

instruction: What is the purpose of the verse "وَلَا تَحْسَبَنَّ اللَّـهَ غَافِلًا" (And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers are doing) in the Islamic text?
output: The purpose of the verse "وَلَا تَحْسَبَنَّ اللَّـهَ غَافِلًا" (And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers are doing) in the Islamic text is to remind every negligent person, including the Prophet ﷺ himself and others in the community, that Allah is aware of their actions, even if they are deceived into thinking otherwise by their own negligence or shaitan.

instruction: What is the purpose of the postponement of sudden punishment for the unjust people in the Islamic text?
output: The postponement of sudden punishment for the unjust people is not any better for them, as they will ultimately be seized in the great punishment of Qiyamah and Akhirah.

instruction: What is the significance of the 'Akhirah (life to come) mentioned in the text?
output: The 'Akhirah mentioned in the text refers to the life to come, where the unjust and the wrong-doing will experience a horrendous punishment.

instruction: What does the verse "لِيَوْمٍ تَشْخَصُ فِيهِ الْأَبْصَارُ‌" mean?

instruction: What is the message conveyed in the above text?

instruction: What is the nature of Allah as portrayed in the text?
output: Allah is Mighty and the Lord of Retribution.

instruction: What happens to the earth and skies on the Day of Qiyamah according to the text?

instruction: What does the verse "يَوْمَ تُبَدَّلُ الْأَرْ‌ضُ غَيْرَ‌ الْأَرْ‌ضِ وَالسَّمَاوَاتُ ۖ وَبَرَ‌زُوا لِلَّـهِ الْوَاحِدِ الْقَهَّارِ‌" mean?
output: This verse refers to the day of Qiyamah when the earth and the sky will be transformed or changed into another earth and sky.

instruction: What will the earth and the sky be transformed into according to the Hadith narrations?
output: According to Hadith narrations, the whole earth will be transformed into a levelled surface having no house, tree, mountain, and mound blocking the view, nor shall there remain any cave and abyss.

instruction: What does the statement "لَّا تَرَ‌ىٰ فِيهَا عِوَجًا وَلَا أَمْتًا" mean?
output: This statement means that on the day of Qiyamah, things will not remain the way they are. Roads and pathways we see today wind their way past buildings and mountains negotiating all sorts of twists and turns on surfaces high and low. This will change, and the whole thing would turn into flat, unobstructed ground.

instruction: What does the Qur'an describe as happening on the Day of Qiyamah?
output: The Qur'an describes that on the Day of Qiyamah, the earth will be transformed into some other earth, and the skies as well. All creation will appear before Allah, the One, the All-Dominant.

instruction: What does the Qur'an mean by the earth and the sky being turned into some other earth and sky?
output: The Qur'an may mean that the earth and the sky will undergo a change in their distinctive characteristics and appearances. instruction: What does Hadith suggest about the earth surface of the Day of Qiyamah?

instruction: What does the statement "يَوْمَ تُبَدَّلُ الْأَرْضُ غَيْرَ‌ الْأَرْضِ وَالسَّمَاوَاتُ ۖ وَبَرَ‌زُوا لِلَّـهِ الْوَاحِدِ الْقَهَّارِ‌" mean, according to the text?

instruction: What does the verse "يَوْمَ تُبَدَّلُ الْأَرْ‌ضُ غَيْرَ‌ الْأَرْ‌ضِ وَالسَّمَاوَاتُ ۖ وَبَرَ‌زُوا لِلَّـهِ الْوَاحِدِ الْقَهَّارِ‌" mean?

instruction: What does the verse "يَوْمَ تُبَدَّلُ الْأَرْ‌ضُ غَيْرَ‌ الْأَرْ‌ضِ وَالسَّمَاوَاتُ ۖ وَبَرَ‌زُوا لِلَّـهِ الْوَاحِدِ الْقَهَّارِ‌" mean?

instruction: What is the significance of the change in the earth and the sky as per the verse "يَوْمَ تُبَدَّلُ الْأَرْ‌ضُ غَيْرَ‌ الْأَرْ‌ضِ وَالسَّمَاوَاتُ ۖ وَبَرَ‌زُوا لِلَّـهِ الْوَاحِدِ الْقَهَّارِ‌"?
output: This act of changing the earth and the sky could also be taken to mean that another set of the earth and the sky would be made in the place of the present ones.

instruction: In the Hadith reported in the Musnad of Ahmad and Tafsir Ibn Jarir, as narrated by Sayyidna Anas ؓ, what is said about the ground of Al-Mahshar (the plain of Resurrection)?

instruction: What is the difference between a disbeliever's approach towards life and a believer's approach towards life, according to the text?
output: A disbeliever's approach towards life is to focus solely on eating and drinking and long-drawn material plans while being heedless to death and the 'Akhirah (life to come). A believer, on the other hand, also takes care of economic needs and future plans, but is mindful of death and the 'Akhirah, carefully ensuring that everything they do is Halal or Haram (permissible or forbidden).

instruction: What are the four signs of being unfortunate, according to the Hadith narrated by the Prophet ﷺ?
output: The four signs of being unfortunate, as per the Hadith, are: (1) Not being able to shed tears when ashamed of acts of negligence and sin, (2) hard-heartedness, (3) fanciful hopes and plans for the future, and (4) the greed for worldly things.

instruction: What is the significance of the long-drawn plans and projections mentioned in the text, and what are they not included in?
output: The long-drawn plans and projections mentioned in the text refer to the engrossing love and materialistic greed without concern for death and 'Akhirah. They are not included in plans made to achieve religious objectives or those made to guard the future interests of a people or country, as these are considered a form of concern for 'Akhirah itself.

instruction: What does the phrase "ila bi al-l aqq" mean in the context of the text?
output: "ila bi al-l aqq" means the decision to send down punishment.

instruction: What was the argument made by the disbelievers of Makkah against the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, as per the text?
output: The disbelievers of Makkah argued that if the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ was truly sent by God, he should have brought angels to them to testify his truthfulness.

instruction: What is the interpretation of Maulana Ashraf `Ali Thanavi (ra) regarding the verses in question?
output: Maulana Ashraf `Ali Thanavi (ra) interpreted these verses as stating that the disbelievers' request for an angel to be sent down was impossible because the purpose of sending down angels is to enforce a decision, not to provide evidence of prophethood.

instruction: Who was the person who converted to Islam after a year?
output: The person who was a Jew and attended the debate of Ma'mun, but later converted to Islam after a year is the person who is being referred to in the text.

instruction: What made the person convert to Islam?
output: The person converted to Islam after realizing that the Qur'an was protected and protected by Allah Ta'ala Himself, as compared to the Torah and the Injil which were not protected.

instruction: What does the promise to protect the Qur'an include?
output: The promise to protect the Qur'an includes the protection of both the words of the Qur'an and the meanings of the Qur'an, as they remain protected against alteration or distortion. The meanings of the Qur'an are the same as the Hadith, the sayings and deeds of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), which are used as a medium of instruction for the Muslim community.

instruction: What is the meaning of the word 'shi'a' in the Arabic language?
output: Follower or helper of a person.

instruction: In what context does the term 'shi'a' appear in the given Islamic text?
output: The term 'shi'a' refers to a group that agrees upon particular beliefs and theoretical assumptions.

instruction: What is the message conveyed by Allah sending messengers among every group or sect?
output: Allah sent messengers among every group or sect to make it easy for people to trust them and to make appropriate plans to work for their reform.

instruction: What do the Tafsir authorities Mujahid, Qatadah, Abu Salih and others explain 'buruj' to mean in the present verse?
output: Big stars.

instruction: What does the word 'as-sama' commonly refer to in the Holy Qur'an?
output: Sky and space.

instruction: How do the planets and stars exist according to the verse: "Tabaarakal-ladhee ja'ala fi as-samaa' burujan wa ja'ala feehaa sirajan wa qamaran muneeran" of Surah Al-Furqan (25 :61)?
output: They are in the space, and not in the skies.

instruction: What does the verse "نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَاعِدَ" in Surah Al-Jinn mean?
output: The verse means that the shaitans would enter the atmospheric zone where clouds abound like thieves, would sit there in ambush and hear.

instruction: What is the purpose of Al-Shihab Al-Thagib, meteors or shooting stars, as mentioned in the verses of Surah Al-Jinn?
output: The purpose of Al-Shihab Al-Thagib is to drive the shaitans away so that they would not overhear angels.

instruction: Can it be said that the presence of shooting stars in outer space is nothing new, and this phenomena continues later than that as well?
output: Yes, it can be said that the presence of shooting stars in outer space is nothing new, and this phenomena continues later than that as well. However, before the coming of the Holy Prophet ﷺ, these flames were not employed to serve a particular purpose. However, after his coming, meteoric flames were employed to serve the purpose of shooting the shaitans who would come up to stealthily hear the conversation of angels.

instruction: What does the expression "مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ" mean according to the text?
output: The expression "مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ" means that everything that grows is in a determined measure, not less than that which would have made life difficult, and not too much which would have also brought difficulties of a different nature.

instruction: What does the text imply about the abundance of grains and fruits if they were to grow in excess?
output: The text implies that if grains and fruits were to grow in excess, they would go bad, or their possible storage would be difficult under varying conditions, and if they had to be dumped, then, not much space would be left for such mega dumpings.

instruction: What is the second possible meaning of the expression "مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ" according to the text?
output: The second possible meaning of the expression "مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ" according to the text is that Allah Ta’ ala has created everything that grows in a suitable and proportionate manner which gives it beauty and attraction.

instruction: What are the different interpretations of the words 'al-mustaqdimin' and 'al-musta'khirin' according to Tafsir authorities among the Sahabah and Tabi'in?
output: The different interpretations of the words 'al-mustaqdimin' and 'al-musta'khirin' according to Tafsir authorities among the Sahabah and Tabi'in include: - 'Al-Mustaqdimin' are those born to date, and 'Al-Musta'khirin' are those not born yet (Qatadah and `Ikrimah). - 'Al-Mustaqdimin' means the dead, and 'Al-Musta'khirin' means those alive till now (Ibn `Abbas and Dahhak). - 'Al-Mustaqdimin' signifies good people who came before the appearance of the Ummah of the Holy Prophet ﷺ, and 'Al-Mustakhirin' refers to his Ummah itself (Mujahid). - 'Al-Mustaqdimin' denotes people who obey Allah and do good deeds, while 'Al-Musta'khirin' refers to people who disobey Him and neglect what is good (Hasan and Qatadah). - 'Al-Mustaqdimin' are people who remain ahead in the rows of Salah, or in the front lines of Jihad, and in other righteous deeds - and 'Al-Musta'khirin' are those who remain behind in these deeds of merit (Hasan al-Basri, Said ibn al-Musaiyyab, al-Qurtubi, al-Sha`bi, and others).

instruction: What does Al-Qurtubi say about the verse indicating the merit of performing Salah in the first row, and soon after the time it becomes due?
output: Al-Qurtubi says that this verse indicates the merit of performing Salah in the first row, and soon after the time it becomes due. He also reports the Hadith where the Holy Prophet ﷺ has been reported to have said: 'If people were to find out the enormous merit of calling the Adhan and standing in the first row of Salah, everyone would have started making the effort to necessarily stand in the first row, and when there would remain no space for everybody to stand there, lots would have to be drawn.'

instruction: What does the saying of Sayyidna Ka'b suggest about those praying in the last row?
output: The saying of Sayyidna Ka'b suggests that those praying in the last row may have a sort of merit in that there may perhaps be some righteous servant of Allah praying in the front rows for whose sake, they too may be forgiven.

instruction: What is the spirit (Ruh) in Islamic belief?

instruction: What is the significance of the term أَعْطَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلْقَهُ ثُمَّ هَدَىٰ (He gave everything its form, then provided it with guidance) as compared to the address to the honey bee in Surah Al-Nahl?
output: The term أَعْطَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلْقَهُ ثُمَّ هَدَىٰ (He gave everything its form, then provided it with guidance) is a universal law for all of life forms in the animal and insect kingdom, stated in Surah Taha, 20:50. But, for the honey bee, it was specially said: أَوْحَىٰ رَ‌بُّكَ (And your Lord revealed) which has been designed to indicate that the honey bee has a prominent status among other life forms by virtue of its intelligence, sense, and functional insight.

instruction: What is the unique feature of the honey bee's system of governance?
output: The honey bee's system of governance operates on the principles of human politics and government. The system of this tiny flier's life is managed by one big bee which is the ruling head of all bees. It is her managerial skill and efficient distribution of work that helps run the whole system soundly and safely. The 'queen' itself lays six to twelve thousand eggs in a period of three weeks, and by its size, physique, and demeanor, it is distinguishable from other bees. This 'queen', following the principle of division of labor, appoints its subjects to handle different matters. Some of them serve on guard duty and do not allow some unknown outsider to enter into the hive. Some stand to protect eggs. Some nurture and train baby bees. Some serve as architects and engineers. The compartments of most roofs made by them range between twenty to thirty thousand. Some bees collect and deliver wax to architects which build homes. They procure this wax material from a whitish powder settled upon vegetation. This material is commonly visible on sugarcane. Some of them sit on different kinds of fruits and flowers and suck their juices which turns into honey while in their bellies. This honey is their food and the food of their children. And the same is, for all of us too, the essence of taste and nutrition, and the prescription of medicine and remedy. These different parties discharge their assigned duties very enthusiastically and obey the command of their 'queen' most obediently. If one of them happens to perch on filth, the guards of the hive stop the unwary worker on the outside gate and the 'queen' kills it.

instruction: What is the natural proof of Allah's oneness (Tauhid)?
output: By referring to major manifestations of His knowledge and power and blessings which descend on human beings, Allah's Oneness (Tauhid) is the natural proof.

instruction: What is the subject of focus in the present verse of the Qur'an?
output: The subject of focus in the present verse is Tauhid (Oneness of Allah).

instruction: What is the outcome of the natural distribution of wealth mentioned in the verse?
output: The outcome of this natural distribution of wealth is that he who was given preference in provision and made rich and need-free would never accept to distribute his wealth among his slaves and servants in a way that they too become his equals in wealth.

instruction: What does verse 72 of Surah Ar-Rum indicate about spouses according to the Islamic text?
output: The verse indicates that Allah Ta'ala has created spouses from the same genus, emphasizing mutual familiarity and the stability of the human species through generations.

instruction: What is the significance of the mention of children in the verse "وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّن أَزْوَاجِكُم بَنِينَ وَحَفَدَةً"?
output: The mention of children in this verse implies that the role of the mother in the birth and the creational formation of the child is more pronounced than that of the father.

instruction: What does the verse "وَرَ‌زَقَكُم مِّنَ الطَّيِّبَاتِ" signify about the provision of food for human survival?
output: This verse signifies that once a human child is born, food is needed for its personal survival, and Allah Ta'ala provided this food, ensuring personal survival.

instruction: What does the statement "So, do not coin similarities for Allah -74" clarify about Allah?
output: The statement "So, do not coin similarities for Allah -74" clarifies that Allah is far above similarities and analogies and conjectures and guesses, and that suggesting examples of what has been created and applying them on Allah is unreasonable.

instruction: What wrong assumption does the text suggest people make about Allah?
output: The text suggests that people make the wrong assumption of declaring the highest placed among them, a king and ruler, as similar to Allah, and of taking a cue from the fact that since no king can, all by himself, run the administration of the whole kingdom, the system is run by delegating powers to subordinate ministers and officials who do that on his behalf, and of believing and proposing that there have to be some other objects of worship under the authority of Allah who would help Him out in carrying out His tasks.

instruction: What problem does the text warn against becoming the breeding ground of?
output: The text warns against becoming the breeding ground of all sorts of rejectionist doubts and scruples.

instruction: What is the model of intellectual perfection according to the Islamic text?
output: The model of intellectual perfection is a man who bids justice and teaches what is good.

instruction: What is the model of practical perfection as per the Islamic text?
output: The model of practical perfection is a man who takes the path of moderation and right guidance.

instruction: How do the two men in the Islamic text differ, despite being from the same genus, species, and brotherhood?
output: The two men differ in that one is intellectually and practically perfect, while the other cannot do anything for himself or for others. Despite being from the same origin, they cannot be equal due to their contrasting capabilities and actions.

instruction: What does the verse "لَا تَعْلَمُونَ شَيْئًا (when you knew nothing)" indicate about human knowledge?
output: The verse indicates that human knowledge is not an inherent personal excellence of man, and that man is not born with any knowledge or skill, rather, knowledge is acquired through experiences and learning.

instruction: What are the three primary means of acquiring knowledge according to the verse and its commentary?
output: The three primary means of acquiring knowledge, according to the verse and its commentary, are hearing, seeing, and understanding.

instruction: What is the role of the heart in the process of reasoning and understanding, according to the Qur'an?
output: The Qur'an states that though the brain plays a role in the process of reasoning, yet the real center of knowledge and reason is the heart.

instruction: What does the word 'buyut' mean in the Arabic language?
output: 'Buyut' is a plural noun in Arabic, which means a house where night could be spent.

instruction: What is the real purpose of making a house according to the Qur'an as per Imam Al-Qurtubi's Tafsir?
output: The real purpose of making a house is to provide comfort for the body and peace for the heart.

instruction: What is the artificially imposed addition in houses that can destroy peace and comfort?
output: The artificially imposed additions in houses can destroy comfort and peace, and these become the very agents which destroy comfort and peace.

instruction: What does the Quranic statement "سَرَ‌ابِيلَ تَقِيكُمُ الْحَرَّ" mean?
output: The Quranic statement "سَرَ‌ابِيلَ تَقِيكُمُ الْحَرَّ" means "shirts which protect you from heat".

instruction: Why does the Quran mention only protection from heat in verse 81 of Surah Al-Muddaththir, despite shirts protecting from both heat and cold?
output: The Quran mentions only protection from heat in verse 81 of Surah Al-Muddaththir because it was revealed in Arabia, a hot country, and it speaks by taking Arab habits and needs into account.

instruction: Why does the Quran not mention protection from cold in verse 81 of Surah Al-Muddaththir, despite mentioning it earlier in the same Surah?
output: The Quran does not mention protection from cold in verse 81 of Surah Al-Muddaththir because it has already mentioned provision against cold in an earlier verse (16:5), and it was in view of this earlier mention that only protection from heat has been mentioned here.

instruction: Can the Qur'an be considered an exposition of everything in the context of the religion?
output: Yes, but the interpretation and solution of certain problems that are not explicitly stated in the Qur'an are deduced from the principles of Ijma` (consensus) and Al-Qiyas (analogical deduction following the norms set by the Shari` ah of Islam) or from the Ahadith of the Holy Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: What role do the Ahadith of the Prophet play in providing answers to problems pertaining to the religion?
output: The Ahadith of the Prophet provide clarification to the basic principles, and in the light of these principles, answers to certain problems are deduced.

instruction: How are certain religious rulings deduced when the Qur'an does not explicitly provide answers to all problems?
output: The religious rulings are deduced from the principles of Ijma` (consensus) and Al-Qiyas (analogical deduction following the norms set by the Shari` ah of Islam) or from the Ahadith of the Holy Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: What is the most comprehensive verse of the Holy Qur’an and who said this?
output: The most comprehensive verse of the Holy Qur’an is: “Indeed, Allah commands you to do justice, to be good, and to give relatives their due.” This is stated by Sayyidna ` Abdullaa ibn Masud.

instruction: What did Aktham ibn al-Saifi propose when he decided to visit the Holy Prophet?
output: Aktham ibn al-Saifi proposed that they should select two persons from his tribe to go to the Holy Prophet and report back to him.

instruction: What was the answer to Aktham ibn al-Saifi's first question when he met the Holy Prophet?
output: The Holy Prophet's answer to Aktham's first question was: "I am Muhammad, the servant of Allah and His messenger."

instruction: What does the Arabic word 'ahd' encompass?
output: 'Ahd' encompasses all transactions, pacts, and pledges the responsibility of which has been assumed verbally.

instruction: What happens if one breaks a pledge or a contract?
output: Breaking a pledge or a contract is a major sin, and there is no fixed Kaffarah (expiation) for this purpose. Instead, it brings the punishment of the Hereafter on the offender.

instruction: What is the significance of acting contrary to what one has sworn by?
output: Acting contrary to what one has sworn by is also a major sin. In the Hereafter, it is full of unimaginably evil consequences while in the present world too there are its particular situations in which Kaffarah (expiation) becomes necessary.

instruction: What is the Islamic teaching regarding breaking a pact entered into with a group?
output: Muslims are forbidden to break a pact entered into with a group merely for the sake of worldly interests and gains, even if the other group appears to be weaker or less affluent.

instruction: What should one do if the party with which one has entered into a pact commits acts contrary to Islamic law?
output: If the party with which one has entered into a pact commits acts contrary to Islamic law, it is necessary to break that pact, provided they are clearly forewarned that Muslims will no longer be bound by that pact.

instruction: What is the purpose of the verse that discusses breaking a pact in Islamic scripture?
output: The verse discusses the breaking of a pact as a device to test Muslims, to determine if they would obey their selfish desires and break the solemn pledge, or sacrifice their selfish motives in obedience to Allah's command.

instruction: What is the instruction given in the verse 94 of the Quran that begins with the words: وَلَا تَتَّخِذُوا أَيْمَانَكُمْ دَخَلًا?
output: The instruction is to stay away from getting involved in what is a great sin laden with evil consequences.

instruction: What does the act of swearing an oath with the intention to deceive another party signify?
output: The act signifies the danger of forfeiture of Faith ('Iman).

instruction: What does the sentence "Fatazilla qadamun ba'da thubootihaa" mean in the context of the verse 94 of the Quran?
output: It means that a person who harbours other intentions while taking an oath, and is all set to act counter to the oath may end up being all deprived of the very asset of 'Iman (faith).

instruction: What is the interpretation of 'good life' according to the majority of commentators?
output: According to the majority of commentators, 'good life' means a pure and pleasing life in the present world.

instruction: What does the term 'good life' not imply, as per the majority of commentators?
output: 'Good life' does not mean that such a person will never encounter poverty or sickness.

instruction: What does the belief of a believer give him solace and comfort even in hardships, as per the text?
output: The believer's belief in the promises made by Allah and his strong hopes of seeing ease after hardship and comfort after pain give him solace and comfort even in hardships.

instruction: What command is given in this verse of the Qur’an that is deemed necessary with other deeds?
output: The command to seek protection against Satan, the accursed, particularly during the recitation of the Qur’ an.

instruction: What is the significance of the recitation of the Qur’ an in relation to Satan?
output: Satan runs away from people who recite the Qur’ an.

instruction: What are the two kinds of enemies that human beings have, according to Ibn Kathir, and how does Islam command defence against each kind?
output: The first kind of enemy comes from human beings themselves (such as disbelievers), and defence is sought through Jihad involving fighting and killing. The second kind is the enemy of the Satanic kind, and defence is sought through the seeking of protection from Allah.

instruction: What is the way of faith and trust in Allah according to the Islamic text?
output: The way of faith and trust in Allah is the way of freedom from the power and control of the Shaitan.

instruction: What does verse 99 and 100 of the Islamic text suggest about the power of the Shaitan?
output: Verses 99 and 100 of the Islamic text suggest that Allah Ta’ ala has not given the Shaitan the kind of power which would disarm any human being and compel him to become helpless and take to evil.

instruction: What does verse 42 of Surah al-Hijr refute about the claim of the Shaitan?
output: Verse 42 of Surah al-Hijr refutes the claim of the Shaitan by saying that the Shaitan has no power over Allah's servants except over those who follow him from among the astray.

instruction: What is the instruction given in the previous verse regarding the Qur'an?
output: The instruction is to say 'a udhu bil-lah' (I seek protection with Allah) while reciting the Qur'an.

instruction: What does the Shaitan do when one recites the Qur'an?
output: The Shaitan puts scruples in the heart when one recites the Qur'an.

instruction: What does the text above refute?
output: The text above refutes Satanic instigations.

instruction: Who were the first two individuals to meet their martyrdom in the way of Islam, and how did they die?
output: Sayyidna Yasir and Sayyidah Sumayyah were the first two individuals to meet their martyrdom in the way of Islam. They were cruelly killed by the Mushriks (polytheists) of Makkah. Sayyidna Yasir was killed and Sayyidah Sumayyah was torn apart by two camels.

instruction: What is the meaning of Ikrah and what are its two degrees?
output: Ikrah means using threat or violence to force a person to act against his or her will. It has two degrees: Ikrah ghayr mulji' (compulsion not forced actually), where one is not willing by heart to do something, but is also not that denuded of choice and volition to say no. In the second degree, one is just sucked out of all choice so much so that should he fail to carry out the order of the perpetrators of this coercion (Ikrah), he would be killed or some of his organ is amputated.

instruction: What is the ruling on transactions that are executed under duress (with Ikrah)?
output: Transactions that can be effected only by mutual consent and heartfelt willingness of the parties, like sale, gift, etc., have no validity in the sight of the Shari`ah of Islam if they are executed under duress (with Ikrah). However, for some transactions, like marriage, divorce, revocation of divorce, and freedom of a slave, the mere verbalization of the word of the respective transactions is sufficient, even if it is done under duress, according to Imam Abu Hanifah. However, according to Imam Shafi`i, such transactions done under duress will not take effect.

instruction: What is the significance of 'Iman' (faith) as mentioned in the verse 106?
output: The significance of 'Iman' (faith) as mentioned in the verse 106 is that it serves as a wealth that can forgive all past sins of a disbeliever or apostate if they come up with an honest and true faith.

instruction: What is the significance of the 'Last Day of Qiyamah' as mentioned in the verse 107?
output: The Last Day of Qiyamah, as mentioned in the verse 107, is significant because it is the day when all the phenomena of reward and punishment will occur after it.

instruction: What does the verse 108 suggest about the punishment of certain sins?
output: The verse 108 suggests that the punishment of certain sins is faced in a certain degree within the present world, although the real punishment of disbelief and sin will come after the Qiyamah.

instruction: What is the similitude mentioned in Surah Al-An'am, verse 112?
output: The similitude mentioned in Surah Al-An'am, verse 112 is general and universal, not specific to a particular habitation.

instruction: What event is often referred to when interpreting the similitude in Surah Al-An'am, verse 112?
output: The event often referred to is the acute famine that occurred in Makkah al-Mukarramah for seven years, during which people were forced to eat animal carcass, dead dogs, and filth.

instruction: In what way does the word 'garment' (libas) in Surah Al-An'am, verse 112 convey the sense of hunger and fear?
output: The word 'garment' (libas) in Surah Al-An'am, verse 112 conveys the sense of hunger and fear by representing something that is wide-spread and all-enveloping, symbolizing how hunger and fear were cast over the people described in the verse.

instruction: What was the disbelievers' ungratefulness towards Allah?
output: The disbelievers' ungratefulness towards Allah was declaring what Allah had made Halal as Haram and what Allah had called Haram as Halal.

instruction: What is the exclusive right of Muslims' Creator?
output: The exclusive right of Muslims' Creator is to make things Halal and Haram.

instruction: What happens if a Muslim who has committed such evil deeds through ignorance repents and believes?
output: If a Muslim who has committed such evil deeds through ignorance repents and believes, Allah Ta' ala will forgive all sins committed by them.

instruction: What is the purpose of the restrictive particle 'innama' in verse 115 of Surah Al-An`am?
output: The purpose of the restrictive particle 'innama' in verse 115 of Surah Al-An`am is to point out that only those things that are truly Haram are being mentioned here, as opposed to what the mushrikin of the period of Jahiliyah had made Haram on their own.

instruction: What is the purpose of verses 145 of Surah a1-An`am and 173-174 of Surah Al-Baqarah?
output: The purpose of verses 145 of Surah a1-An`am and 173-174 of Surah Al-Baqarah is not to describe Halal and Haram as they are commonly understood. Instead, these verses point out to what the mushrikin of the period of Jahiliyah had done, i.e., they had made many things Haram on their own although Allah Ta’ ala had never ordered them about their unlawfulness. These verses aim to correct their misconceptions.

instruction: What is the implication of the interpretation of 'innama' in verse 115 of Surah Al-An`am?
output: The implication of the interpretation of 'innama' in verse 115 of Surah Al-An`am is that according to the Qur'an and Sunnah, and by the Consensus of the Muslim Ummah, there are many more things rated as Haram that are not mentioned in this verse.

instruction: What word is used in the Quran to denote acting ignorantly, even if done knowingly?
output: The word "jahalah" is used in the Quran to denote acting ignorantly, even if done knowingly.

instruction: What is the antonym of the word 'ilm in Arabic?
output: The antonym of the word 'ilm (knowledge) in Arabic is "jahl."

instruction: Is repentance from sin restricted to situations where a sin is committed with lack of understanding or volition?
output: Repentance from sin is not restricted to situations where a sin is committed with lack of understanding or volition.

instruction: Who was Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) according to the Qur'an?
output: Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam) was the foremost universal leader of nations with the high station of a prophet and messenger of Allah.

instruction: What did the Qur'an confirm about Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) in verse 121?
output: In verse 121, the Qur'an confirmed that Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam) was grateful to Allah and was on the straight path.

instruction: What does the Qur'an state about the prophetic mission of Sayyidna Muhammad al-Mustafa ﷺ and the ideal of the authentic community of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam) in verse 123?
output: In verse 123, the Qur'an states that the prophetic mission of Sayyidna Muhammad al-Mustafa ﷺ was true and that he was truly committed to the ideal of the authentic community of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam).

instruction: Who did the Holy Prophet ﷺ follow in terms of Shari'ah and its Injunctions?
output: The Holy Prophet ﷺ followed the way of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) in terms of Shari'ah and its Injunctions.

instruction: What is the significance of the Holy Prophet ﷺ following the way of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام)?
output: The Holy Prophet ﷺ following the way of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) signifies the similarity of their Shari'ah, the fact that the last Shari'ah was also to be in accord with that, and it is a special tribute to Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) as the most superior of all his merits and perfections.

instruction: Why is the command to follow the way of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) considered special for the Holy Prophet ﷺ?
output: The command to follow the way of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) is considered special for the Holy Prophet ﷺ because it is a unique tribute out of the many honors and tributes attributed to Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام), and it signifies that Allah Ta’ ala has asked his preferred-most and the dearest rasul to follow his way.

instruction: What is the literal meaning of the Arabic term 'da'wah'?
output: Da'wah means to call.

instruction: Who is the first duty of the blessed prophets?
output: The first duty of the blessed prophets is to call people towards Allah.

instruction: According to the Qur'an, who is the best in utterance?
output: Who is better in utterance than the one who called (people) towards Allah. (41:33)

instruction: What does the verse 126 in Surah Al-Hujurat (49:126) instruct Muslims about causing harm to a Da'i (person of Da'wah)?
output: The verse instructs Muslims that, if they were to harm someone who is causing them harm in the process of delivering the message of truth, they have the legal right to retaliate against injustice done to them. However, this retaliation should not exceed the measure of injustice done.

instruction: What is the significance of the event that led to the revelation of verses 126, 127, and 128 in Surah Al-Hujurat (49)?
output: These verses were revealed in relation to the shahadah of seventy Sahabah (Companions of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ) and the event in which Sayyidna Hamzah رضي الله عنه (the revered uncle of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ) was killed and subjected to post-killing mutilations.

instruction: What is the background in which verse 126 was revealed and how was it implemented by the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ and his noble Sahabah رضي الله عنهم?
output: According to the majority of commentators, verse 126 is Madani and was revealed in relation to the shahadah of seventy Sahabah (Companions of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ) and the event in which Sayyidna Hamzah رضي الله عنه was killed and subjected to post-killing mutilations. The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ was initially determined to subject seventy Mushriks (polytheists) in retaliation for his Sahabah irrespective of their exact number. However, he was alerted and told that the right of retaliation was there but it had to match the measure of injustice done. He was also advised to be patient and not to retaliate, which was definitely much better. The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ said, "Now, patient we shall be. We shall not take any revenge from anyone" and paid out a kaffarah (expiation) for his oath. When, on the eve of the Conquest of Makkah, having all those Mushriks of Makkah under his control, it was certainly the time to do what he had declared on the battlefield of Uhud that he would do. However, at the time of the Conquest of Makkah, the course of patience was taken in accordance with the imperative of these verses.

instruction: What is the universal formula mentioned in the last verse (128) of the Islamic text?
output: The universal formula is "إِنَّ اللَّـهَ مَعَ الَّذِينَ اتَّقَوا وَّالَّذِينَ هُم مُّحْسِنُونَ" which means, "Surely, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are good in deeds."

instruction: What are the two virtues mentioned in the formula, and what do they represent?
output: The two virtues are Taqwa and Ihsan. Taqwa represents acting righteously or being good in deed, while Ihsan at this place signifies being good to those created by Allah Ta’ ala, those who are duty-bound to do righteous deeds and are particular in dealing with others nicely.

instruction: What does it mean to have the 'company' or help of Allah Ta’ ala?
output: To have the 'company' or help of Allah Ta’ ala means to be blessed with His presence and guidance, which enables one to act righteously and deal nicely with others. This is the ultimate goal and blessing for every believer.

instruction: What is the journey of Mi'raj, and what is the journey of Isra'?
output: The journey of Mi'raj (the Ascent to the heavens) is the journey taken by the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ from Makkah to the seventh heaven and beyond, where he met various prophets and angels. The journey of Isra' (the Night Journey) is a part of Mi'raj, which is the journey taken by the Holy Prophet  Muhammmad ﷺ from Makkah to Jerusalem (al-Masjid al-Aqsa).

instruction: What is the significance of the word 'abd (servant) in the verse "bi'abdihi (His servant)" mentioned in the text?
output: The word 'abd (servant) in the verse "bi'abdihi (His servant)" signifies a special bond of love between Allah and the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, indicating the highest honor a man can achieve, which is to become a perfect servant of Allah.

instruction: What is the difference between the physical and spiritual interpretations of the Mi'raj event?
output: According to the textual authority of the Qur'an and Ahadith, the Mi'raj event was physical, meaning the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ physically traveled from Makkah to Jerusalem and ascended to the heavens. Some interpretations also suggest that it might have had a spiritual component as well. However, the physical interpretation is the one that is predominantly accepted by Muslim scholars.

instruction: What does the text declare as valid right through the last day of Qiyamah?
output: The law which means - if you return to disobedience and contumacy, We shall, once again, make a similar penalty and punishment zoom back upon you.

instruction: Who were the addressees of the law declared in the text?
output: The people of Bani Isra'il who were present during the blessed time of the Holy Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: What does the text point out to the people of Bani Isra'il?
output: They should not forget that they were seized by divine punishment twice when they had first opposed the code of Sayyidna Musa (علیہ السلام) and then the code of Sayyidna 'Isa (علیہ السلام).

instruction: What is the way to which the Qur'an guides called?
output: The way to which the Qur'an guides is called 'aqwam,' the most upright.

instruction: What does 'aqwam' mean?
output: 'Aqwam' can be explained by saying that it is a way that is closer to the destination, is easy and free of dangers at the same time.

instruction: What does the Qur'an's guidance offer according to the text?
output: The rules set for human life by the Holy Qur'an offer a combination of being closer to the destination, being easy, and being free of dangers.

instruction: What does the verse 11 of Surah Al-Insan describe?
output: The verse 11 of Surah Al-Insan describes a natural weakness of human beings, their tendency to act hastily and focus on immediate profit and loss, overlooking foresight and hindsight.

instruction: What is the event related to, as mentioned by some authorities in Tafsir, in verse 11 of Surah Al-Insan?
output: The event relates to Nadr ibn Harith, a man who made a prayer in the heat of his hostility toward Islam, asking Allah to rain down rocks from the skies or send upon him some other painful punishment if Islam was the truth from Allah.

instruction: Who or what is the 'al-insan' in the text of verse 11 of Surah Al-Insan referring to?
output: The 'al-insan' in the text of verse 11 of Surah Al-Insan could be referring to those mentioned above, or those like them, as some authorities in Tafsir suggest, with reference to Nadr ibn Harith.

instruction: What is the significance of the alternation of night and day according to the Islamic text?
output: The alternation of night and day is a sign of Allah's most perfect power and there is great wisdom in the making of the night dark and the day bright.

instruction: What is the purpose behind the darkness of the night, according to the text?
output: The darkness of the night is appropriate and conducive to sleep and rest, as per the divine arrangement, humans and animals go to sleep in the darkness of that very night, and the whole world sleeps simultaneously in harmony with its night.

instruction: What are the two elements of wisdom in the day being bright, as mentioned in the text?
output: The two elements of wisdom in the day being bright are: (1) one can earn his living in the light of the day, and (2) the alternation of night and day helps one know the number of years, as the completion of three hundred and sixty days tells us that a full year has gone by. Other calculations are also related to the alternation of night and day.

instruction: What is the significance of the 'book of deeds' mentioned in the text?
output: The 'book of deeds' is a metaphorical concept in Islamic teachings, representing an individual's record of their actions, both good and bad, throughout their life.

instruction: What happens to an individual's 'book of deeds' at death, according to the text?
output: At death, the 'book of deeds' is closed and set aside safely. On the Day of Judgment, it is placed in everyone's hand for them to read and decide their own fate.

instruction: Who will be able to read their 'book of deeds' on the Day of Judgment, according to the text?
output: According to the text, even an illiterate person will be able to read their 'book of deeds' on the Day of Judgment.

instruction: What does the verse "Allah does not punish unless He sends a Messenger" imply?
output: This verse implies that Allah will not punish anyone unless He sends a messenger to them.

instruction: Who will not be subject to any punishment, according to some leading Muslim jurists?
output: Those to whom the call of any prophet or messenger did not reach will not be subject to any punishment, despite their disbelief.

instruction: Who will not be punished, according to the verse "And no bearer of burden shall bear the burden of another"?
output: The children of Mushriks and disbelievers who die before reaching adulthood will not be punished.

instruction: What does the text imply about the relationship between divine punishment and human actions?
output: The text implies that divine punishment is a consequence of human actions, particularly when people refuse to obey the commandments of Allah through the prophets, and continue to indulge in sin.

instruction: What are the outcomes of two different renditions or versions (qira'ah) of the word 'amarna' as per Tafsir?
output: The two different outcomes of the two qira'ah of the word 'amarna' are: (1) When Allah Ta` ala sends punishment on a certain people, the initial sign is that the number of the reckless rich is increased among them and they, through their spate of sins, become the cause of making the punishment descend upon the entire people, and (2) When Allah Ta’ ala sends punishment on a certain people, the initial sign is that an affluent person is made the ruler of their affairs.

instruction: What is the natural phenomenon that the rich and the affluent have over a people, according to the text?
output: The text indicates that the masses are naturally affected with the deeds and morals of those affluent among them and those who rule over them. When these people get used to misdeeds, the whole nation follows suit and takes to misdeeds (as the only available norm of social survival).

instruction: What do the verses in the text imply about people who prioritize worldly benefits?
output: The text implies that people who prioritize worldly benefits are continuously motivated by material interests only, having practically no concern for the Hereafter, and their punishment in Hell will materialize.

instruction: What does the text imply about people who desire the Hereafter and its rewards?
output: The text implies that as soon as a true believer forms an intention to have the reward of the Hereafter in whatever he proposes to do, that deed of his shall stand accepted - irrespective of any corruptive element having entered into something else he was intending to do.

instruction: Can the deeds of a denier of the Hereafter be accepted?
output: No, the deeds of a denier of the Hereafter cannot be accepted according to the conditions described in the text. Only the deeds of a true believer, who intends to do something for the sake of the Hereafter, can be accepted.

instruction: What does the text in verse 19 of Surah Al-Munafiqun clarify about deeds and efforts?
output: The text clarifies that not every deed or effort is necessarily beneficial or acceptable with Allah. Only the deed or effort that is appropriate to the essential objective (of the Hereafter) is credible.

instruction: How can one find out if a deed or effort is appropriate for the Hereafter?
output: One can find out if a deed or effort is appropriate for the Hereafter from the statement of Allah Ta’ ala and His Messenger ﷺ .

instruction: According to the text, what are self-opinionated deeds and acts of religious innovation?
output: Self-opinionated deeds and acts of religious innovation are efforts made by insisting on bland personal opinion and self-invented ways, which includes common customs of Bid'ah (innovations in established religion), no matter how good and beneficial they may appear at their face, but are not appropriate to the effort made for the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the primary condition for the acceptance of deeds in Islam?
output: The primary condition is 'Iman (faith, belief) in the Oneness of Allah (tauhid).

instruction: What does the Shari'ah of Islam regulate?
output: The Shari'ah of Islam regulates rules for deeds and their compliance brings success in the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the consequence of contravening the rules set by the Shari'ah of Islam?
output: The consequence of contravening the rules set by the Shari'ah of Islam is ruin.

instruction: What does the instruction "Submit yourself before them in humility out of compassion" mean?
output: The instruction means that one should stand in a stance of submission and humility as a mark of respect for parents, out of compassion. It cautions against adopting this stance of grace as a mere show-off, but instead, it should be adopted on the strong foundation of genuine, heartfelt respect and compassion for them.

instruction: What does the instruction "And say, 'My Lord, be merciful to them'" mean?
output: This instruction means that one should do whatever it is humanly possible to do in order to provide maximum comfort for parents, and then, along with it, one should also keep praying before Allah Ta` ala that He, in His infinite mercy, removes all their difficulties and makes things easy on them.

instruction: What happened with the man who complained about his father?
output: The man came to the Holy Prophet ﷺ to complain that his father was taking away what belonged to him. The Holy Prophet ﷺ asked him to bring his father. When his father came, he asked him about the words he had composed in his heart and which his own ears had not heard yet. The father confessed that he had composed some lines of poetry within his heart, which the Holy Prophet ﷺ asked him to recite. After hearing the poetry, the Holy Prophet ﷺ held the son by his shirt and said, " اَنت و مَالک لابیک " meaning that: Go. You and your property, everything belongs to your father.

instruction: What does the last verse of the text aim to remove in the hearts of children?
output: The last verse aims to remove any scruple or doubt that remains in the hearts of children regarding their ability to comply with divine injunctions relating to consistent observance of etiquette and respect due to parents.

instruction: What does the word 'al-awwabin' carry the sense of in the text?
output: The word 'al-awwabin' carries the sense of 'at-tawwabin' (those who repent before Him).

instruction: What do the six raka'at after Maghrib and the nawafil of al-Ishraq represent according to the Hadith?
output: The six raka'at after Maghrib and the nawafil of al-Ishraq represent the Salah al-Awwabin, a prayer to which the taufiq (ability) is granted only to those who are the Awwabin and Tawwabin (those who repent before Him).

instruction: What is the teaching in the Islamic text about the rights of common relatives?
output: The Islamic text teaches that every individual is obligated to fulfill the rights of common relatives. This includes sharing the graces of good social living, treating them well, and financially helping them if they are needy, in accordance with one's personal capacity.

instruction: Who does the verse of Surah al-Baqarah refer to regarding financial assistance?
output: The verse of Surah al-Baqarah refers to the necessary financial assistance provided to the needy and the wayfarer, and the mercy and generosity practiced in the case of kinsfolk.

instruction: What does the verse of Surah al-Baqarah aim to convey about the financial assistance given to relatives?
output: The verse aims to convey that the giver has no reason or occasion to harp on the favor done before or behind them because their right is his duty. The giver is simply doing his duty and not showering favors on anyone.

instruction: What does the Qur'an describe as 'squandering recklessly'?
output: The Qur'an describes 'squandering recklessly' as Tabdhir (تَبذیر), which is reckless spending of resources.

instruction: What is the Arabic term for extravagance in the Qur'an?
output: The Arabic term for extravagance in the Qur'an is Israf (اِسرِاف).

instruction: What is the difference between Tabdhir and Israf in Islamic spending?
output: Some commentators say that Tabdhir refers to spending in sin or on some totally unsuitable occasion or place, while Israf is spending beyond the level of need on an occasion where it is permissible to spend. Tabdhir is considered worse than Israf.

instruction: What is the moral training given to Muslims in the verse mentioned in the text?
output: The moral training in the verse is to not turn away or excuse oneself from helping those in need with an air of indifference or an insulting attitude, even if one is unable to help.

instruction: What was the background of the revelation of the verse mentioned in the text?
output: The verse was revealed as some people used to ask for financial help from the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, and he knew what would be given to them would be spent in the spreading of disorder. Therefore, he refused to give it to them, and this refusal was a device to stop them from indulging in disorder.

instruction: What happened after the Holy Prophet ﷺ distributed the cloth mentioned in the text?
output: After the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ distributed the cloth, some others came when the supply was finished and he had nothing to give. It was about the later that this verse was revealed.

instruction: What was the purpose of the revelation of the verse mentioned in the text?
output: The purpose of the revelation of the verse was to teach a just and moderate course in spending which does not prevent one from helping others nor does it end up in a lot of trouble for him.

instruction: What event is mentioned in the background of the verse's revelation?
output: The event in the background of the verse's revelation is an incident where a boy came to the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ asking for a shirt for his mother, and the Prophet ﷺ gave him his own shirt, leaving himself bare-bodied.

instruction: What was the outcome of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ giving the boy his own shirt?
output: The outcome of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ giving the boy his own shirt was that he was left bare-bodied, and when it was time for Salah, he could not respond to the Adhan, causing concern among the people. This led to the revelation of the verse discussed in the text.

instruction: What does the prohibition in the given verse pertain to?
output: The prohibition in the given verse pertains to haphazard spending that may leave the spender in a state of poverty and hardship.

instruction: Who is the verse not applicable to?
output: The verse is not applicable to people of high determination who can bear hardships and continue to fulfill the rights of others, even in case of poverty.

instruction: In what way does the verse prohibit spending?
output: The verse prohibits spending haphazardly, neglecting the future, which may lead to one's incapability to help others or fulfill family obligations due to lack of resources.

instruction: What was a cruel custom among the people of Arabs of Jahiliyyah during the pre-Islamic period?
output: Killing their children, particularly daughters, at birth due to fear of the expenses on their maintenance.

instruction: What does the Qur'an say about the responsibility of providing sustenance?
output: It is the exclusive domain of Allah Ta’ ala. He is the One who gives you your sustenance.

instruction: How does the Qur'an indicate that Allah Ta’ ala shall give sustenance?
output: Allah Ta’ ala, when He sees His servant supporting his family or helping others poor and weak, He gives him liberally in proportion to enable him to meet his needs as well as help others. This means that Allah Ta’ ala, when He sees His servant supporting his family or helping others poor and weak, He gives him liberally in proportion to enable him to meet his needs as well as help others.

instruction: What is the Islamic perspective on the act of fornication or adultery?
output: In Islam, fornication or adultery (zina) is considered a grave sin and a crime.

instruction: What are the two reasons given in the text as to why fornication or adultery is forbidden in Islam?
output: The two reasons are: (1) It is considered a shame and the loss of modesty leads to the inability to distinguish between good and evil; (2) It generates limitless social disorder that can devastate entire communities.

instruction: What is the punishment for committing adultery in Islam, according to the text?
output: The punishment for committing adultery in Islam is the harshest of all crimes, as it is considered more serious than any other crime due to its contagious nature and the potential for widespread social disorder. The act of adultery is said to be cursed by the heavens and the earth, and it is believed to bring embarrassment even in Hell.

instruction: What is the Islamic perspective on unjust killing?
output: The Islamic perspective on unjust killing is that it is a grave crime. The Holy Prophet ﷺ said, "The destruction of the entire world is lighter in the sight of Allah than the unjust killing of a believer."

instruction: What is the punishment for a person who abets in the killing of a believer?
output: A person who abets in the killing of a believer by assisting the killer even with one word will be brought before Allah Ta’ ala on the day of Resurrection. And written on his forehead shall be: "Deprived of the mercy of Allah."

instruction: Who has the right to seek Qisas (retaliation) in case of the unjust killing of a person?
output: The waliyy (legal heir) of the person killed has the right to seek Qisas (retaliation) in case of the unjust killing of a person. In the absence of a lineal waliyy, the head of the Islamic government will have this right.

instruction: What are the three financial injunctions mentioned in the text?
output: The three financial injunctions mentioned in the text are: (1) Caution in handling the property of orphans, (2) Fulfillment of covenants, and (3) Implementation of contracts, including the fulfillment of promises made to others.

instruction: What is the significance of the ninth injunction regarding the property of orphans?
output: The ninth injunction emphasizes the protection of properties owned by orphans and the observation of caution in their handling. It lays down that the property should be spent only in the interest and to the advantage of orphans, and not as based on their whim or lack of concern.

instruction: What is the meaning of the tenth and eleventh injunctions in the text?
output: The tenth injunction enjoins the fulfillment of covenants, while the eleventh injunction emphasizes the implementation of weights and measures in transactions of buying and selling, and forbids any short measuring.

instruction: What does the twelfth verse in the text forbid?
output: The twelfth verse in the text forbids doing something without having become certain about it.

instruction: What are the two degrees of certainty according to the text?
output: The two degrees of certainty according to the text are (1) Perfect certitude, a state that leaves no room of even the slightest doubt contrary to it. (2) Strong likelihood or Overwhelming Probability.

instruction: What are the three things that will be questioned about on the Day of Judgment according to the text?
output: The three things that will be questioned about on the Day of Judgment according to the text are the ear, the eye, and the heart.

instruction: What is the meaning of the thirteenth injunction in the second verse of Surah Al-A'raf (37) as interpreted in the text?
output: The thirteenth injunction in the second verse of Surah Al-A'raf (37) is interpreted as a command to not walk on the earth with arrogance, pride, and exultation, as this is an idiotic act that shows a major sin.

instruction: What is the significance of arrogance according to the Islamic text?
output: Arrogance is a major sin that can afflict a human heart mortally. It is taking oneself superior to others and rating others to be inferior to oneself. Severe warnings against it appear in Hadith.

instruction: What is reported in Hadith Qudsi regarding arrogance?
output: In Hadith Qudsi, it is reported that grandeur is Allah's mantle and greatness is His breech. Whoever tries to snatch these from Allah, Himself, will be put in Jahannam (The Inferno).

instruction: What is the general meaning of 'makruh' in the Islamic text mentioned?
output: 'Makruh' in the Islamic text refers to actions or behaviors that are detestable or disliked in the sight of Allah, including both 'haram' (forbidden) and 'makruh' (discouraged).

instruction: What is the purpose of the commandments in the Islamic text regarding rights of parents and relatives?
output: The purpose of the commandments in the Islamic text regarding rights of parents and relatives is to promote actions that are favorable, like fulfilling promises, caring for parents, and maintaining family relationships, and to avoid actions that are unfavorable, like hurting parents, breaking off from relatives, and going back on solemn promises.

instruction: What is the main divisions of the acceptable effort mentioned in the Islamic text?
output: The main divisions of the acceptable effort mentioned in the Islamic text are taking up the rights of Allah first and then the rights of the servants of Allah. The effort made in accordance with the Sunnah and teaching of the Holy Prophet ﷺ is the only one acceptable with Him.

instruction: Who is the Owner, Master, and Creator of the entire universe according to the Islamic text?
output: Allah is the Owner, Master, and Creator of the entire universe.

instruction: According to the Islamic text, why is it impossible for Allah to have partners in Godhead?
output: According to the Islamic text, it is impossible for Allah to have partners in Godhead because differences would have necessarily emerged among them, and ever-abiding peace among them is habitually impossible.

instruction: What would happen if Allah had other partners in Godhead?
output: If Allah had other partners in Godhead, the whole universal system would have gone to ruins.

instruction: What is the Tasbih (glorification of Allah) mentioned in the text?
output: The Tasbih mentioned in the text is the act of praising and glorifying Allah that is performed by everything in the universe, including angels, jinn, human beings, and inanimate objects.

instruction: What do some scholars say about the Tasbih of Allah performed by inanimate objects?
output: Some scholars say that the Tasbih of Allah performed by inanimate objects is circumstantial, state-articulated, and a testimony of their state of being. It is not a volitional act but a response to the creational imperative.

instruction: What does the phenomenon of pebbles saying Tasbih in the blessed hand of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ signify?
output: The phenomenon of pebbles saying Tasbih in the blessed hand of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ signifies a miracle. However, it is not the miracle of the Prophet ﷺ that the pebbles say Tasbih, but rather that their Tasbih becomes audible when they are in his blessed hand. This is a refinement made by Shaykh Jalaluddin as-Suyuti.

instruction: Does a prophet get affected by magic?
output: Yes, a prophet can be affected by magic, in the same way as they could be affected by sickness or other physical ailments.

instruction: What is the Hadith of magic referring to?
output: The Hadith of magic refers to the physical illness suffered by the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) that was caused by an act of magic.

instruction: Can magic have an adverse effect on the functions of a prophet?
output: No, magic or sorcery can affect a prophet only to cause a physical illness, and it cannot have an adverse effect on their functions as prophets. The disbelievers called the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) 'bewitched' in a metaphorical sense, which was impossible for him to be, while the Hadith refers to the physical illness suffered by the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) that was caused by an act of magic.

instruction: What does the word "Yad'uukum" in Surah Al-Qiyamah, Ayat 52 mean?
output: The word "Yad'uukum" in Surah Al-Qiyamah, Ayat 52 is a derivation from "Dua' " which means to call out for someone by announcing it vocally.

instruction: What is the meaning of "Istijabah" in Surah Al-Qiyamah, Ayat 52?
output: "Istijabah" in Surah Al-Qiyamah, Ayat 52 means to respond on being called by someone and be present before him.

instruction: Who are the real addressees of the verse in Surah Al-Qiyamah, Ayat 52, according to some commentators?
output: According to some commentators, the real addressees of the verse in Surah Al-Qiyamah, Ayat 52 are the disbelievers.

instruction: What does the verse (53) prohibit?
output: The verse (53) prohibits Muslims from talking harshly to disbelievers.

instruction: Why is it not allowed to use foul language or harsh words against disbelievers?
output: Using foul language or harsh words against disbelievers is not allowed because it neither subdues the aggression of disbelievers nor guides them to Islam.

instruction: What did Imam al-Qurtubi suggest about the verse (53)?
output: Imam al-Qurtubi suggested that the verse (53) contains a guideline for Muslims as to how they should address each other. It suggests that they should not speak harshly at the time of mutual difference, for this is a trap door through which the Shaitan pushes them into mutual infighting and disorder.

instruction: What is the significance of the Zabur (Psalms) mentioned in the Qur'an?
output: The Zabur (Psalms) is significant because it is mentioned in the Qur'an as a book of Allah revealed to Prophet Dawud (David), and it reports the prophethood and rulership of the Holy Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: How many surahs or chapters does the Zabur have?
output: The Zabur has one hundred and fifty surahs or chapters.

instruction: What are the primary themes of Zabur?
output: The primary themes of Zabur are praises of Allah and prayers to Him. The areas of lawful and unlawful, obligations, and limits are not taken up there.

instruction: What is the meaning of 'al-wasilah' in the Islamic text from Surah Al-An'am (57)?
output: 'Al-wasilah' means that which is used as a means of reaching someone, in this context, the means of reaching Allah.

instruction: What is the meaning or significance of 'Yabtaghoona ila rabbihim al-wasilah' (They seek the means of closeness to their Lord) in the Islamic text from Surah Al-An'am (57)?
output: The sentence means that all of them are seeking the closeness of Allah Ta’ ala through their righteous deeds.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase 'Yarjuona Rahmatah wa yakhaafuona `Adhabah' (They hope for His Mercy and fear His punishment) in the Islamic text from Surah Al-An'am (57)?
output: The phrase signifies the two different states one is in when seeking closeness to Allah - hoping for mercy from Allah as well as fearing Him. It is also stated that when they stay at par, one keeps on course, correct and stable. If any one of the two overcomes the other, one finds the equilibrium of his spiritual state subjected to disorder to the measure of that imbalance. (As per the interpretation by Qurtubi).

instruction: What is the meaning of the word "fitnah' (فِتنَہ)" in the verse 60 of Surah al-Mudaththir?
output: The word "fitnah' (فِتنَہ)" in this verse can mean falling into error and going astray, trial or test, or some disorder or upheaval. However, in this context, it refers to the trial or test that people were subjected to when they were told about the Mi'raj (the nocturnal journey of the Prophet ﷺ to Baitul-Maqdis and the heavens).

instruction: What event is the verse 60 of Surah al-Mudaththir referring to?
output: The verse 60 of Surah al-Mudaththir is referring to the event of Mi'raj or the nocturnal journey of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ to Baitul-Maqdis and the heavens.

instruction: What was the purpose of using the word "ru'ya" (رُّ‌ؤْيَا) in verse 60 of Surah al-Mudaththir?
output: The purpose of using the word "ru'ya" (رُّ‌ؤْيَا) in verse 60 of Surah al-Mudaththir was to show that the marvel was witnessed while awake, and not as a matter of some dream. This is because dreams are generally subjective experiences and there was no reason for people to turn apostates due to dreams. The use of the word "ru'ya" (رُّ‌ؤْيَا) highlights the objective nature of the event and the Prophet's ﷺ conscious experience.

instruction: What does the word "ihtinak" mean in the Islamic text?
output: "ihtinak" means to exterminate or uproot something, or to subdue and overpower it completely.

instruction: What is the meaning of "istifzaz" in verse 64 of the Islamic text?
output: "istifzaz" means to cut off or to tear away from, and in this place, it means to tear away from the path of truth.

instruction: According to Sayyidna ` Abdullah ibn ` Abbas ؓ, what are the voices of Shaitan?
output: The voices of songs, musical instruments, and the hullabaloo of fun and games are the voices of Shaitan that he employs to tear people away from the path of truth.

instruction: What does the text suggest about the Shaitan's claim to mislead the entire progeny of Adam?
output: The text suggests that the Shaitan claimed he would mislead the entire progeny of Adam, except a few of them.

instruction: What does the term 'Shaitanic army' in the text refer to?
output: The term 'Shaitanic army' in the text does not necessarily mean that the Shaitan actually has combat support in that formation. It is a manner of referring to the full force and power of the Shaitan.

instruction: According to the text, how does the Shaitan gain control over people?
output: The Shaitan gains control over people either by looking at the ingredients that go into the making of man, making it easy to entice them successfully, or by his very claim being a bland lie. The Shaitan's sharing in wealth and children can also lead to control, as explained in the text.

instruction: What does the term 'Imam' in the verse "Think of the Day We will call every people with their book of deeds" mean?
output: The term 'Imam' in the verse means 'book of deeds'.

instruction: On the Day of Judgement, who among the people will get their books of deeds in their right hand?
output: Those who will get their books of deeds in their right hand on the Day of Judgement will be the people of faith, pious or sinner.

instruction: According to some Ahadith, how will the books of deeds be given in the right or the left hand?
output: According to some Ahadith, all books of deeds will be at one place under the 'Arsh (Throne). Then a wind will blow and cause these to fly and reach the hands of people in a manner that some will get it in their right hand and some others in the left.

instruction: What event is the above text referring to?
output: The event referred to in the text is the incident where some chiefs of the Quraysh of Makkah suggested to the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ to remove poor and broken-down people from around him, in the hope that they might become his companions and friends.

instruction: What did the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ do in response to this suggestion?
output: The Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ did not accept the suggestion as it was a fitnah (a trial or test or a ruse to tempt him into creating discord in his ranks).

instruction: What is indicated by the phrase "had your Lord not been particular about your grooming and fortitude"?
output: The phrase "had your Lord not been particular about your grooming and fortitude" indicates that, without Allah's intervention, the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ might have come somewhat closer to tilting towards the proposal of the Quraysh disbelievers, but Allah saved him from drifting even to that limit due to his infallibility.

instruction: What does the phrase "Wa'in kaduu la yastafizzooka" mean in the verse from the Qur'an?
output: "Wa'in kaduu la yastafizzooka" means that the disbelievers intended to expel the Holy Prophet ﷺ from Makkah al-Mukarramah.

instruction: In what city did the Jews of Madinah suggest to the Holy Prophet ﷺ to live?
output: The Jews of Madinah suggested to the Holy Prophet ﷺ to live in Syria.

instruction: What was the consequence of the Quraysh disbelievers' plan to expel the Holy Prophet ﷺ from Makkah, according to the verse "Wa'in kaduu la yastafizzooka"?
output: The consequence, according to the verse, was that the Quraysh disbelievers themselves would not be able to live in peace in Makkah much longer after the Holy Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: What happens when a people expel their prophet from his home-land?
output: According to the customary way and law of Allah Ta` ala, those people are visited by the punishment of Allah Ta’ ala.

instruction: What does the last verse (77) of the Islamic text tell us about the treatment of prophets?
output: The last verse (77) tells us that when a people expel their prophet or compel him to leave by scaring and harassing, they are visited by the punishment of Allah Ta’ ala.

instruction: What is the implication of the last verse (77) for people who expel their prophet from his home-land?
output: The implication of the last verse (77) for people who expel their prophet from his home-land is that they are not left to continue living there and are visited by the punishment of Allah Ta’ ala.

instruction: What does the word "tahajjud" mean in the context of this Islamic text?
output: "Tahajjud" in the context of this Islamic text refers to a nightly prayer which is called the prayer of Tahajjud in the terminology of Shari'ah.

instruction: Is the prayer of Tahajjud Fard (obligatory) or Nafl (additional)?
output: The prayer of Tahajjud is not Fard (obligatory) but Nafl (additional).

instruction: What is the outcome of the narrative reports concerning the prayer of Tahajjud reported from al-Hasan al-Basri (رح) by Imam Ibn Kathir (رح)?
output: The reports confirm that the prayer of Tahajjud holds good for every prayer that is said after al-` Isha, and it will be applied to that which is said after some sleep. This sense holds good for sleeping a little, then waking up from it and making Salah. Very similarly, it is also good if one begins by postponing sleep for Tahajjud and makes the Salah. The condition that one has to sleep before doing the prayer of Tahajjud is not found in the words used by the Qur'an.

instruction: What did the Holy Prophet ﷺ pray for during his migration from Makkah to Madinah?
output: The Holy Prophet ﷺ prayed that his entry into Madinah and his exit from Makkah should both be good and smooth.

instruction: What is the significance of the order of 'entrance' and 'exit' in the prayer?
output: The order of 'entrance' and 'exit' in the prayer indicates that the exit from Makkah had no purpose of its own, while the objective to be achieved, i.e., the entry in Madinah, was made to come first.

instruction: What is the benefit of making the prayer mentioned in the text for Muslims?
output: Some `Ulama' have said that every Muslim should remember to make this prayer at the beginning of all objectives they wish to pursue, and this prayer is beneficial for all objectives and purposes.

instruction: What happened on the day Makkah was conquered according to Ibn Masud رضی الله عنہ?
output: On the day Makkah was conquered, the Holy Prophet ﷺ entered Makkah. At that time, there were three hundred and sixty idols standing around the Baytullah.

instruction: What did the Mushriks of Makkah have a separate idol for each day of the year that they used to worship?
output: The Mushriks of Makkah had a separate idol for each day of the year that they used to worship on the given day.

instruction: What did the Holy Prophet ﷺ do with the idols when he reached Makkah?
output: When the Holy Prophet ﷺ reached Makkah, he went round striking at each single idol on the chest with his stick. He gave orders that they be demolished after all idols fell down.

instruction: What is the significance of the Qur'an according to the Islamic text?
output: The Qur'an is a source of healing, a cure for spiritual ailments and physical diseases, as well as a means to deliver people from shirk and kufr (polytheism and disbelief).

instruction: What is the Hadith of Sayyidna Abu Said al-Khudri ؓ about?
output: The Hadith narrates an incident where a party of the noble Companions ؓ used the recital of Surah al-Fatihah and their breath to cure a sick person who had been bitten by a scorpion. This action was later approved by the Holy Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: What does the last sentence of verse 82 indicate according to the text?
output: The last sentence of verse 82 indicates that for those who deny or show irreverence to the Qur'an, it will result in loss and misfortunes.

instruction: What does the term "shakilah" refer to in the verse "Everyone acts in his own style"?
output: "Shakilah" refers to disposition, habit, instinct, intention, way or manner, and it is a second nature that one builds up under the influence of one's surroundings, company, and customs.

instruction: What does the verse "Everyone acts in his own style" caution us about?
output: The verse cautions us to abstain from bad surroundings, bad company, and bad habits, and to take to the company of good people and inculcate good habits.

instruction: What does Imam al-Jassas suggest as another meaning of 'shakilah' at the place mentioned in the verse?
output: Imam al-Jassas suggests that 'shakilah' can mean 'like,' with the sense of the verse being that everyone feels comfortable with a person who is compatible with one's temperament. This also serves as a warning against falling into bad company and bad habits.

instruction: What is the meaning of the word 'Ruh' in the context of the Holy Qur'an?
