instruction: What does the phrase "their deeds, other than that" in the text refer to?
output: It refers to the sinful deeds that the infidels engage in, in addition to their rejection of the Oneness of Allah and their denial of the true faith.

instruction: What is the significance of the word غَمْرَ‌ةٍ used in the verse "But their hearts are in ignorance"?
output: The significance of the word غَمْرَ‌ةٍ used in the verse is to signify that the ignorance in which the hearts of the infidels are submerged and hidden is so deep that no light can reach them.

instruction: What is the meaning of تْرَ‌فِ in the context of the Islamic text mentioned?
output: تْرَ‌فِ is derived from comfort and prosperity.

instruction: What is the Divine punishment mentioned in the verse 23:64, as per some interpretations, that was inflicted upon the infidels of Makkah?
output: The punishment mentioned in verse 23:64, as per some interpretations, is an allusion to the crushing defeat which the infidels of Makkah suffered at the hands of the Muslims in the Battle of Badr.

instruction: What was the curse laid on the people of Makkah by the Holy Prophet ﷺ, according to some interpretations of the verse 23:64?
output: According to some interpretations of the verse 23:64, the curse laid on the people of Makkah by the Holy Prophet ﷺ was a severe famine which afflicted them as a result. They were forced to eat dead animals and cats and dogs.

instruction: What are the five reasons mentioned in the verses 68, 69, and 70 as to why unbelievers may not accept the faith brought by the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ?
output: The five reasons are: a) The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is merely following the teachings of the previous prophets. b) The unbelievers think that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is possessed. c) They argue that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ has forged the revelations. d) They claim that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ has invented the revelations. e) They say that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ and his followers are mad.

instruction: What is the rebuttal for each of these causes, according to the text?
output: The rebuttal for each cause is as follows: a) The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is not following the teachings of previous prophets, but is, in fact, the last in the line of prophets (and the culmination of God's guidance). b) The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is not possessed, but is a messenger of God. c) The unbelievers' accusation that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ has forged the revelations is unfounded, as God is the source of the revelations. d) The claim that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ has invented the revelations is false, as he is an unlettered prophet who receives revelations from God. e) The unbelievers' assertion that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ and his followers are mad is untrue, as they are guided by divine revelation.

instruction: What is the overall effect of the verses 68, 69, and 70, according to the text?
output: The verses 68, 69, and 70 demonstrate that all the arguments advanced by the infidels for not accepting the true faith have been demolished, and there are compelling grounds and irrefutable evidence that should convince any right-minded person of the error of their ways and persuade them to accept the message brought by the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ. The persistence of the unbelievers in their unbelief is due to their unreasoning hatred towards and blind prejudice against the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.

instruction: Who was the messenger being referred to in the Islamic text "أَمْ لَمْ يَعْرِ‌فُوا رَ‌سُولَهُمْOr did they not recognize their messenger?"
output: The messenger being referred to in the Islamic text is the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.

instruction: In what way was the life of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ an open book before the people of Makkah?
output: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ's life was an open book before the people of Makkah because before prophethood was bestowed upon him, he was known among the unbelievers of Makkah as 'اَمِین' (trustworthy) and 'صَادِق' (truthful). Nobody had ever raised an accusing finger on his character and general behavior.

instruction: What argument could not be invoked in the case of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ regarding the denial of the message by the people of Makkah?
output: The argument that could not be invoked in the case of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ regarding the denial of the message by the people of Makkah was that their repudiation of the message brought to him was due to their ignorance about him or about his family connections.

instruction: What was the event referred to in the verse "وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَاهُم بِالْعَذَابِ فَمَا اسْتَكَانُوا لِرَ‌بِّهِمْ" (23:76)?
output: The verse refers to an incident when the people of Makkah were subjected to famine, but they did not turn humbly to their Lord despite being delivered from their sufferings.

instruction: What was the cause of the famine in Makkah mentioned in the text?
output: The text mentions that the Holy Prophet ﷺ prayed to Allah to punish the people of Makkah with famine, and as a result they were reduced to great straits and were forced to eat dead animals.

instruction: Who interceded on behalf of the people of Makkah to Allah to remove the curse of famine?
output: The text mentions that Abu Sufyan, an eminent leader of the Quraysh tribe, presented himself before the Holy Prophet ﷺ at Madinah and interceded on behalf of the people of Makkah to Allah to remove the curse of famine.

instruction: What is the subject matter of the given Islamic text?
output: The given Islamic text is about a prayer that the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was encouraged to make by Allah.

instruction: What is the purpose of the prayer mentioned in the text?
output: The purpose of the prayer mentioned in the text is to ask Allah not to place the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) among the wrongdoing people if Allah's wrath were to descend upon the infidels during his lifetime.

instruction: Why was the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) encouraged to make this prayer despite his impeccability and infallibility?
output: The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was encouraged to make this prayer to remind him to always remember Allah and beseech His mercy, increasing his own reward in the Hereafter.

instruction: What does the text imply about the power of Allah?
output: The text implies that Allah has the power to carry out His threats.

instruction: What does the text refer to as "what We threatened them with"?
output: The text refers to the punishment that Allah threatened the disbelievers of Makkah with, which was shown to the Prophet through the famine and their defeat at the Battle of Badr.

instruction: What does the text suggest about the Prophet's role in the community?
output: The text suggests that the Prophet, during his lifetime, had a protective role in the community, as Allah did not punish them while he was among them.

instruction: What does Allah instruct the Holy Prophet to counter evil with?
output: Allah instructs the Holy Prophet to counter evil with that which is best.

instruction: What is the general observation of the virtues of conduct taught by Allah to the Holy Prophet among the Muslims?
output: The general observation of the virtues of conduct taught by Allah to the Holy Prophet among the Muslims is settling affairs with justice, mercy, and good.

instruction: What were the Muslims forbidden from doing during Jihad, according to the text?
output: During Jihad, the Muslims were forbidden from killing women, children, and the priests who did not engage in battle against the Muslims, and mutilation of the dead bodies of enemies was strictly forbidden.

instruction: What is the meaning of the word هَمَز (Hamazat) in the verse 97, 98 of Surah Al-Mumtahanah?
output: The word "Hamazat" in the verse 97, 98 of Surah Al-Mumtahanah means "strokes" or "push" or "press".

instruction: What is the purpose of the prayer 'اَعُوذ بِکَلِمَاتِ اللہِ التَّامَّۃِ مِن غضَبِ اللہِ وَعِقَابِہٖ وَمِن شَرِّ عِبَادِہٖ وَمِن ھَمَزٰتِ الشَّیٰطِینِ وَاَن یَّحضُرُونِ ?
output: The prayer 'اَعُوذ بِکَلِمَاتِ اللہِ التَّامَّۃِ مِن غضَبِ اللہِ وَعِقَابِہٖ وَمِن شَرِّ عِبَادِہٖ وَمِن ھَمَزٰتِ الشَّیٰطِینِ وَاَن یَّحضُرُونِ is used for seeking refuge from Allah's wrath and punishment, the evils of His slaves, the strokes of the Shaitans, and from their presence.

instruction: How did Sayyidna Khalid ؓ get cured of insomnia?
output: Sayyidna Khalid ؓ suffered from insomnia and was cured after he recited the prayer 'اَعُوذ بِکَلِمَاتِ اللہِ التَّامَّۃِ مِن غضَبِ اللہِ وَعِقَابِہٖ وَمِن شَرِّ عِبَادِہٖ وَمِن ھَمَزٰتِ الشَّیٰطِینِ وَاَن یَّحضُرُونِ as advised by the Holy Prophet ﷺ before going to bed.

instruction: What is the purpose of the prayer "أَن يَحْضُرُ‌ونِ"?
output: The prayer "أَن يَحْضُرُ‌ونِ" is a protection against the attempts of Shaitan to do evil deeds.

instruction: According to Islamic texts, what role does Shaitan play in human affairs?
output: According to Islamic texts, Shaitan meddles in all human affairs and tempts people to do evil deeds.

instruction: In which Hadith collection is the saying of the Holy Prophet ﷺ about the prayer "أَن يَحْضُرُ‌ونِ" found?
output: The Hadith about the prayer "أَن يَحْضُرُ‌ونِ" is found in the Sahih of Muslim.

instruction: What is the reaction of a good Muslim at the time of death?
output: A good Muslim perceives the angels of mercy and all the luxuries of Paradise spread out before him, but he refuses to return to a place which is full of woes and suffering and misery, and only desires to be taken to Allah's presence.

instruction: What is the response of an infidel at the time of death when asked if he wishes to return to the world?
output: An infidel's response when asked if he wishes to return to the world is "Rabbi arjuoni" - a wish to be sent back to the world.

instruction: What happens when death approaches an infidel who senses the punishment that awaits him on the Day of Judgment?
output: When death approaches an infidel and he senses the punishment that awaits him on the Day of Judgment, he wishes for a return to this world, so that by performing good deeds he may escape the punishment which he has richly deserved.

instruction: What is the Arabic word بَرْ‌زَakh and what does it signify in the context of Islamic beliefs?
output: بَرْ‌زَakh (Barzakh) is an Arabic word, which signifies a barrier or anything that intervenes between two conditions or two objects. In the context of Islamic beliefs, it refers to the intervening period between death and the Day of Judgment.

instruction: What does the verse "كَلَّا إِنَّهَا كَلِمَةٌ هُوَ قَائِلُهَا وَمِن وَرَ‌ائِهِم بَرْ‌زَخٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ" (23:100) mean?
output: The verse means "It is just a word he has to utter. And in front of them there is a barrier till the day when they will be resurrected." This verse implies that the wish of the infidel who has died to be returned to this world is fruitless, because he has reached the Barzakh from which no return is possible and a second life cannot be given until the Day of Resurrection, when all the dead will rise and be brought back to life.

instruction: What is the significance of the Barzakh in Islamic beliefs?
output: In Islamic beliefs, the Barzakh refers to the intervening period between death and the Day of Judgment. It is a concept that signifies anything which intervenes between two conditions or two objects, and is often interpreted as the state of the human soul between physical death and the Day of Resurrection. During this period, the soul is believed to be isolated and cut off from the temporal world, and awaits the Day of Judgment and the subsequent resurrection.

instruction: What happens to the earth, skies, and living things when the trumpet is blown for the first time on the Day of Judgment?
output: When the trumpet is blown for the first time on the Day of Judgment, everything - the earth, the skies, and every living thing in between will perish.

instruction: What is the difference of opinion regarding the reference of the verse "Thereafter, when the Sur (the trumpet) is blown, there are no ties of kinship between them" in the Quran?
output: According to Ibn Jubair, Sayyidna Ibn ` Abbas ؓ thought that it refers to the first call, while Sayyidna ` Abdullah Ibn Masud ؓ says that reference here is to the second call, and according to `Ata (رح) as Sayyidna ` Abbas ؓ also supports this view.

instruction: What happens on the Day of Judgment according to Sayyidna ` Abdullah Ibn Masud ؓ?
output: On the Day of Judgment every man and woman will be assembled in the gathering place (مَحشَر) where a herald appointed by Allah will identify each person by his name and his father's name and invite any one from amongst those present who has a claim against him to come forward and receive it. This proclamation will please everyone - a father having a claim against his son, a wife having a claim against her husband, a sister having a claim against her brother (and vice versa) - and they will all come forward to receive their dues. The present verse describes this situation: "There are no ties of kinship between them" (23:101).

instruction: How is the weighing of deeds performed on the Day of Judgment according to the Qur'an and Hadith?
output: According to the Qur'an and Hadith, there are different versions about the method for the weighing of deeds. One version is that the believers and the infidels will be weighed bodily in the scale of justice, another version says that the scrolls on which their deeds are recorded will be weighed, and a third version suggests that a man's deeds which were weightless and intangible in this world, will be made solid on the Day of Judgment and will be placed on the scales and weighed.

instruction: How will the deeds of believers be weighed according to a specific Hadith?
output: According to a specific Hadith, a man's deeds which were weightless and intangible in this world, will be made solid on the Day of Judgment and will be placed on the scales and weighed.

instruction: What happens when a man's good deeds and bad deeds are of equal weight on the Day of Judgment?
output: According to a Hadith, a believer Muslim will be sent to Hell for the purpose of purification only just as gold and iron and other metals are subjected to heating process to remove their impurities, and as soon as they are purged of their sins, they will be admitted to Paradise. A man whose good and bad deeds are of equal weight in the scale will join of (People of A` raf) and spend a while between heaven and hell waiting for a decision, but ultimately he too would go to Paradise.

instruction: What is the object of forgiveness and mercy in the prayer "Rabb aghfir warham" according to Mazhari?
output: The object of forgiveness and mercy in the prayer "Rabb aghfir warham" according to Mazhari is deliverance from harm and suffering, and the grant of every wish.

instruction: What does the ending verse of Surah Al-Mu'minun signify?
output: The ending verse of Surah Al-Mu'minun, "Surely, the infidels will not achieve success", signifies that success will come only to believers and that the unbelievers will have no share of it.

instruction: Why was the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) commanded to recite the prayer of forgiveness and mercy even though he is impeccable?
output: The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was commanded to recite the prayer of forgiveness and mercy even though he is impeccable to impress upon his followers the special merit of this prayer. (Qurtubi)

instruction: What does the prayer "Rabb-i-Ghafir-War-Ham" generally entail?
output: The prayer "Rabb-i-Ghafir-War-Ham" generally entails a plea for forgiveness and mercy, covering deliverance from harm and suffering, and the grant of every wish.

instruction: What is the object of human activity, as per the Islamic text?
output: The object of human activity is protection from bodily harm and acquisition of legitimate gains.

instruction: What is the significance of the verse قَدْ أَفْلَحَ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ (Success is really attained by the believers)?
output: The verse قَدْ أَفْلَحَ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ (Success is really attained by the believers) signifies that success will only come to believers.

instruction: What is the significance of the first verse of Surah An-Nur?
output: The first verse of Surah An-Nur is an introductory preface to emphasize the commands given in the following verses, particularly the command regarding punishment for adultery.

instruction: What is the Islamic punishment for adultery?
output: The Islamic punishment for adultery is the most severe among all the punishments prescribed by the Qur'an for crimes committed by human beings. For unmarried man and woman, the punishment is flogging with one hundred stripes, and for married man and woman, the punishment is stoning to death.

instruction: Why is the punishment for adultery in Islam so severe?
output: The punishment for adultery in Islam is severe because adultery is a great crime that is a combination of many crimes and brings along with it many other ills, such as the destruction of the entire social order, and contributes significantly to other ills of the world at large.

instruction: What is the second injunction about in Surah al-Nur verse 3?
output: The second injunction is about marrying men or women who have committed adultery, as well as marrying polytheist men or women.

instruction: What is the objective of the second injunction in Surah al-Nur verse 3?
output: The objective of the second injunction in Surah al-Nur verse 3 is to describe the far-reaching detrimental and evil effects of fornication, and how it ruins the moral behavior of man.

instruction: Who would agree to marry a polytheist woman, according to the verse Surah al-Nur verse 3?
output: A polytheist man would agree to marry an adulterer woman, as marrying a polytheist is as prohibited for a Muslim woman as adultery.

instruction: What is the punishment prescribed for false accusation of adultery under Islamic law?
output: The punishment prescribed for false accusation of adultery (qazf) is eighty stripes.

instruction: What is the condition for a person's evidence to be accepted in Islamic law?
output: For a person's evidence to be accepted in Islamic law, there must be four honest, equitable, just men as witnesses to the crime, without which the accusation is a big crime by itself.

instruction: What is the concept of Muhsanat in Islamic jurisprudence?
output: In Islamic jurisprudence, a Muhsanat is a person who is sane, adult, a free Muslim, and chaste, that is he has not been proved an adulterer before. This term is used to denote the person against whom the charge of adultery is levelled.

instruction: Who is the exception mentioned in the verse 24:5 of the Quran according to Imam Abu Hanifah (رح)?
output: Imam Abu Hanifah (رح) states that the exception mentioned in the verse 24:5 refers to those who are punished for false accusation of adultery, but if they sincerely repent and improve themselves after obtaining forgiveness from the one they had falsely accused, then they will no longer remain sinners, and their punishment will be pardoned in the Hereafter.

instruction: What are the two punishments meant for this world, which are referred in the beginning of the verse 24:5, according to the Islamic text?
output: The two punishments meant for this world, which are referred in the beginning of the verse 24:5, are eighty stripes and inadmissibility of his evidence.

instruction: What is the significance of the exemption in the verse 24:5 according to the Islamic text?
output: The exemption in the verse 24:5 implies that if the one who is punished for false accusation of adultery sincerely repents and improves himself, then he will no longer remain a sinner, and his punishment will be pardoned in the Hereafter, but the two punishments meant for this world, which are referred in the beginning of the verse, will remain despite the repentance. It is because the big punishment of stripes has already been executed and the second punishment is part of hadd. All scholars are unanimous on the point that repentance does not remit punishment of hadd, only the torment of the Hereafter is pardoned. Since inadmissibility of the evidence is part of hadd, it will not be remitted by repentance.

instruction: What is Li'an and what are its implications in Islamic law?
output: Li'an (لِعَان) is a specific type of oath between a husband and wife in Islamic law, where if a husband accuses his wife of adultery or refuses to own his child as being legitimate, and his wife refutes his allegation, they are subjected to a process called Li'an. This process involves swearing an oath five times, and if either party hesitates or refuses to swear, they may be arrested and forced to either repeat the oath or admit guilt. If both parties complete the process, they are forbidden from each other forever, and the husband must divorce his wife. If the husband does not divorce her, the judge or ruler can have them separated by his decree, which will have the same force as divorce. Moreover, they also cannot get married again for ever.

instruction: What is the purpose of the law of Li'an (لِعَان) in Islamic jurisprudence?
output: The law of Li'an (لِعَان) has been placed in the Islamic jurisprudence to take care of the psychology and emotions of the husband, as the husband may feel lifelong agony if he accuses his wife of adultery without the support of four eye-witnesses and is liable to punishment of false allegation of adultery. The husband's case has been separated from the general law and a separate provision has been prescribed, which is exclusive to the case between husband and wife.

instruction: What happens to the couple after the process of Li'an (لِعَان) is completed?
output: After the process of Li'an (لِعَان) is completed, the husband must free the woman by divorcing her. If the husband does not divorce her, then the judge or the ruler can have them separated by his decree, which will have the same force as divorce. Moreover, they also cannot get married again for ever. The child that would born from that conception would not have the name of her husband, but would be called after the name of the mother. Although the torment of Hereafter would increase on the one who is liar, after the Li'an, but the punishment of the world be annulled. Similarly, it is not permissible to call the woman an adulterer nor is it permissible to call her child illegitimate.

instruction: What is the main subject of Surah An-Nur?
output: The main subject of Surah An-Nur is the protection and security of chastity and continence.

instruction: Who was the target of false accusation in the episode of Ifk?
output: The target of false accusation in the episode of Ifk was Sayyidah ` A'ishah ؓ.

instruction: What did the Holy Prophet ﷺ award as punishment to those who were involved in the spread of false slander?
output: The Holy Prophet ﷺ awarded the punishment of false accusation (حدّ القذف) to those who were involved in the spread of false slander, and each one of them was flogged with eighty stripes.

instruction: What is the message of the verse 24:13 of the Quran?
output: The verse 24:13 of the Quran emphasizes that if a person makes an accusation of adultery against another person, he should produce four witnesses to prove his claim. If he cannot produce four witnesses, he is a liar in the sight of Allah.

instruction: Why was the person who made the accusation declared a liar in the sight of Allah, despite the fact that he might have seen the incident with his own eyes?
output: The person who made the accusation was declared a liar in the sight of Allah because he could not produce four witnesses to prove his claim, according to the Islamic law. In the absence of witnesses, it is not possible to prove the commission of a crime or sin, and as such, the person making the accusation is liable to be punished for relating a lie.

instruction: Why did the Holy Prophet ﷺ deny the accusation made against his wife at the outset, despite the fact that he had good opinion about his wife?
output: The Holy Prophet ﷺ denied the accusation made against his wife at the outset because the natural anxiety that arises in such a situation is but natural, but to act with care and caution, as the Holy Prophet ﷺ did, was not against having good opinion about the Muslims, especially when no action was taken on its exigency. Those Muslims who were awarded the punishment for false accusation and were reprimanded in these two verses, had actually acted on the exigency of the rumor and were involved in its spread. Spreading falsehood was unlawful and punishable even before the revelation of these verses.

instruction: What was the mistake that the believers in this verse had committed?
output: The believers in this verse had committed the mistake of slander.

instruction: What would have happened to the believers if it weren't for Allah's grace and mercy?
output: If it weren't for Allah's grace and mercy, a great punishment would have reached the believers for their slander.

instruction: What is the manifestation of Allah's grace and mercy in the world for the believers mentioned in this verse?
output: The manifestation of Allah's grace and mercy in the world for the believers mentioned in this verse is that Divine help was granted to adopt Islam, the company of the Prophet was accorded, and the repentance was accepted and the sin was pardoned.

instruction: What is the system for the prevention of obscenity as per the Qur'an?
output: The Qur'anic system for the prevention of obscenity is that such news should not spread and, if it is leaked out, it should be backed up with lawful proof. The punishment of adultery is also executed publicly, immediately after the spread of the news.

instruction: What is the consequence of publicizing scandals without proof in the Qur'anic perspective?
output: Publicizing scandals without proof in the Qur'anic perspective invites very severe punishment both in this world and in the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the role of the publicity of such news in the Qur'anic system?
output: In the Qur'anic system, the publicity of such news serves as a preventive measure, as people see the severe punishment for the obscene crime along with the news of adultery when they learn about it. It discourages immorality and obscenity from the people's mind.

instruction: Who were Sayyidna Mistah and Hassan and what was their relationship to the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ?
output: Sayyidna Mistah and Hassan were illustrious companions of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ. Sayyidna Mistah was a relative of Sayyidna Abu Bakr ﷽, while Sayyidna Hassan was the son of Sayyidna `Ali ﷺ and the grandson of the Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: What incident happened between Sayyidna Mistah and Hassan and Sayyidna `A'ishah ﷽, for which they were punished by the Prophet ﷺ?
output: They were involved in the incident of slandering Sayyidna `A'ishah ﷽, which led to their punishment by the Prophet ﷺ after the revelation of exoneration verses.

instruction: What lesson was given to Sayyidna Abu Bakr ﷽ and Sayyidna Mistah ﷽ in the Qur'an (24:22) regarding the oath that Sayyidna Abu Bakr ﷽ had sworn against helping Sayyidna Mistah ﷽ materially?
output: The verse (24:22) imparted the lesson that they should break their oath and expiate for it, since it was not a religious obligation to help the poor. They should also forgive and overlook, as Allah had forgiven them.

instruction: What does the verse 24:23 refer to?
output: The verse refers to those who falsely accuse chaste, innocent and believing women without sufficient evidence.

instruction: What is the punishment announced for those who falsely accuse chaste women according to verse 24:23?
output: Those who falsely accuse chaste, innocent, and believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter, and they will receive a severe punishment.

instruction: Who are the individuals this verse was aimed at in the first place?
output: This verse was aimed at those who were involved in slandering Sayyidah `A'ishah ؓ and did not repent, even after her exoneration was revealed in the Qur'an. This verse was not aimed at those who repented and mended their ways, as mentioned in verses 24:4-5.

instruction: What will happen to a person's tongue, hands, and feet on the Day of Judgment as mentioned in Surah An-Nur, verse 24?
output: On the Day of Judgment, a person's tongue, hands, and feet will testify against them of what they used to do.

instruction: What does the testifying of a person's tongue, hands, and feet imply according to the Islamic text?
output: The testifying of a person's tongue, hands, and feet implies that they will speak against them and testify against their crimes, leading to punishment for their sins.

instruction: What is the significance of a person's speech, hands, and feet testifying against them according to the Islamic text?
output: A person's speech, hands, and feet testifying against them signifies that their own actions will be the basis for their judgment and punishment on the Day of Judgment, with no room for denial or deception.

instruction: What is the principle stated in Surah Al-Nur, verse 26?
output: The principle stated in Surah Al-Nur, verse 26 is that vulgar and unchaste women are inclined towards vulgar and unchaste men and vice versa, while pure and chaste women show inclination towards pure and decent men and vice versa.

instruction: Who was bestowed with spouses by Allah Ta’ ala in accordance with their status, as mentioned in the text?
output: The messengers of Allah, who are the models of purity and chastity both outwardly and inwardly in this world, were bestowed with spouses by Allah Ta’ ala in accordance with their status.

instruction: Who is more prominent among the wives of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, according to the text?
output: Sayyidah ` A'ishah ؓ is more prominent among the wives of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, all according to the text.

instruction: What does the Islamic jurisprudence establish regarding the mannerism of social graces and saving people from troubles and inconveniences?
output: The Islamic jurisprudence establishes a two-sided system of teaching the mannerism of social graces and of saving all from troubles and inconveniences.

instruction: What is the ruling if a person seeks permission to go in but does not get an answer after knocking three times?
output: According to the practice of the Prophet ﷺ, if a person seeks permission three times and does not get a reply, he should go back.

instruction: What does the Qur'an advise about calling the Prophet ﷺ while he is inside his house?
output: The Qur'an advises that to call the Prophet ﷺ while he is inside his house, with the purpose of calling him out of the house, is disrespect to him. People should wait for him outside until he comes out on his own according to his convenience. (The related verse is 49:5.)

instruction: What is the meaning of Mata` in the Islamic text 24:29?
output: Mata` in the Islamic text 24:29 means 'rightful benefit'. Anything from which some benefit is drawn is also called Mata`.

instruction: What is the background of the revelation of verse 24:29?

instruction: What does the verse 24:29 prohibit?
output: Verse 24:29 does not prohibit entering uninhabited houses in which one has rightful benefit. However, it emphasizes the need for permission to enter private houses that have specific residents.

instruction: What do scholars call the verse mentioned in the text?
output: The scholars call this verse as the `Verse of Radiance'.

instruction: What does the verse of radiance describe in detail?
output: The verse of radiance describes in great detail the radiance of faith and the darkness of disbelief.

instruction: What is the significance of the verse of radiance in Islamic teachings?
output: The verse of radiance has great importance in Islamic teachings, as it highlights the contrast between faith and disbelief, symbolized by radiance and darkness respectively.

instruction: What is the definition of Nur (light) according to Imam Ghazzali?
output: Nur (light) is something which is bright and manifest on its own, and makes other things bright and evident.

instruction: What is the example of a believer's light according to the verse 24:35?

instruction: What does olive oil symbolize in the verse 24:35, according to the interpretation of Sayyidna Ubayy bin Ka`b ؓ?
output: Olive oil in the verse 24:35 symbolizes the natural nur (light) of guidance which is deposited in the nature of a believer and which has the inherent capability to accept the truth.

instruction: What does the verse "Fī بُيُوتٍ أَذِنَ اللَّـهُ أَن تُرْ‌فَعَ" mean?

instruction: What does the verse "يُذْكَرَ‌ فِيهَا اسْمُهُ" refer to?

instruction: What is the significance of the word "raised" used in the verse "Fī بُيُوتٍ أَذِنَ اللَّـهُ أَن تُرْ‌فَعَ"?
output: The word "raised" signifies to build, venerate, and keep mosques free of evil, as well as to keep them clean, meaning to make them free of all types of filth and dirt, and free of any foul smell.

instruction: What does the verse "And the one to whom Allah does not give light can have no light at all" (40) signify about disbelievers?
output: This verse signifies that disbelievers are deprived of the Nur (light) of guidance, which they lost by denying the injunctions of Allah.

instruction: What does the verse (35) "Allah guides to His light whomsoever He wills" describe?
output: This verse describes the guidance of believers towards Allah's light, which is the Nur of guidance.

instruction: According to the text, can a person become a perspicacious scholar merely by having resource of insight and knowledge?
output: No, according to the text, one cannot become a perspicacious scholar merely by having resource of insight and knowledge. Instead, it is bestowed by the grace of Allah only.

instruction: What is the meaning of Tasbih in the context of the Islamic text?
output: Tasbih, in the context of the Islamic text, refers to the obedience and submission to carry out the assigned job, which is a constant act of worship and recognition of Allah Ta’ ala's purity and almightiness.

instruction: What does the verse كُلٌّ قَدْ عَلِمَ صَلَاتَهُ وَتَسْبِيحَهُ (Everyone knows one's own (way of) praying and proclaiming Allah's purity - 41) suggest about the different forms of worship among various creatures?
output: The verse suggests that all creatures are busy in Tasbih and worship of Allah Ta’ ala, but the manner of worship of each creature is different. For example, angels worship in a different manner, humans worship differently, trees and vegetation also worship differently, and the rocks and minerals yet in another manner.

instruction: What does the verse أَعْطَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلْقَهُ ثُمَّ هَدَىٰ (He who gave everything its shape, then guidance - 20:50) imply?
output: The verse implies that Allah Ta’ ala created everything and then guided them, meaning He gave them a purpose and then showed them the way to fulfill their purpose with perfection. This guidance is that everything is obeying Allah and performing its assigned duty diligently.

instruction: What was the occasion for the revelation of the verses mentioned in the text?
output: The occasion was when a hypocrite named Bishr evaded taking a land dispute to the court of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ and instead took it to another Jew, Ka'b Ibn Ashraf.

instruction: What was the underlying reason for the hypocrite's evasion?
output: The hypocrite knew that if the case was placed before the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, he would definitely lose it because the Prophet would decide the case on merit.

instruction: What does the verse "Is there any malady in their hearts" (50:22) negate according to the text?
output: The verse negates that the malady in their hearts was either firm infidelity or doubt on prophethood, implying that these were not the real causes of evasion to take the dispute in the court of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ. Instead, it was about avoiding loss in the case due to the Prophet's justice.

instruction: What is the significance of the verse وَمَن يُطِعِ اللَّـهَ وَرَ‌سُولَهُ وَيَخْشَ اللَّـهَ وَيَتَّقْهِ (And whoever obeys Allah and His messenger and has awe of Him and observes Tagwa of Him, then such people are the victorious.)?
output: This verse signifies that those who bind themselves to follow these four things are the ones who are successful and victorious in this world and the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the explanation of the verse given by a Roman villager who accepted Islam?
output: The Roman villager explained that وَمَن يُطِعِ اللَّـهَ (whoever obeys Allah) refers to the obligations toward Allah, وَرَ‌سُولَهُ (and His messenger) refers to Prophet's traditions, يَخْشَ اللَّـهَ (and has awe of Him) alludes toward past life, and وَيَتَّقْهِ (and observes Tagwa of Him) is purported for the remaining life.

instruction: What does Fa'iz refer to as per the explanation of the verse by the Roman villager?
output: Fa'iz is that person who gets deliverance from Jahannam (Hell) and earns a place in the Paradise.

instruction: What did the Holy Prophet ﷺ promise about peace for his Ummah?
output: The Holy Prophet ﷺ promised that a time would come when his followers would live in peace without wearing their weaponry.

instruction: What were the three promises made by Allah Ta’ ala to the Ummah of Muhammad ﷺ according to the text?
output: The three promises made by Allah Ta’ ala to the Ummah were that they would be made His vicegerents on earth, Islam would be made victorious, and Muslims would be given so much power and grandeur that they would have no fear of any one.

instruction: What hadith is being referred to when it is stated that the caliphate will last for thirty years after the Holy Prophet ﷺ?
output: The hadith refers to a Sahih Hadith that the caliphate will last for thirty years after the Holy Prophet ﷺ, which means the Rightly Guided Caliphate (Al-Khilafah-ar-Rashidah). It lasted up to the time of Sayyidna `Ali ؓ, because this period of thirty years was finished after him.

instruction: What are the times when it is prohibited for mahrams and relatives to enter the private chambers of a home without taking permission?
output: The times when it is prohibited for mahrams and relatives to enter the private chambers of a home without taking permission are before the Fajr prayers, the resting time in the afternoon and in the night after ` Isha' prayers.

instruction: What is the reason for the injunction to seek permission at these three specific times before entering the private chambers?
output: The reason for the injunction to seek permission at these three specific times before entering the private chambers is to ensure that none should go in the private rooms without first seeking the permission, as one wants to be on his own and sometimes takes off the extra clothes, while at times one is in a compromising position with his wife. During any of these situations one would feel very embarrassed and upset if seen by even a very young but sensible child or a woman of the household. In the least it will cause him disturbance in his rest.

instruction: What is the ruling on the young children who are commanded to comply with the injunction of seeking permission?
output: In actual fact, the adult men and women who are the inmates of the house are charged with the duty to explain to the young children not to go to private chambers at these times without taking permission. It is in the same manner as a hadith instructs to teach the prayers to children when they attain the age of seven years and persuade them to offer it. And when they attain the age of ten years they be bound down to offer prayers regularly, and if they default then they should be beaten to be regular in their prayers. Similarly, the injunction of isti'dhan in the above verse is actually for the adult men and women. In the sentence under discussion the word Junah is used to say that apart from these three times there is no harm if the inmates go in the private chambers without permission. Generally the word Junah is used for sin, but sometimes it is also used for harm or obstacle. Here in this verse it is used for the latter meaning, hence, any doubt of sinning on the part of children is also removed. (Bayan ul-Qur’ an)

instruction: What is the third exemption to the injunction on hijab for women in Islamic text?
output: The third exemption is granted to old women who have no hope for marriage, for whom concession in hijab is allowed, and even strangers (non-Mahrams) are treated like mahrams.

instruction: What does the verse "And those old women who have no hope for marriage - 60" explain in this Islamic text?
output: This verse explains the third exemption, which allows old women who have no hope for marriage to uncover those parts of their body before non-Mahrams which are not required to be covered before mahrams.

instruction: What is the condition for the third exemption in the Islamic text regarding hijab for women?
output: The condition for the third exemption is that old women who have no hope for marriage should not apply any makeup or adornment while uncovering those parts of their body before non-Mahrams. Additionally, it is better for them if they avoid going before non-Mahrams altogether.

instruction: What is the purpose of the verse mentioned in the text?
output: The purpose of the verse mentioned in the text is to enjoin certain obligations and preferable social etiquettes to follow after permission to enter a house is granted.

instruction: What is the background in which this verse was revealed?
output: The verse was revealed in a background where Allah Ta’ ala had chosen such fortunate persons for the company of the Holy Prophet ﷺ that they were all ears for any command from Allah or His Messenger. They were always ready to put in their best on every single command. By following Qur'anic teachings diligently and having the exalted company of the Holy Prophet ﷺ they were turned by Allah Ta’ ala into a group of whom even the angels were proud.

instruction: What are the actual reasons behind the revelation of this verse?
output: The actual reasons behind the revelation of this verse are as follows: (1) A common habit among people to feel disgust in eating together with lame, cripple, blind and sick, and avoid it. (2) When the verse "Do not eat up each other's property by false means" was revealed, people were hesitant to eat with the blind, lame and the sick. (3) While going on jihad or battles, the Muslims used to hand over the keys of their houses to the poor and disabled persons with the instructions that they can eat whatever is there in the house. (4) The word "your friend" used in the verse was a reference toward the incident of Harith bin ` Amr ﷻ who went for jihad along with the Holy Prophet ﷺ, leaving the care and custody of his house to his friend, Malik Ibn Zaid ﷻ .

instruction: What is the first injunction given in the above Islamic text?

instruction: What is the second verse of the above Islamic text about?

instruction: What does the phrase "for a collective matter" in the above Islamic text mean?

instruction: What is the meaning of the term "call of the messenger" in the Islamic text 24:63?

instruction: What is the difference between the two interpretations of "call of the messenger" in 24:63?
output: The first interpretation explains that when the Holy Prophet ﷺ calls people, it should not be taken as a common call of an ordinary person. The second interpretation explains that the "call of the messenger" means the calling of the Holy Prophet ﷺ by the people for some need.

instruction: What is the injunction in the verse 24:63 in the context of the verse's meaning?
output: The injunction in 24:63 is that when people call the Holy Prophet ﷺ for some need, they should not call him by his name in a disrespectful manner, but should use an honorific form of address.

instruction: What was the first objection raised against the Holy Qur'an and the prophethood of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ?
output: The first objection was that the Qur'an was not a revealed book from Allah, but was compiled from old stories and narrations by the Jews and Christians, and the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ could not write or read.

instruction: What is the answer to the objection that the Qur'an is not a divine revelation?
output: The answer is given in the verse "Say, 'It is sent down by the One who knows the secret in the heavens and the earth' (Qur'an 25:6)."

instruction: What is the essence of the answer given in the verse "Say, 'It is sent down by the One who knows the secret in the heavens and the earth' (Qur'an 25:6)?"
output: The essence of the answer is that the Qur'an is evidence to the fact that it is the Divine message from Him who is Omniscient and who knows the secrets of the Heavens and the earth, making it a miraculous Message. The whole world was challenged to bring out a Surah or even a verse to match it, but no one could. This is a clear proof that it is not a work of a human being.

instruction: What was the second objection against the Holy Prophet ﷺ being a prophet?
output: The second objection was that the Prophet should not have been eating and drinking like common people, or have enough wealth to take care of his daily needs, and he should have been free from eating and drinking like angels, or an angel should have accompanied him to endorse what he preaches.

instruction: What is the general answer given in the verse انظُرْ‌ كَيْفَ ضَرَ‌بُوا لَكَ لِلْعَالَمِينَ regarding the second objection?
output: The general answer to the second objection is given in the verse انظُرْ‌ كَيْفَ ضَرَ‌بُوا لَكَ لِلْعَالَمِينَ (See how they coined similes for you, so they have gone astray and cannot find a way.)

instruction: Why did Allah not make the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ wealthy, given that He has the power to do so?

instruction: Did the Prophets eat and drink like ordinary humans?
output: Yes, the Prophets whom you admit to be prophets were also humans and not angels. They used to eat, drink, and work like ordinary human beings.

instruction: What is the significance of economic difference between people according to Islam?

instruction: What is the story behind the revelation of the verse "Woe to me! would that I had not taken so-and-so for my friend"?

'Uqbah tried to defend himself by explaining that he repeated the Kalimah Tayyabah (Islamic creed) to please the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, but 'Ubayy Ibn Khalaf did not accept this explanation and asked 'Uqbah to go and spit on the Prophet's ﷺ face. instruction: What is the moral of the verse "Woe to me! would that I had not taken so-and-so for my friend"?
output: The moral of the verse is universal, implying that friendship with wicked persons and non-believers will lead to repentance and regret in the Hereafter.

instruction: What does the Hadith "Every person is influenced by the faith and way of life of his friends" mean?

instruction: What does the verse 25:31 imply about the response of people towards the Qur'an?

instruction: Who are believed to fall within the category of those who abandon the Qur'an, according to certain traditions?

instruction: What were the people of Pharaoh denying according to the Islamic text mentioned?

instruction: What does the phrase "selfish desires are like an idol" mean according to the verse 25:43?

instruction: What is the significance of the night in Islamic perspective?

instruction: What is the significance of sleep in Islamic perspective?

instruction: Why does Allah Ta’ ala make people sleep at night?

instruction: What does the Arabic word "طَهُور" (Tahur) mean in the context of the given text?

instruction: What is the significance of water in Islamic perspective according to the given text?

instruction: What happens to the underground water that seeps into the ground as per the natural drainage system?
output: Underground water, seeping into the ground, is taken by the natural drainage system to every nook of the earth and then it reappears on the surface in the form of springs, fountains etc. Sometimes, it is drawn out by digging wells to reach it.

instruction: What does the verse "And We have distributed it (the water) among them" mean?

instruction: What is the incorrect presumption about the quantity of rains mentioned in the text?

instruction: What is the meaning of "Jihad with Qur'an"?

instruction: What did Allah command the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ to say to the people?
output: Allah commanded the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ to say, "I do not demand from you any fee, except that whoever so wills, should adopt a way to his Lord."

instruction: What is the purpose of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ inviting people to follow Allah's message?

instruction: What is the significance of the Holy Prophet ﷺ in the context of this verse?

instruction: Who are the people referred to in the verse "So ask about Him someone who knows" (25:59)?

instruction: Who was رَّ‌حْمَـٰنُ (Rahman) in the Arabic language before it was used for Allah?
output: رَّ‌حْمَـٰنُ (Rahman) was an Arabic word that originally referred to the most merciful and compassionate person or entity.

instruction: Why did Arabs not use the word رَّ‌حْمَـٰنُ (Rahman) for Allah before?

instruction: Why did Prophet Musa (PBUH) consider the killing of the Qibti as a sin, even though the Qibti was an infidel combatant and his killing was permissible?
output: Prophet Musa (PBUH) regarded the killing of the Qibti as a sin because violation of an implied or written covenant is prohibited in Islam. Covenants of peace are sometimes written or spoken in express words, and sometimes they come into effect by consistent practice of the parties that amounts to an implied agreement and is as good as a written covenant. The principle that grabbing of wealth of infidels during peacetime is not permissible has been laid down in a Hadith of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).

instruction: What is the principle laid down in the Hadith of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) about the wealth of infidels during peacetime?
output: The Hadith lays down the principle that grabbing of wealth of infidels during peacetime is not permissible. This is for the simple reason that people living together in a city or township or those who work together regard themselves secured from each other. The agreement established through their practice is like a trust, which must be honored by each and every person, no matter whether he is a Muslim or an infidel. The property of infidels permitted for possession by the Muslims is only that which is acquired during a war with them. It is not permitted to grab the wealth of infidels during peacetime, when one feels secured from one another.

instruction: What is the significance of the killing of the Qibti in the incident of Prophet Musa (PBUH)?
output: The killing of the Qibti in the incident of Prophet Musa (PBUH) was a result of his unjust attack on the Isra'illi. Prophet Musa (PBUH) tried to save the Isra'illi from the Qibti, but in the process, the Qibti was killed. However, Prophet Musa (PBUH) realized that a lighter blow would also have done the job of getting rid of the Qibti. Realizing that the harder blow was not needed, he repented and invoked Allah's mercy. This shows that Prophet Musa (PBUH) was always careful in his actions, even in performing permissible acts, and avoided them, unless he received a cue from Allah Ta’ ala. In view of his status as a prophet, he maintained that it was a sin on his part, and hence, invoked Allah's pardon.

instruction: What does the text in Surah An-Najm (10:3) imply about the creation of the skies?

instruction: Who was Luqman mentioned in verse 12: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا لُقْمَانَ الْحِكْمَةَ (And We gave wisdom to Luqman)?

instruction: What does the 'hikmah' given to Luqman (علیہ السلام) mean?

instruction: What was the command given to Luqman (علیہ السلام) along with the hikmah?

instruction: What is the primary article of belief in Islam?

instruction: What is considered a grave transgression in Islam?

instruction: What does the phrase "And be with them, in this world, with due fairness" mean in the Islamic text?

instruction: What is the significance of the weaning period of two years for a child mentioned in the verse, according to the Islamic text?

instruction: What is the belief that every Muslim should have about Allah's knowledge and power according to the text?

instruction: What is the fourth bequest of Luqman about, according to the text?

instruction: What does the phrase "لَا تُصَعِّرْ‌ خَدَّكَ لِلنَّاسِ" in verse 18 of Luqman's sayings mean?

instruction: What does the word "مَرَ‌حًا" denote in the verse "وَلَا تَمْشِ فِي الْأَرْ‌ضِ مَرَ‌حًا"?

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "إِنَّ اللَّـهَ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخْتَالٍ فَخُورٍ‌" in verse 18 of Luqman's sayings?

instruction: What does the word "isbagh" in verse 20 of Surah Ar-Rum mean?
output: "Isbagh" means to perfect, make complete, provide in great abundance to the last fill. It refers to both outward and inward blessings bestowed by Allah upon humans.

instruction: What are some examples of outward and inward blessings?
output: Outward blessings include beauty, provisions, property, wealth, economic opportunity, health, and well-being. instruction: What does the expression "kalimatul-lah" (the words of Allah) mean in the Islamic text?

instruction: What do the 'seven seas' in the Islamic text represent?
output: The 'seven seas' in the Islamic text do not represent actual oceans. Instead, they are a manner of saying that if all existing oceans were to be replenished with seven more oceans, still all the words of Allah could not be committed to writing.

instruction: What was the reason for the revelation of the verse "وَلَوْ أَنَّمَا فِي الْأَرْ‌ضِ مِن شَجَرَ‌ةٍ أَقْلَامٌ (27)"?

instruction: What is the message in the Surah Luqman about fearing Allah?

This fear is meant to instill the sublimity and awe of Allah Ta'ala in the hearts of people so that they can obey Him perfectly and easily.

instruction: What does the Surah Luqman say about a father's ability to bring benefit to his son on the Day of Judgment?
output: The Surah Luqman states that on the Day of Judgment, a father will not be able to bring any benefit to his son, nor will a son be able to bring any benefit to his father, if one is a believer and the other is a disbeliever. This is because of the difference in their faith and deeds.

instruction: What is the significance of using the word "maulud" (born one) instead of "walad" (son) in the Surah Luqman?

instruction: What are the five things that no one else knows except Allah?

instruction: What are the five things mentioned in the verse 31:34 that no one has their knowledge other than Allah?

instruction: What does the phrase 'No one knows what he will earn tomorrow' mean?

instruction: What does the verse (31:34) state about the knowledge of the Hour, rain, and what is in the wombs?

instruction: What are the two days mentioned in the Qur'an that are the Day of Resurrection (Qiyamah)?
output: The two days mentioned in the Qur'an that are the Day of Resurrection (Qiyamah) are a day whose measure is a thousand years and a day whose measure is fifty thousand years.

instruction: Why are the lengths of the two Days of Resurrection (Qiyamah) mentioned differently in the Qur'an?
output: The lengths of the two Days of Resurrection (Qiyamah) are mentioned differently in the Qur'an to emphasize its horrendous nature, and the length will be felt differently by individuals based on their faith and deeds.

instruction: Who had left the knowledge of the difference between the two Days of Resurrection (Qiyamah) as one thousand years and fifty thousand years to Allah?

instruction: What is the attribute of sincere believers pointed out in the verse 16 of Surah Al-Qiyamah?

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Their sides remain apart from their beds" in the verse 16 of Surah Al-Qiyamah?

instruction: What is the interpretation of the phrase "فَلَا تَكُن فِي مِرْ‌يَةٍ مِّن لِّقَائِهِ" according to Hasan al-Basri?

instruction: What is the second reason for religious leadership bestowed on some of the sages of Bani Isra'il, as mentioned in the given Islamic text?

instruction: What does the verse "قُلْ يَوْمَ الْفَتْحِ لَا يَنفَعُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُ‌وا إِيمَانُهُمْ" mean in the context of the Islamic text?

instruction: What is the background of the revelation of Surah al-Ahzab?
output: The background of the revelation of Surah al-Ahzab is the time when the Holy Prophet ﷺ migrated to Madinah. instruction: What are the two orders given to the Holy Prophet ﷺ in the opening verse of Surah al-Ahzab?
output: The two orders given to the Holy Prophet ﷺ in the opening verse of Surah al-Ahzab are (1) اِتَّقِ اللہَ (ittaqillah), that is, 'fear Allah.' (2) لَا تُطِیعِ الکَافِرِینَ (la tuti'il-kafirin), that is, 'do not obey the disbelievers.'

instruction: What is the significance of the wording of the address to the Holy Prophet ﷺ in the opening verse of Surah al-Ahzab?

instruction: What is the message conveyed in verse "And follow what is revealed to you from your Lord"?
output: The message is to follow whatever has been revealed to the person by Allah through walhy (revelation).

output: The verse was addressed to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him).

instruction: What does the verse "And place your trust in Allah and Allah is enough as a guardian" mean?
output: The verse means that one should trust only in Allah for success in one's objective, as He is the ultimate doer, maker, and fixer of all matters and things.

instruction: Is it permissible to consult with disbelievers in religious matters according to the verse?
output: No, the verse indicates that consulting with disbelievers in religious matters is not permissible.

instruction: What was the custom of "Zihar" among the disbelievers during Jahiliyyah?
output: Zihar was a custom among the disbelievers during Jahiliyyah where a person would declare his wife to be like the back of his mother, and go on to say, 'you are, for me, like the back of my mother.' This was called "Zihar." If a person who had done "Zihar" with his wife, she becomes haram (unlawful) to him forever.

instruction: What is the ruling in Islam regarding adoption of sons?
output: In Islam, a so-called or adopted son is not recognized as a 'real' son. This means that he will not be entitled to a share in inheritance with other sons, nor will the precepts of the unlawfulness of marriage apply to him. For example, the divorced wife of an adopted son is not unlawful for his so-called father.

instruction: What was the custom of mutabanna among the disbelievers during Jahiliyyah?
output: The custom of mutabanna among the disbelievers during Jahiliyyah was that one person would make the son of another his so-called or adopted son, and the boy would become known as 'his' son and would be addressed as such. According to their practice, this so-called or adopted son used to be recognized in all rules and regulations as a 'real' son, including inheritance and marriage rules.

instruction: What is the meaning of the statement: "The Prophet ﷺ is closer to the believers than their own selves"?
output: Every Muslim is duty-bound to obey and implement the command of the Holy Prophet ﷺ more than the command of his parents. If one's parents oppose any command of the Holy Prophet ﷺ, their obedience in that matter is not permissible.

instruction: What is the relationship of the blessed wives of the Holy Prophet with the believers of the Muslim community, as mentioned in the verse: وَ اَزوَاجُہُ اُمَّھَاتُھُم (and his wives are your mothers)?

instruction: What is a literal sense of the expression: اُولُوا الاَرحاَم (ulu 'l-arham) in the Qur'anic verse: اُولُوا الاَرحاَم بَعضُھُم اَولٰی بِبَعضٍ (And those having mutual kinship are closer to one another (for the purpose of inheritance)?

instruction: What is the event of the battle of al-Ahzab named after?

instruction: Who were the combined forces of disbelievers and polytheists that attacked Madinah during the battle of al-Ahzab?

instruction: What is the significance of the battle of al-Ahzab according to the Qur'an?
output: According to the Qur'an, the battle of al-Ahzab was a severe test for Muslims due to the large numerical strength and combined power of the Arab and Jewish tribes against them. instruction: What made the hypocrites question the Muslims' faith in the promises of the Prophet (PBUH)?

instruction: Who were the hypocrites in Islam as described in the text?

instruction: What is the position of the blessed wives of the Prophet as mentioned in the Qur'an?

instruction: What is the instruction contained in verse 33: "لِيُذْهِبَ عَنكُمُ الرِّجْسَ أَهْلَ الْبَيْtِ وَيُطَهِّرَ‌كُمْ تَطْهِيرً‌ا"?

instruction: What is the significance of the Dhikr (remembrance) of Allah, and why is it mentioned in the Qur'an more frequently than other acts of worship?

instruction: Who was Zayd Ibn Harithah?

instruction: What was the significance of the name "Zayd" in the Qur'an?

instruction: What was the reason for the Holy Prophet ﷺ to stop Sayyidna Zayd Ibn Harithah parser from divorcing Sayyidah Zainab bint Jahsh ؓ ?

instruction: What did the Holy Prophet ﷺ say to Sayyidna Zayd Ibn Harithah parser regarding his wife, Sayyidah Zainab bint Jahsh ؓ ?

instruction: What was the admonition revealed in the verse, "And you were concealing in your heart what Allah was going to reveal, and you were fearing people, while Allah is more entitled to be feared by you?" (33:37) ?
output: The admonition in the verse, "And you were concealing in your heart what Allah was going to reveal, and you were fearing people, while Allah is more entitled to be feared by you" (33:37), is a reprimand for hiding the intention of marrying Sayyidah Zainab bint Jahsh ؓ from the people, even though it was known to him through Divine revelation. instruction: What is the significance of the opening sentence of verse 38 in the context of the marriage between Sayyidna Zayd ؓ and Sayyidah Zainab ؓ?

instruction: Why was permission given for multiple marriages in the case of earlier prophets like Sayyidna Dawud (علیہ السلام) and Sayyidna Sulaiman (علیہ السلام)?

instruction: What does the last sentence of the text imply about the matter of nikah (marriage) and rizq (sustenance)?

instruction: What was one of the attributes of the prophets mentioned in the text?
output: One of the attributes of the prophets mentioned in the text is that they convey the messages of Allah to their respective communities without fear of anyone.

instruction: What does the term "وَيَخْشَوْنَهُ وَلَا يَخْشَوْنَ أَحَدًا إِلَّا اللَّـهَ" mean?
output: "وَيَخْشَوْنَهُ وَلَا يَخْشَوْنَ أَحَدًا إِلَّا اللَّـهَ" means that these prophets keep fearing Allah and fear none but Allah.

instruction: What is the main subject of the verse "Muhammad is not the father of any of your men."?
output: The main subject of the verse is the refutation of the claim that the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is father of any of the men and that Zayd bin Harith (the freed slave of the Prophet) is his son.

instruction: What objection is removed by adding the phrase "but a Messenger of Allah" in the verse?
output: The objection that is removed by adding the phrase "but a Messenger of Allah" is the doubt that the Holy Prophet ﷺ is the father of all the men of his Ummah, because every prophet is considered as the father of his Ummah.

instruction: What does the phrase "and the Last of the Prophets" mean in the verse?
output: The phrase "and the Last of the Prophets" means that the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is the last prophet, and no prophet will come after him. This indicates his excellence and distinction as the seal of all prophets.

instruction: What is the significance of dhikrullah (remembrance of Allah) in Islamic worship?
output: Dhikrullah is a form of worship for which there is no limit or defined quantity, no particular time or period, no defined posture or position, nor even the state of purity through ablution is required. instruction: What does the Hadith "لَا یَزَالُ لِسَانُکَ رَطباً بِذِکرِ اللہِ" mean?

instruction: What was the response of the Holy Prophet ﷺ to a Bedouin who asked for a concise and comprehensive way to practice Islam?

instruction: What does the text "And proclaim His purity at morn and eve" mean?

instruction: Are the times of 'morn' and 'eve' in the text literal or metaphorical?

instruction: Why is it important to remember Allah at 'morn' and 'eve'?

instruction: What does the term 'Salah' refer to in the verse "He is such that He and His angels send blessings to you"?
