instruction: What are the three occasions when Salam from Allah is sent, according to the text?
output: The text suggests that Salam from Allah can be sent on the Day of Judgement (Doomsday), when believers enter Paradise, and when a believer dies.

instruction: What does the term 'Shahid' refer to in the context of the Holy Prophet ﷺ?
output: 'Shahid' refers to the Holy Prophet ﷺ as a witness on the Day of Judgment, who will give testimony in favor of his Ummah.

instruction: What does the term 'Mubashshir' signify about the Holy Prophet ﷺ?
output: 'Mubashshir' signifies that the Holy Prophet ﷺ is the bearer of good news, announcing the good news of Paradise for the righteous people of his Ummah.

instruction: What does the term 'Nadhir' indicate about the role of the Holy Prophet ﷺ?
output: 'Nadhir' indicates that the Holy Prophet ﷺ warns his Ummah, putting the fear of Allah's punishment in their hearts in case they violate or disobey the injunctions of Shari'ah.

instruction: What does the phrase 'One who calls people to Allah' mean in the given text?
output: The phrase 'One who calls people to Allah' means that the Holy Prophet ﷺ calls his Ummah to believe in Allah's Being, Oneness and obedience.

instruction: What does the term 'Siraj' mean in the given text?
output: 'Siraj' means lamp.

instruction: What is the significance of the attribute of the Holy Prophet ﷺ being a luminous lamp, as stated in the text?
output: The attribute of the Holy Prophet ﷺ being a luminous lamp signifies that his blessed heart illuminates the inside of the whole world and the hearts of the faithful, just as the sun illuminates only the surface of the world.

instruction: What is the significance of the verse mentioned in the text regarding divorce?
output: The verse is a general rule regarding divorce that is applicable to all Muslims. It serves as a prologue to the special rules that are exclusive to the Holy Prophet ﷺ in matters of marriage and divorce.

instruction: What does the term "Al-khalwah As-sahihah" mean in the context of the text?
output: "Al-khalwah As-sahihah" refers to a type of privacy where the spouses meet together at a private place without any apprehension of interference by someone, and there is nothing to prevent them from having sex. If a woman is divorced before the spouses have had "Al-khalwah As-sahihah," she is not liable to any period of عِدَّة ` iddah (waiting period), which means that she can enter into another marriage immediately.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Release them gracefully" in the context of the text?
output: The phrase "Release them gracefully" imposes a restriction on the husband not to say anything harsh even verbally nor to indulge in taunts or sarcasms during the divorce process. This underscores the importance of maintaining courteous behavior and graceful discharge of social obligations during the divorce.

instruction: What is the significance of the Holy Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) being allowed to have more than four wives?
output: The Holy Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) being allowed to have more than four wives signifies his distinctive eminence and special honor. At the time of revelation of this verse, the Holy Prophet (PBUH) had more than four wives, while it is not permissible for Muslims in general to keep more than four wives at any time.

instruction: Why are the daughters of paternal uncles and aunts and the daughters of maternal uncles and aunts lawful for the Holy Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)?
output: The daughters of paternal uncles and aunts and the daughters of maternal uncles and aunts are lawful for the Holy Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) because they must have migrated with him from Makkah, not necessarily in his company or at the same time, but the condition is that they migrated at any time in accordance with his command. This condition was not applicable to other women in general - their being Muslim was enough. The wisdom in applying this condition of migration for the Holy Prophet (PBUH) was perhaps that the women of the family are proud of their family, which is unbecoming for the wife of a prophet. This propensity was taken care of by imposing the condition of migration, because only that women would migrate whose love for Allah and His Messenger (PBUH) prevails over her love for her family, home, and property. Also, one has to suffer great difficulties during migration, and these sufferings in the way of Allah have a special place in one's spiritual reform.

instruction: What is the rule regarding a Muslim husband having multiple wives in terms of distributing nights and providing means of sustenance and maintenance?
output: A Muslim husband having more than one wife must distribute his nights between his wives in equal numbers and similarly must provide means of sustenance and maintenance to each one of them equally. It is not permissible to violate the principle of equality.

instruction: Who was exempted from the rule of equality between wives according to the Holy Qur'an?
output: The Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ was exempted from the rule of equality between wives.

instruction: What was the practice of the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ in terms of maintaining equality between his wives even after the revelation of the verse that allowed him to postpone the turn of any one of his wives?
output: The Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ always maintained equality between his wives even after the revelation of the verse, and he never availed of the concession that was granted to him in practice.

instruction: What was the attitude of the enemies of Islam towards the issue of polygamy, specifically the number of wives of the Holy Prophet ﷺ?
output: The enemies of Islam have always targeted the issue of polygamy, particularly the number of wives of the Holy Prophet ﷺ, for their criticism.

instruction: Who was the first wife of the Holy Prophet ﷺ, and at what age did he marry her?
output: The first wife of the Holy Prophet ﷺ was Sayyidah Khadijah ﷺ, and he married her at the age of twenty-five.

instruction: What was the purpose of the Holy Prophet ﷺ marrying multiple wives, according to the text?
output: The purpose of the Holy Prophet ﷺ marrying multiple wives, according to the text, was not for fulfilling selfish or sexual desires. Rather, it was to attract their clans towards Islam and to contribute to the propagation and education of Islam. Additionally, it was a means to educate the wider community about the rules pertaining to the private life of a prophet and domestic affairs in Islam.

instruction: What is the context of the verses in Surah Al-Ahzab (33:53)?
output: The verses in Surah Al-Ahzab (33:53) provide etiquettes and rules for Islamic social behavior, particularly for hosts and guests, and for women in relation to men.

instruction: What does the first rule in the verse 33:53 instruct about entering the house of the Prophet (PBUH)?
output: The first rule states that one should not enter the houses of the Prophet (PBUH) unless invited or unless it is for a meal, not for waiting for its preparation.

instruction: What does the third rule in the verse 33:53 instruct about the behavior of guests after having a meal?
output: The third rule instructs that once guests have had the meal, they should disperse and not stay for long, being keen for a chat. This is to avoid causing inconvenience to the host, either due to the host wanting to get busy with his own work or because he has to serve meals to others after the guests.

instruction: What is the purpose of the verse mentioned in the text?
output: The purpose of the verse is to obligate Muslims to send Salah (durood) and Salam upon the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.

instruction: What does the word Salah mean in the context of this verse?
output: In this verse, Salah means Allah's sending of mercy, while Salam from the angels denotes their prayer for him. From common believers, the sense of Salah (durood) is a combination of dua' (prayer) and thana' (praise).

instruction: What is the significance of the command to send Salah and Salam upon the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, according to the text?
output: The significance of the command is that it indicates the great merit accredited to Muslims who send Salah and Salam as Allah Ta’ ala makes them share in doing what Allah Ta’ ala Himself does and so do His angels. It also proves the great merit of the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, as the station of the Holy Prophet ﷺ is so high that the act asked to be done by common Muslims in his respect is something already done by Allah Ta’ ala Himself as well as angels.

instruction: What did the verse 33:53 warn Muslims about?
output: The verse warned Muslims about entering the houses of the Prophet, unintentionally.

instruction: What does causing pain to Allah mean according to some Tafsir authorities?
output: According to some Tafsir authorities, causing pain to Allah means those words and deeds about which it has been specifically declared in the spoken ahadith of the Holy Prophet ﷺ that they cause pain to Allah Ta’ ala.

instruction: What is the ruling according to the verse 33:58 on causing pain to any believer?
output: Causing pain to any believer is haram (forbidden) as being a grave sin. However, it is subjected to a condition that they should not have deserved it by committing a wrongful act.

instruction: What did the hypocrites do to the Muslim women that caused pain to them and the Prophet (PBUH)?
output: They molested bondwomen from Muslim homes when they went out for chores, and on occasions, they mistreated free women under the impression that they were bondwomen.

instruction: What is the difference between free women and bondwomen in terms of hijab according to Islamic law?
output: Free women are required to cover their faces with a long sheet pulled from over their head downwards before their face, while bondwomen were allowed to leave their faces open, as their job was to serve their masters, which took them out of the home repeatedly.

instruction: What did the Prophet (PBUH) and the Muslims threaten to do to the hypocrites who failed to abstain from their low behavior towards the Muslim women?
output: They threatened to punish them in this world, in addition to the torment of the Hereafter, for their low behavior towards the Muslim women.

instruction: What is the punishment for an apostate in Islam?
output: An apostate (murtadd) is killed in punishment.

instruction: Who are the hypocrites mentioned in the text?
output: The hypocrites are those who call themselves Muslims but demonstrate open hostility to and denial of Islam.

instruction: What is the law for disbelievers in the Shari’ ah of Islam?
output: They should first be invited to embrace Islam along with sincere efforts to remove any doubts they may have. If, even then, they elect not to enter the fold of Islam, they should be asked to live as Dhimmi subjects of the Muslim state. If they accept that, the protection of their life, property and honor becomes obligatory on Muslims very much like that of Muslims themselves. If they do not accept this too, and choose the option of fighting, then, the command is to fight back against them.

instruction: What does the verse warn about for those who deny the Hereafter?
output: The verse warns about curse and punishment in the present world and in the Hereafter for those who deny the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the significance of Qiyamah's being declared as close?
output: The Qiyamah being declared as close signifies that nobody knows the exact date of the Doomsday, and everyone should be prepared for it as if it were very close, and after facing the horrible incidents of Qiyamah, the entire worldly life of thousands of years will seem to be very short (and the Qiyamah very close to it).

instruction: What was the mocking question asked by the disbelievers regarding Qiyamah?
output: The disbelievers mockingly asked, "When would that Qiyamah come?" in their own place.

instruction: What extraordinary event occurred to Prophet Musa (Peace be upon him) to prove Allah's special care for him?
output: Allah Ta'ala demonstrated exceptional care by making a rock run away with Prophet Musa's clothes, causing him to appear before the people undressed.

instruction: What does the Hadith of Bukhari prove about Prophets according to the text?
output: The Hadith of Bukhari proves that all prophets are lineally high-born, as it is hard for people to listen, accept and follow someone from the line and family regarded by people as customarily low.

instruction: Why cannot the case of Prophet Ayyub (Peace be upon him) be used to raise any objection about the bodies of prophets being free from defects?
output: What happened to Prophet Ayyub was a dictate of Divine wisdom, a particular trial, a temporary discomfort which was eliminated later on, and it was not a permanent physical defect.

instruction: What does the Qur'anic verse discussed indicate about the importance of controlling one's speech?
output: The verse indicates that controlling one's speech is crucial for the correction and reform of one's deeds and for the achievement of Taqwa, which is the essence of the Islamic religion.

instruction: What promise is made to those who gain control over their speech in the verse discussed?
output: The promise made to those who gain control over their speech is that Allah will correct their deeds and make them better, as well as forgive any errors or slips made therein.

instruction: What is the connection between speaking the right thing and observing Taqwa?
output: Speaking the right thing is an important means of observing Taqwa, as it leads to the correction and betterment of one's deeds in both this world and the Hereafter.

instruction: What does the word "amanah" mean in this particular context?
output: "Amanah" in this context refers to the entire package of all obligations and prohibitions set by the Shari’ ah, which includes religious conduct, legal obligations, protection of chastity, properties held under trust, removal of impurity through having bath, Salah, Zakah, Fasting, Hajj etc.

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "ma'lumun" in this verse?
output: In this context, "ma'lumun" refers to the known station of the individuals mentioned in the verse.

instruction: What was the response of the heavens, the earth, and the mountains when Allah Ta'ala offered the trust (amanah)?
output: They were unable to bear the burden of the trust and declined the offer due to fear of not being able to fulfill its due right.

instruction: What is the meaning of the lam used in the beginning of Verse 73 of Surah Al-Ahzab in Arabic linguistics?
output: The lam used in the beginning of Verse 73 of Surah Al-Ahzab, in Arabic linguistics, points out to the end of something, as it appears in a line of Arabic poetry which reads:لِدُوا لِلمَوتِ وَ ابنُوا لِلخَرَابِ, which means that the end of everyone born is death and the end of every building is falling into ruins.

instruction: What is the purpose or aim of the verse as per the text?
output: The purpose or aim of the verse is that, as a result of man's assumption of responsibility for the trust, mankind will split in two groups: (1) Disbelievers, hypocrites and others who will rebel against Divine orders and become wasters of the great 'trust'. They will be punished. (2) There will be believing men and believing women who, through their obedience to Divine injunctions, will fulfill the dictates of the trust reposed in them. They will be treated with mercy and forgiveness.

instruction: Who are the individuals to whom the words Zalum and Jahul, as reported in the Tafsir, particularly refer to?
output: The words Zalum and Jahul, as reported in the Tafsir, particularly refer to those individuals who wasted away the Divine trust reposed in them.

instruction: What does the lam at the beginning of the verse (73) signify in Arabic linguistics?
output: The lam at the beginning of the verse (73) signifies the end of something, as it appears in a line of Arabic poetry which reads:لِدُوا لِلمَوتِ وَ ابنُوا لِلخَرَابِ'Be born only to be dead and build only to be ruined'.

instruction: What does the verse (73) imply about the outcome of the people mentioned in the verse?
output: The verse (73) implies that Allah will punish the hypocrites, men and women, and the Mushriks, men and women, and will accept the repentance of the believing men and women.

instruction: What does the verse (73) imply about the two groups that mankind will split into?
output: The verse (73) implies that mankind will split in two groups: (1) Disbelievers, hypocrites and others who will rebel against Divine orders and become wasters of the great 'trust'. They will be punished. (2) There will be believing men and believing women who, through their obedience to Divine injunctions, will fulfill the dictates of the trust reposed in them. They will be treated with mercy and forgiveness.

instruction: What attribute of Allah is emphasized in the Islamic text?
output: The attribute of Allah emphasized in the Islamic text is His all-encompassing knowledge and knowledge of the unseen.

instruction: What is the purpose of emphasizing Allah's knowledge of the unseen in the text?
output: The purpose of emphasizing Allah's knowledge of the unseen in the text is to refute the disbelievers' rejection of the Day of Resurrection, showing that Allah's comprehensive knowledge includes the knowledge of the unseen, including the collection and re-assembly of scattered human particles on the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: Why was it difficult for the disbelievers to accept the Day of Resurrection?
output: The disbelievers found it difficult to accept the Day of Resurrection because they had taken Allah's knowledge and power on the analogy of their own, and they could not comprehend how the scattered particles of humans could be collected and reconstituted.

instruction: What is the purpose of Al-Qiyamah (Doomsday)?
output: The purpose of Al-Qiyamah is to reward believers and provide them with the best sustenance from Jannah (Paradise).

instruction: What does the sentence "لِّيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا" mean?
output: "لِّيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا" means "So that He rewards those who believed."

instruction: Why is Al-Qiyamah (Doomsday) bound to come?
output: Al-Qiyamah is bound to come as a means to reward believers and provide them with the best sustenance from Jannah (Paradise).

instruction: What is the claim being questioned in the text?
output: The claim being questioned in the text is that all totally disintegrated particles of the body will stand reassembled together, turn into the human body once again, and be alive as well.

instruction: What do the speaker's words suggest about the claim made by the Prophet?
output: The speaker's words suggest that the claim made by the Prophet (PBUH) is either a deliberate attempt to fabricate a lie against Allah or the person who says so is insane, and no premise of his statement is correct.

instruction: What is the implied reasoning behind the speaker's accusation?
output: The implied reasoning behind the speaker's accusation is that the idea is so unreasonable, to start with, that there remains practically no question of entertaining or accepting it.

instruction: What does the word 'fadl' denote in the opening sentence of verse 10 of Surah Al-Sajdah?
output: The word 'fadl' denotes excess, favor, or grace.

instruction: What is the significance of the mountains and birds in the story of Prophet Dawud (as)?
output: The mountains and birds were blessed to join Prophet Dawud (as) in reciting the praise of Allah (tasbih) as a special miracle shown at his hands.

instruction: How did Prophet Dawud (as) communicate with the mountains and birds?
output: Prophet Dawud (as) communicated with the mountains and birds by making them synchronize their voice with his and repeat the Tasbih after him, not in the manner sound reverberates, but as a special gift and grace bestowed upon him.

instruction: Who was Sulayman (علیہ السلام) and what was his miracle?
output: Sulayman (علیہ السلاam) was a prophet of Allah, and his miracle was the subjugation of the wind. The wind would carry his throne from morning till afternoon for a travel distance of one month, and in the evening till late night for another month.

instruction: What happened to Sayyidna Sulayman (علیہ السلام) due to his horses and how was he blessed?
output: Sayyidna Sulayman (علیہ السلاam) missed his Asr prayer while inspecting his horses. Therefore, he sacrificed his horses by slaughtering them, and Allah Ta’ ala blessed him with a better ride as a reward.

instruction: What does the Jinn's work before Sayyidna Sulayman (علیہ السلام) signify?
output: The Jinns who worked before Sayyidna Sulayman (علیہ السلاam) were made subservient to him by the command of Allah, and they did the chores he assigned to them before him.

instruction: What does the word "maharib" in the text refer to?
output: The noblest part of a house or a mansion.

instruction: What is the plural form of the word "tamathil" in the text?
output: Timthal.

instruction: What is the word "tamathil" in the Arabic Lexicon?
output: A picture.

instruction: What was the unusual event of the death of Sayyidna Sulayman (علیہ السلام)?
output: The unusual event of the death of Sayyidna Sulayman (علیہ السلام) was that he remained standing in a posture of worship for over a year, supported by his staff, even after his death, to ensure the completion of the construction of Baytul-Maqdis and to let people know the real nature of the Jinns.

instruction: What was the purpose of the staff (minsa'ah) held by Sayyidna Sulayman (علیہ السلام) during his unusual death?
output: The staff (minsa'ah) held by Sayyidna Sulayman (علیہ السلام) during his unusual death was used to maintain his poise and to ward off the Jinns who might have come close to him.

instruction: What did the Jinns find out when they came to know about the death of Sayyidna Sulayman (علیہ السلام)?
output: When the Jinns came to know about the death of Sayyidna Sulayman (علیہ السلام), they found out that they were no possessors of the knowledge of the unseen, as they had not been aware of his death more than a year ago, which could have saved them from the hard labor they were doing on the assumption that he was alive.

instruction: What is the meaning of `arim' in the context of the Qur'an as explained by the scholars of tafsir?
output: The meaning of `arim' in the context of the Qur'an, as explained by the scholars of tafsir, is a dam that is made to block water.

instruction: What was the purpose of the dam of Ma'arib built by the people of Saba' mentioned in the Qur'anic verse 16?
output: The purpose of the dam of Ma'arib built by the people of Saba' was to store water for irrigation of their farms and gardens.

instruction: Which two cities are referred to as 'Two gardens' in verse 15 of the Qur'anic verse 34?
output: The two cities referred to as 'Two gardens' in verse 15 of the Qur'anic verse 34 are the twin rows of gardens fed by canals of water by the city of Ma'arib.

instruction: What is the meaning of the term 'Kufr' in Islamic texts?
output: Kufr has two meanings. It could mean ungratefulness and it could mean the denial of the true faith.

instruction: Who were the people punished in the Qur'anic verse ذَٰلِكَ جَزَيْنَاهُم بِمَا كَفَرُ‌وا (Thus We punished them because of their ungratefulness.- 34:17)?
output: The people referred to in this verse are the people of Saba'.

instruction: What is the significance of the term 'Kafur' in the Qur'anic verse وَهَلْ نُجَازِي إِلَّا الْكَفُورَ‌ (And We do not give (such a) punishment but to the ungrateful - 34:17)?
output: The term 'Kafur' in this verse signifies one who is very ungrateful or is an absolute disbeliever, and the verse could be taken to mean: 'We do not punish anyone other than the one who is very ungrateful or is an absolute disbeliever.' However, it does not signify punishment in an absolute sense, instead, it means a mass punishment as was sent over the people of Saba'. Such punishment does not befall Muslim sinners.

instruction: What do the towns mentioned in the verse refer to?
output: The towns mentioned in the verse refer to the rural areas of the country of Syria.

instruction: What was the blessing Allah bestowed upon the people of Saba'?
output: Allah bestowed the blessing of making their travels to the towns of Syria very easy for them during their business trips.

instruction: What does the phrase "Travel along them at nights and days peacefully" imply?
output: It implies that the travelers could travel at any time of the night or day without any hesitation or concern due to the secure routes and the equal and balanced distances between the settlements.

instruction: What was the prayer of the people of Saba' regarding travel that led to their destruction?
output: They prayed to Allah to make the distances they cover in travel longer, hoping for hard areas of travel like forests or wilderness, due to their lack of recognition and straight ungratefulness for the blessing of Allah placed there to eliminate the hardships of travel.

instruction: What is the meaning of the word 'mazzaqnahum' in the text, and what was the ultimate consequence of the punishment released on the people of Saba'?
output: 'Mazzaqnahum' is a derivation from 'tamziq', meaning to tear and scatter (a people) or to destroy (a kingdom). The ultimate consequence of the punishment released on the people of Saba' was that they were virtually expunged from this world, leaving nothing but idle tales of their wealth and luxury.

instruction: What was the advice of the soothsayer to his people before the flood of the dam hit them, and where did different groups of his people settle down after following his advice?
output: The soothsayer advised his people to sell all their property, move to safe far-away places immediately. The tribe of Azd went towards Amman, the Ghassan to Busra in the country of Syria, and the Aws and Khazraj and Banu ` Uthman started off in the direction of Yathrib (Madinah). After reaching Batn Murr, Banu ` Uthman liked the place and settled right there. As for Aws and Khazraj, they reached Yathrib and stayed there. After the long narrative in Ibn Kathir, the same detail about people scattering to different places has been reported on the authority of Said from Qatadah from al-Sha'bi.

instruction: What was the belief of the first group of idol-worshippers that the Quran refutes?
output: The first group of idol-worshippers believed that their idols were the partners of Allah in His powers and associates in His divine attributes.

instruction: What was the belief of the second group of idol-worshippers that the Quran refutes?
output: The second group of idol-worshippers believed that their idols were helpers of Allah in managing the affairs of the universe.

instruction: What belief about idols does the Quran refute in verse 23?
output: The belief that idols are so close to Allah that their intercession is always approved by Him, and whoever has the advantage of their intercession, his desires may well be fulfilled.

instruction: What was the primary purpose of Allah's address to the polytheists and disbelievers in verse 34:24?
output: The primary purpose of Allah's address to the polytheists and disbelievers in verse 34:24 was to make it clear that they were ignorant and astray in bypassing Allah and electing to worship idols and shaitans.

instruction: How was the address to the disbelieving adversaries in verse 34:24 different from the usual address?
output: The address to the disbelieving adversaries in verse 34:24 was different from the usual address in that they were not called kafirs, infidels, disbelievers or the ones gone astray. Instead, a change was introduced in the mode and content of the address.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "you think and you decide as to who is on the side of truth. Is it we or is it you?" in verse 34:24?
output: The phrase "you think and you decide as to who is on the side of truth. Is it we or is it you?" signifies that the decision regarding who is on the right path or in error is left to the addressees. This approach was kept so affectionate and disarming that it would make even the most diehard adversary left with no choice but to consider what was being proposed.

instruction: Who was the Holy Prophet sent as a messenger to?
output: The Holy Prophet was sent as a messenger to all peoples of the world who are there now or will come in the future.

instruction: What is the significance of the word 'Kaaffah' in the verse "كَافَّةً لِلنَاس Kaaffatal-lin-naas"?
output: The word 'Kaaffah' in the verse "كَافَّةً لِلنَاس Kaaffatal-lin-naas" signifies universality and inclusiveness of the mission of the Last Rasul of Allah, without the exclusion of anyone from it.

instruction: What sets the mission of the Holy Prophet apart from the missions of other prophets sent before him?
output: The mission of the Holy Prophet ﷺ is common and open to all peoples of the world, while the mission of other prophets was restricted to some particular people and particular geographical area. Furthermore, the mission of the Holy Prophet is applicable to all human generations up to the last day of Qiyamah, whereas the missions of other prophets were limited to their specific times.

instruction: What is the age-old shaitanic illusion that the Qur'an refutes?
output: The age-old shaitanic illusion that the Qur'an refutes is the belief that taking worldly riches and honors as a proof of being loved by Allah is valid.

instruction: Who were the people that opposed the prophets and the pious people, and why?
output: The people who opposed the prophets and the pious people were those who were intoxicated with material wealth and luxury. They opposed the prophets and the pious people because they were not following their ways, and they used this wealth and power as a proof of being loved by Allah.

instruction: What is the significance of the cited verse (34:34) in the Qur'an?
output: The cited verse (34:34) in the Qur'an signifies that whenever Allah has sent a messenger, the rich and luxurious people of the community have always confronted him with a flat denial of his mission.

instruction: What is the message conveyed in the verse of Surah al-Mu'minun (23:55, 56) about wealth and children?
output: The message is that wealth and children that make people neglect Allah become a curse for them, and they do not understand the reality.

instruction: What is the purpose of the wealth and children according to the verse of Surah At-Taubah (9:85)?
output: The purpose of the wealth and children is that Allah wants to punish the disbelievers with these in this world.

instruction: What is the significance of the saying of the Holy Prophet ﷺ narrated by Sayyidna Abu Hurairah ؓ  about Allah Ta’ ala?
output: The saying signifies that Allah Ta’ ala does not see people or their wealth, but He sees their hearts and their deeds.

instruction: What is the meaning of the term "ضِعْف" in the Islamic text?
output: The term "ضِعْف" in the Islamic text is a verbal noun which means 'like a thing' or 'the likes of a thing'.

instruction: What does the term "غُرُفَات" denote in the Islamic text?
output: The term "غُرُفَات" in the Islamic text denotes a part of the mansion considered distinct and high as compared to other parts.

instruction: What is the state of the people of faith and good deeds according to the Islamic text?
output: The people of faith and good deeds, as per the Islamic text, will have their return for their deeds multiplied many times over in the Hereafter and will reside in the elevated chambers of Paradise in perfect peace and forever shielded against all sorrows.

instruction: What does the phrase "Min 'ibadihi" in the verse imply?
output: The phrase "Min 'ibadihi" implies that this rule of guidance has been put forth for the believers.

instruction: According to the verse, what is the purpose of this rule of guidance?
output: The purpose of this rule of guidance is to alert people of faith that they should not start loving wealth and comfort to the extent that their hearts choke when it comes to spending at occasions and on rights enjoined by Allah Ta’ ala.

instruction: What is the meaning of the sentence "وَمَا أَنفَقْتُم مِّن شَيْءٍ فَهُوَ يُخْلِفُهُ" in the verse?

instruction: What is the method of acquiring the gifts of grace and honor from Allah as mentioned in the verse 10 of Surah Fatihah?

instruction: What are the two parts of the prescription for becoming a recipient of honor from Allah, as mentioned in the verse 10 of Surah Fatihah?
output: The two parts of the prescription for becoming a recipient of honor from Allah, as mentioned in Surah Fatihah's verse 10, are good word (the kalimah of tauhid and other words of remembrance and glorification of Allah) and good deeds, which include belief by heart, prayers, fasting, abstinence from forbidden and reprehensible things, and other acts of obedience to Allah.

instruction: How does the good deed uplift the good word, as mentioned in the verse 10 of Surah Fatihah?

instruction: What is the general understanding of the verse وَمَا يُعَمَّرُ‌ مِن مُّعَمَّرٍ‌ وَلَا يُنقَصُ مِنْ عُمُرِ‌هِ إِلَّا فِي كِتَابٍ (And no aged person is made to advance in age, nor a part is curtailed from his age, but all this is (recorded) in a book - 35:11), according to the majority of Muslim commentators?
output: The general understanding is that if Allah blesses a person with a long age, it is already on record in the Preserved Tablet (al-lawh al-mahfuz). Similarly, when the age of a certain person is kept at a lower mark in terms of the number of years, that too already stands recorded in al-lawh al-mahfuz. The statement relates to humankind as a whole, in the sense that some individuals from it are given long ages and others, a comparatively shorter ones.

instruction: What do some early commentators say about the length of age mentioned in the verse وَمَا يُعَمَّرُ‌ مِن مُّعَمَّarٍ‌ وَلَا يُنقَصُ مِنْ عُمُرِ‌هِ إِلَّا فِي كِتَابٍ (And no aged person is made to advance in age, nor a part is curtailed from his age, but all this is (recorded) in a book - 35:11)?
output: Some early commentators say that if the length of age concerns one single person, then, decrease in age would mean that the age of every person as already written by Allah Ta’ ala is certain, and every day that passes decreases one day from this pre-fixed age. If two days pass, two days decrease. In the same way, every day, in fact, every single breath keeps decreasing one's age.

instruction: What does the Hadith "مَن سَرَّہ، اَن یُبسَطَ لَہ، فِی رِزقِہٖ وَ یُنسَأ فِی اَثَرہٖ فَلیَصِلَ رَحمَۃ" mean according to Imam an-Nasa`i (رح)?
output: The Hadith means: 'He who wishes that his sustenance and age is increased should treat his close relatives well (Silatu-r-rahim).' This obviously suggests that these deeds increase one's age. However, another Hadith given below has itself clarified its sense: the increase in age means that Allah Ta` ala blesses one with good children who keep praying for him. This person is not there anymore, but he keeps receiving their prayers in his grave (that is, he keeps on receiving the benefits one would have received if one were alive. Thus, in a way, his age has increased.

instruction: What does the verse "And the sun is quickly proceeding towards its resting place. That is the designing of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing." (Ya Sin, 36:38) mean according to some respected commentators?

When that is arrived at, this solar system and the movement will stop, end - and that is the Day of Qiyamah (Day of Resurrection).

instruction: What is the meaning of the word "ajalim-musamma" in the verse "He created the heavens and the earth in His wisdom. instruction: What does the verse "إِنَّمَا أَمْرُ‌هُ إِذَا أَرَ‌ادَ شَيْئًا أَن يَقُولَ لَهُ كُن فَيَكُونُ" (His practice, when He intends to do something, is no more than He says, "Be", and it comes to be) mean?
output: This verse implies that when Allah intends to create something, He has no need to follow the way things are made by human beings who have to collect raw materials, assemble technicians, and work for a certain period of time until the thing is ready. Instead, when He intends to create something, for Him it is sufficient to give the command: "Be." Right then, the thing so commanded comes into existence.

instruction: Does this verse suggest that the creation of everything should always be instant?

instruction: What is the meaning of 'known provision' in the verse أُولَـٰئِكَ لَهُمْ رِ‌زْقٌ مَّعْلُومٌ?
output: The 'known provision' refers to the detailed description of the provisions of Paradise mentioned in different Surahs of the Qur'an, or it refers to the provision that will be bestowed punctually all mornings and evenings, or it means that this provision will be certain and everlasting, unlike the worldly provision.

instruction: What are the three different interpretations of 'known provision'?
output: The three different interpretations of 'known provision' are: (1) it refers to the detailed description of the provisions of Paradise mentioned in different Surahs of the Qur'an, (2) 'known provision' means that its timings are determined and known, that is, it will be bestowed punctually all mornings and evenings, and (3) 'known provision' means that this provision will be certain and everlasting, unlike the worldly provision.

instruction: Why is the provision of Paradise called 'known provision'?
output: The provision of Paradise is called 'known provision' because it will be certain and everlasting, unlike the worldly provision where no one can say with any degree of certainty what and how much of that provision he or she is going to get; nor does anyone know how long his provision will remain available to him or her. Every human heart is all the time under the fear that the blessings he has may disappear in future- may be, comes a tomorrow and they are no more there. Jannah will be free of this danger. Instead, the provision of Paradise will be certain and everlasting, both.

instruction: What does the Qur'an describe as 'rizq' (provision)?
output: Fruits, as explained in the Qur'an by the word 'fawakih' which denotes everything eaten for taste and not to remove hunger.

instruction: What does the word 'fakihah' denote according to Imam Razi?
output: According to Imam Razi, the sense of 'fakihah' is much wider than that of fruit. It includes all kinds of food and cuisine, and the cuisine offered in Jannah will be for the taste of it, and not for removing hunger.

instruction: What does the Qur'anic verse 'وَهُم مُّكْرَ‌مُونَ' (wa hum mukramun) imply?
output: This verse implies that the provision in Jannah will be presented to the people of Jannah with full protocol of hospitality and honor, for an absence of it would render even the most delicious offering remain without relish, and that the right of a guest includes not just feeding but also the warmth of hospitality and the according of honor to a guest.

instruction: What is the simile used in verse 49 of the Quran to describe the women of Jannah?
output: The women of Jannah have been likened to hidden eggs.

instruction: Why were eggs used as a simile for the women of Jannah in Islamic tradition?
output: The egg hidden under feathers remains safe from pollution, and its color is yellowish white, which was deemed by the Arabs as the most attractive color for women.

instruction: What is another interpretation of the simile used in verse 49 of the Quran for the women of Jannah?
output: Some commentators interpret the simile to relate to the membrane hidden in the egg, and the sense is that the skin of those women will be as soft as the membrane of the eggs.

instruction: Who is the person mentioned in the Quran who will recall a disbelieving acquaintance in Jannah?
output: A believer who was a partner in business with a disbeliever and gave away all his wealth in charity for the sake of the Hereafter.

instruction: Who is the disbelieving acquaintance of the person in question 1?
output: The disbelieving partner in the business of the person in question 1.

instruction: What is the purpose of mentioning this event in the Quran?
output: To emphasize the importance of being cautious when choosing friends and relationships, as bad company can lead one to destruction in the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the occasion that makes the person in the story exclaim "Is it that we do not have to die anymore"?
output: The occasion is the person's entry into Paradise and experiencing the immense blessings of eternal life.

instruction: What does the exclamation "Is it that we do not have to die anymore" indicate about the person's state of mind?
output: The exclamation indicates that the person is so delighted with the blessings of Paradise that it seems unbelievable to him, as if he does not believe his eyes.

instruction: What is the main lesson that the Qur'an wants us to learn from this event?
output: The main lesson is that we should strive and work hard to achieve similar blessings in the afterlife, as indicated by the phrase "For this kind (of achievement), all workers must work."

instruction: What is the tree of Zaqqum?
output: The tree of Zaqquum is a tree by the name of Zaqqum, found in the territory of Tihamah, a part of the Arabian Peninsula.

instruction: Is Zaqqum the same tree found in other barren deserts?
output: Yes, some say that the tree of Zaqqum is also found in other barren deserts.

instruction: Is the Zaqqum of Jahannam an entirely different thing or is it the same as the earthly Zaqqum?
output: Some commentators differ in this matter. While some support the view that it is what is found growing in this world, others suggest that the zaqqum of Jahannam is an entirely different thing, with nothing in common with the earthly zaqqum.

instruction: What does the term 'fitnah' mean according to most commentators in the Islamic text?
output: According to most commentators, 'fitnah' in the Islamic text means 'trial' or 'test'.

instruction: What was the purpose of Allah according to the Islamic text when referring to the tree of zaqqum as a 'fitnah'?
output: The purpose of Allah, according to the Islamic text, was to test as to who believes in the existence of the tree of zaqqum and who ridicules it.

instruction: What did Abu Jahl and his accomplices do in response to the mention of the tree of zaqqum in the Qur'an?
output: In response to the mention of the tree of zaqqum in the Qur'an, Abu Jahl and his accomplices ridiculed the prophet of Islam by saying they knew zaqqum as the name of butter-topped dates and offered it to eat.

instruction: What does the verse "إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُ‌جُ فِي أَصْلِ الْجَحِيمِ" (That is a tree that comes out in the bottom of Jahannam - 37:64) refer to?
output: The verse refers to a tree that grows in the bottom of Jahannam.

instruction: What misconception does the verse refute by stating that the tree comes out in the bottom of Jahannam?
output: The verse refutes the misconception that the tree in question is a common tree like date and butter.

instruction: How does the tree in question survive in fire, when it is a tree?
output: The tree in question does not burn in fire but is nurtured by it, having properties that make it grow in such conditions.

instruction: What is the literal translation of the phrase 'طَلْعُهَا كَأَنَّهُ رُ‌ءُوسُ الشَّيَاطِينِ' in the text?
output: The literal translation of the phrase 'طَلْعُهَا كَأَنَّهُ رُ‌ءُوسُ الشَّيَاطِينِ' in the text is 'Its fruits are like the heads of the shaitans.'

instruction: What does the phrase 'الشَّيَاطِينِ' in the text refer to?
output: The phrase 'الشَّيَاطِينِ' in the text refers to the satans or the devil.

instruction: How do some commentators interpret the phrase 'الشَّيَاطِينِ' in the text?
output: Some commentators interpret the phrase 'الشَّayَاطِينِ' in the text as 'serpents' since the fruit of zaqqum resembles the hood of the serpent. However, most commentators interpret it in its well-recognized sense, meaning that the fruit of zaqqum is like the head of the satans.

instruction: What does verse 77 of the Qur'an signify according to most commentators?
output: Verse 77 of the Qur'an signifies that the majority of world population was annihilated in the great flood during the time of Prophet Noah, and all races in the entire world originated from the three sons of Prophet Noah.

instruction: Who were the three sons of Prophet Noah, and from which regions did their progenies originate?
output: The three sons of Prophet Noah were Sam, Ham, and Yafith. Sam's children were the forbears of the peoples of Arabia and Persia, Ham's children were the forbears of the peoples of African countries, and some scholars have included the people of India in the same racial stock. Yafith's children came from whom came the races known as Turk, Mongol, and Gog and Magog.

instruction: According to some scholars, did the Great Flood during the time of Prophet Noah cover the entire world or just Arabia?
output: According to some scholars, the Great Flood during the time of Prophet Noah was restricted to the land of ancient Arabia, and it was only in that land area where the progeny of Prophet Noah flourished and survived, and it was through them that the Arab race came. However, this view is considered weak compared to the mainstream view that the Flood was worldwide.

instruction: Who was Sayyidna Nuh (علیہ السلام) and why is he significant in Islamic history?
output: Sayyidna Nuh (علیہ السلام) was a prophet sent by Allah to guide his people. He is significant in Islamic history because he was the first prophet to whom Surah Al-Isra was revealed, and his mission to guide humanity was so revered that even after his death, those who were born after him continued to pray for his peace and well-being right through the last day of Qiyamah.

instruction: How did people who were born after Sayyidna Nuh (علیہ السلام) show their reverence for him?
output: People who were born after Sayyidna Nuh (علیہ السلام) showed their reverence for him by continuing to pray for his peace and well-being right through the last day of Qiyamah, a practice that is referred to as Salam be on Nuh (علیہ السلام).

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Salam be on Nuh (علیہ السلام)" in Islamic belief?
output: The phrase "Salam be on Nuh (علیہ السلاam)" signifies that Nuh (علیہ السلام) is so revered in the sight of those who were born after him that they continue to pray for his peace and well-being right through the last day of Qiyamah. This practice is a testament to the high esteem in which Nuh (علیہ السلاam) is held in Islamic belief. Additionally, all religions with attribution to Divine Scriptures subscribe to the mission of Sayyidna Nuh (علیہ السلاam) as a prophet and hold him in great reverence, with both Muslims, Jews, and Christians regarding him as being their spiritual leader.

instruction: What is the significance of the word "شِيعَتِهِ" (shi'atihi) in verse 83 of Surah Al-Kahf?
output: The word "شِيعَتِهِ" (shi'atihi) refers to a group or party that individuals from which are similar to each other in basic concepts and methods. In the context of Surah Al-Kahf, it refers to the adherents of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام), who followed his teachings and were similar to him in their beliefs and practices.

instruction: Who did Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) follow, according to the details in Surah Al-Kahf?
output: According to Surah Al-Kahf, Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیه السلام) followed the way of Sayyidna Nuh (علیه السلام), the prophet preceding him. This indicates a perfect agreement between them on the basic principles of faith.

instruction: What does the term "شِيعَتِهِ" (shi'atihi) not imply, according to the explanation in Kashshaf?
output: According to the explanation in Kashshaf, "شِيعَتِهِ" (shi'atihi) does not imply that the religious codes followed by Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیه السلام) and Sayyidna Nuh (عليه السلام) were exactly the same, but it is possible that they were similar. Additionally, it is suggested that there was a gap of two thousand six hundred and forty years between them, and there was no prophet except Sayyidna Hud and Sayyidna Salih (علیہ السلام) during this period.

instruction: What was the purpose behind Ibrahim (as) casting a look at the stars before refusing his people's invitation to their festival?
output: The purpose was to let his people understand that the statement being given by Ibrahim (as) about his indisposition was not something unfounded, instead, what he was saying was being said on the basis of his assessment of the movement of stars.

instruction: What was the status of astrology in Islam?
output: The status of astrology in Islam is that events and revolutions of the world depend on Allah Ta’alah alone and stars are not the sole effective agents in the case of all successes and failures. However, some properties and effects in the position, movement, rising and setting of stars might affect human lives. But, acquiring the knowledge of astrology in order to pursue and discover these effects, and then placing reliance on this knowledge, and then issuing decrees for the future on that basis is prohibited in Islam.

instruction: What was the Islamic legal ruling on equivocation (tauriyah)?
output: Resorting to tauriyah on occasions of need is permissible in Islam. One form of tauriyah is verbal, that is, saying something the apparent sense of which is counter to the actual fact, while the inward sense corresponds to it. Then there is the practical tauriyah, that is, to act in a manner that makes the onlooker interpret one’s intention in a certain way while, in reality, one’s intention is quite different. This is also known as 'Istikharah'.

instruction: What event in the life of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) is described in the Islamic text?
output: The event of the sacrifice of his first-born son in the way of Allah.

instruction: What does the phrase "I am going to my Lord" mean in the context of the text?
output: It means that Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) will leave the abode of disbelief and go to a place where he will be able to worship his Lord in peace.

instruction: Who accompanied Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) on his journey, as mentioned in the text?

instruction: What was the dream shown to Prophet Ibrahim (A.S) and why was it considered a test for him?
output: The dream shown to Prophet Ibrahim (A.S) was that he was slaughtering his firstborn son, Ismail (A.S). This dream was a test for him because it could have a lot of room for interpretations and excuses by the human self. However, Prophet Ibrahim (A.S) did not take to the way of excuses, but rather, he obeyed the command of his Lord without hesitation.

instruction: Why was it important for Prophet Ibrahim (A.S) to consult his son before slaughtering him?
output: Prophet Ibrahim (A.S) consulted his son to test his son's readiness to face the trial, and to let him become aware of the command of Allah in advance, so that he is all prepared to endure the pain of being slaughtered well before the zero hour comes.

instruction: What was the response of Prophet Ismail (A.S) when asked about the dream shown to his father, and why was it significant?
output: Prophet Ismail (A.S) responded by saying, "0 my dear father, do what you have been ordered to do." This statement provides an evidence of the unique passion of Prophet Ismail (A.S) to surrender his life in the way of Allah, and also shows the kind of intelligence and knowledge Allah Ta’ ala had blessed him with at such a tender age. Prophet Ismail (A.S) understood that the dream of a prophet is a revelation (wahy) and this dream too was, in reality, a form of Divine command.

instruction: What does the word "aslama" in verse 103 mean in the Islamic text provided?
output: The word "aslama" in verse 103 means to submit, bow down, become obedient, and to carry out the command.

instruction: What hint is given in the Islamic text about the act of self-submission of the father and son mentioned in verse 103?
output: The text hints towards the uniqueness of the bold initiative of self-submission undertaken by the father and son - a self-submission so unique that words fail to convey a fuller description.

instruction: According to the Islamic text, how did Sayyidna Ismail (علیہ السلام) ask his father to perform the act of sacrifice?
output: Sayyidna Ismail (علیہ السلام) asked his father to tie him well, keep his dress protected, sharpen the knife, and run it fast over his throat, so that his last breath comes easy. He also requested his father to pay his respects to his mother and, if he wished, to take his shirt to her.

instruction: Who was called out by Allah after accomplishing a task entrusted to him in obedience?

instruction: What was shown in the dream about Ibrahim (Abraham) as a sign that he did the task perfectly?

instruction: Who was the son of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلاam) who was commanded to be slaughtered?
output: The Qur'anic text does not give a clear answer to this question. It is a matter of debate among Islamic scholars and commentators. However, most of the Tafsir literature and Hadith narrations point towards Sayyidna Ismail (علیہ السلام) being the son who was commanded to be slaughtered.

instruction: What is the difference of opinion among commentators regarding the identity of the son of Sayyidna Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) who was commanded to be slaughtered?
output: Some commentators suggest that the son who was to be slaughtered was Sayyidna Ismail (علیہ السلام), while others argue that it was Sayyidna Ishaq (علیہ السلام).

instruction: What is the basis of the argument that the son who was commanded to be slaughtered was Sayyidna Ismail (علیہ السلام)?
output: The argument is based on several factors: (1) The Qur'anic verse 37:102 mentions the birth of Sayyidna Ishaq (علیہ السلام) as a prophet after the event of the sacrifice. (2) The glad tidings of the birth of Sayyidna Ishaq (علیہ السلاam) were given after the event of the sacrifice, indicating that the son who was sacrificed was not Sayyidna Ishaq. (3) The prophecy of the long life of Sayyidna Ishaq (علیہ السلام) and his offspring being a nation of kings was given before the event of the sacrifice, making it impossible for the son who was sacrificed to be Sayyidna Ishaq. (4) The event of the sacrifice took place in Makkah, where Sayyidna Ismail (علیہ السلام) was living, not Sayyidna Ishaq (علیہ السلاam). (5) The narrative of Sayyidna Ismail (علیہ السلام) being the son sacrificed is supported by most Hadith narrations and Tafsir literature.

instruction: What does the last verse of Surah Al-A'raf refute among the Jews?
output: The verse refutes the false pride of the Jews that being among the progeny of the noble prophets is in itself sufficient to bless one with merit and salvation.

instruction: According to Surah Al-A'raf, what is the guarantee of one's salvation?
output: According to Surah Al-A'raf, one's own beliefs and deeds are the guarantee of one's salvation, not having a lineal connection with a man of virtue.

instruction: What does the verse "and among the progeny of both of them, some are good and some are utterly unjust to their own selves" mean in the context of Surah Al-A'raf?
output: This verse openly declares that having lineal connection with a man of virtue is not a sufficient guarantee of one's salvation, in fact, this thing depends on one's own beliefs and deeds.

instruction: What is the third event described in the verses cited above related to?

instruction: What do the verses indicate about Allah's favors towards Musa (علیہ السلاam) and Harun (علیہ السلام)?

instruction: Who is Sayyidna Ilyas (علیہ السلام) ?
output: Sayyidna Ilyas (علیہ السلام) is a prophet mentioned in the Qur'an at two places: Surah Al-An` am (6:85) and Surah As-Saffat (37:123) and (37:130). He was sent to the Bani Isra'il after Hizqil (علیہ السلاam) (Ezekiel) and before Al-Yasa' (علیہ السلاam) .

instruction: When and where did Sayyidna Ilyas (علیہ السلاam) appear?
output: Historical and Isra'ilite narratives almost concur that he was sent to the Bani Isra'il after Hizqil (علیہ السلاam) (Ezekiel), and before Al-Yasa' (علیہ السلاam) . He was born at Jal` ad in Jordan.

instruction: What struggle did Sayyidna Ilyas (علیہ السلام) have to engage in?
output: Sayyidna Ilyas (علیہ السلام) by asking Ahab, the king of Isra'il, and his people to shun idolatry, invited them towards pure monotheism. But, except for a few votaries of truth, no one listened to him, in fact, tried to harass him in all sorts of ways, so much so that Ahab and his wife planned to kill him. He took refuge in a far out cave where he stayed for a considerably long period of time. After that he prayed that the people of Isra'il be seized with famine, so that he may show them some miracles at his hand for removing the famine, may be, they would, then, come to believe. So, they were struck with a famine.

instruction: Who was Ba'l and what significance does it hold in Islamic history?
output: Ba'l was an idol that the people of Sayyidna Ilyas (علیہ السلام) worshipped. It was a popular idol in Syria during the time of Sayyidna Musa (علیہ السلاam) and was the name of the city Ba'labakk (Baalbek or ancient Heliopolis in present Lebanon).

instruction: What does the expression "الخالقين" (al-khalqin) in the verse mean and how is it related to Allah?
output: The expression "الخالقين" (al-khalqin) refers to Allah Ta'ala, and it means that He is the best of all creators. This statement indicates that Allah is the one who has the power to bring something out of nothingness into existence, which is a power that no one else possesses.

instruction: Is it permissible to ascribe the attribute of creation to anyone other than Allah?
output: No, it is not permissible to ascribe the attribute of creation (خَلَق, khaliq) to anyone other than Allah, as this attribute is particular to Him. The term "خَلَق" (khaliq) refers to bringing something from a state of non-being into a state of being solely on the strength of the creator's inherent power. Therefore, to call human creations as 'creations' is not permissible.

instruction: What does the term "مُخْلَصِينَ" (mukhlasin) denote in the Islamic context?

instruction: How can one become a "مُخْلَصِينَ" (mukhlasin) according to the Islamic text?

instruction: What is the tasbih recited by Sayyidna Yunus (علیہ السلام) while in the belly of the fish?
output: The tasbih recited by Sayyidna Yunus (علیہ السلام) while in the belly of the fish is "لَّا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا أَنتَ سُبْحَانَكَ إِنِّي كُنتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ" (There is no god but You - Pure are You - Indeed I was among the wrongdoers). Additionally, it is reported that the Holy Prophet ﷺ said that any Muslim who recites this tasbih for any permissible objective, his du'a or prayer will be answered. (Tafsir Qurtubi)
