instruction: According to the Islamic text, who is responsible for distributing livelihood?
output: According to the Islamic text, Allah Almighty is responsible for distributing livelihood, not any human organization or authority.

instruction: What does the Islamic text mean by "and have raised some of them over others in ranks"?
output: This means that economic equality, in the sense that the income of all the individuals of this world should be equal, is neither desirable nor practically feasible. Instead, Allah Ta’ ala has charged every member of this universe with some duties, and has given them rights in proportion to their obligations. As such, economic advantages and rights are given to anyone in accordance with his duties and obligations. Differences in incomes are therefore unavoidable.

instruction: What was the infidels' objection to the prophethood bestowed upon the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ?
output: The infidels of Makkah questioned why prophethood was not bestowed upon a wealthy or rich person from Makkah or Ta'if, as they believed that prophethood should be based on wealth and property.

instruction: What does the statement "If the worth of the whole world, in Allah's sight, had been equal to that of one wing of a mosquito, Allah Ta` ala will not have given even one drop of water from this world to an infidel (kafir)" indicate?
output: This statement indicates that wealth and property are so worthless in Allah's view that if there was no apprehension of all the people becoming disbelievers, He will have showered gold and silver upon all the infidels.

instruction: What are the qualities that are necessary for choosing someone as a prophet, according to the Islamic text?
output: The text states that some qualities and abilities are necessary for choosing someone as a prophet, but abundance of riches and wealth cannot be taken as the basis of this choice. instruction: What happens to a person who willfully ignores Allah's advice as mentioned in the verse 43:36 of the Quran?
output: If a person willfully ignores Allah's advice, Allah assigns a devil to accompany him all the time in this world to prevent him from virtuous deeds, and to divert him towards evil. This devil will also be with him in the Hereafter, till they both are pushed in Hell.

instruction: What is the significance of the devil assigned to a person who turns away from Allah's remembrance as per Quran 43:36?
output: The devil assigned to such a person is in addition to the 'Shaitan' (Satan) who is attached to every believer and disbeliever. This devil accompanies him all the time, whereas the 'Shaitan' (Shaitan) does leave the man alone at certain specific times.

instruction: What is the punishment one gets even in this world for turning away from Allah's remembrance as per the commentary?
output: The punishment one gets even in this world for turning away from Allah's remembrance is that he gets into bad company and 'shaitans' (devils), whether from humans or from jinns, keep diverting him from virtues to vices. He commits vices but thinks that he is doing very well.

instruction: What is the meaning of the word 'dhikr' in the given Islamic text?

instruction: What does the verse "And certainly this Qur'an is a word of honor for you and your people" imply?

instruction: What is the meaning of the verse, "And ask Our messengers whom We sent before you..." (43:45)?

output: The context in which the verses of Surah Zukhruf were revealed was in response to the objections raised by the infidels regarding the worship of Sayyidna Isa (علیہ السلام) and Sayyidna Uzair (علیہ السلام) and their supposed fate in Hell.

instruction: What was the misconception held by the infidels regarding Sayyidna Isa (علیہ السلام)?
output: The infidels misconceived that Sayyidna Isa (علیہ السلام) was considered a god or a son of God because of his miraculous birth without a father.

instruction: Why was it inappropriate for the infidels to worship Sayyidna Isa (علیہ السلام)?
output: It was inappropriate for the infidels to worship Sayyidna Isa (علیہ السلام) because at no stage did he like to be worshipped, nor did the Qur'an support it. Their misconception was based on his miraculous birth without a father which was, according to them, a sign of his being god or a son of God. However, the worship of Sayyidna Isa (علیہ السلام) by Christians was not only irrational, but also against his own teachings, because he had always preached 'tauhid' (Oneness of Allah).

instruction: What event is the Islamic verse 43:63 referring to?
output: The event referred to in the Islamic verse 43:63 is the incident of Bana Isra'il, who were drowned due to their arrogance and obstinacy.

instruction: Why were Bana Isra'il drowned?
output: Bana Isra'il were drowned due to their arrogance and obstinacy as they had tampered with the Divine laws.

instruction: Who disclosed the reality of the distortions committed by Bana Isra'il?
output: The reality of the distortions committed by Bana Isra'il was disclosed by Sayyidna ` Isa (علیہ السلام).

instruction: What does the verse "Friends, on that day, will become enemies to one another, except the God-fearing" mean?
output: This verse means that the friendly relationships in this world, which are not based on piety and fear of Allah, will turn into enmity on the Day of Judgment.

instruction: What happens when a Muslim dies and is granted Paradise, if he reminisces about his friend?
output: When a Muslim dies and is granted Paradise, if he reminisces about his friend, he will supplicate for his friend's entry into Paradise, and Allah will reward him for his good deed, but will not grant the same blessing to his friend immediately. Later, when his friend also dies, both their souls will meet, and Allah will direct them to praise each other.

instruction: What happens when a Non-Muslim dies and is told that he will go to Hell?
output: When a Non-Muslim dies and is told that he will go to Hell, if he reminisces about his friend, he will supplicate against his friend's entry into Paradise, and Allah will not grant the same blessing to his friend immediately. Later, when his friend also dies, both their souls will meet, and they will be directed to praise the other. However, each one of them will say about the other that he is the worst brother, worst companion, and worst friend.

instruction: What is the purpose of the statement "قُلْ إِن كَانَ لِلرَّ‌حْمَـٰنِ وَلَدٌ فَأَنَا أَوَّلُ الْعَابِدِينَ (Had there been a son for the Rahman,I would have been the first to worship)" in the Islamic text?
output: The statement's purpose is to illustrate the Prophet's willingness to accept any logical arguments that could prove the existence of offspring of Allah, but since there are no such arguments, the statement is a hypothetical one.

instruction: Why did the Prophet not accept the possibility of Allah having offspring?
output: The Prophet did not accept the possibility of Allah having offspring because there are no logical arguments that can prove this possibility, and every intellectual argument contradicts this idea.

instruction: What does the text teach us about declaring during a debate?
output: The text teaches us that it is lawful, rather desirable, to declare during a debate with erring people that if their claim had been proved by strong arguments, it would have been accepted. This manner of speech may sometimes soften the heart of the opponent and may persuade him to accept the truth.

instruction: What is the instruction given at the end of Surah Zukhruf to the Holy Prophet PBUH?
output: The instruction given to the Holy Prophet PBUH is to always respond to the arguments and doubts of the opponents, but when they start talking ignorantly, foolishly, or involve in hurling abuses, then instead of replying in their language, one should keep quiet.

instruction: What is the meaning of "Say Salam" in the Islamic text?
output: "Say Salam" is an idiomatic expression for parting ways, not a salutation to non-Muslims. It is not permissible to say "Assalamu ` alaikum" to non-Muslims.

instruction: According to the text, who can say "Assalamu ` alaikum" to?
output: "Assalamu ` alaikum" can only be said to a Muslim, not to a non-Muslim.

instruction: What is the gist of the advice given to the Holy Prophet in Surah Az-Zukhruf (The Gold)?
output: The gist of the advice is that one may reply to the arguments and doubts of the opponents, but when they start talking ignorantly, foolishly or are involved in hurling abuses, then instead of replying in their language, one should keep quiet.

instruction: What does the instruction to say "Salam" not mean in the context of the verse 43:89?
output: The instruction to say "Salam" does not mean that "Assalamu ` alaikum" is to be said to non-Muslims, because this salutation is not permissible for any non-Muslim; rather it is an idiomatic expression for parting of ways.

instruction: Who are the ones to whom "Assalamu ` alaikum" is not permissible according to the text?
output: "Assalamu ` alaikum" is not permissible for any non-Muslims.

instruction: What is the "blessed night" referred to in the Islamic text?
output: The "blessed night" is referred to as 'laylatul Qadr' or the 'Night of Power', which occurs in the last ten nights of the month of Ramadan.

instruction: When were the different Scriptures revealed according to the Prophet?
output: The Prophet ﷺ said that Prophet Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) received his Scriptures on 1st Ramadan, Torah was revealed on 6th Ramadan, Zabur was revealed on 12th Ramadan, Injil was revealed on 18th Ramadan and the Holy Qur'an was revealed on the night of 24th, that is, on 25th Ramadan.

instruction: What does the phrase 'We sent it (the Qur'an) in the Night of Qadr' mean?
output: The phrase 'We sent it (the Qur'an) in the Night of Qadr' means that it was revealed in its entirety from the Preserved Tablet to the lowest Firmament in one night of the month of Ramadan. However, it was revealed to the Prophet ﷺ gradually over a period of twenty-three years.

instruction: What does the "visible smoke" in verse 10 of Surah Dukhan denote?
output: The "visible smoke" in verse 10 of Surah Dukhan embodies a prophecy and refers to one of the signs of the Day of Judgment.

instruction: What are the three opinions recorded about this prophecy from the Companions and their pupils?
output: The three opinions are: (1) The smoke is one of the portents of the Day of Judgment which will occur very close to the Day of Judgment. (2) This prophecy has already occurred, referring to the event when the Quraish did not respond to Islam's call and they grew obstinate, causing seven years of drought and famine. (3) The 'smoke' refers to the 'dust' which had been stirred up to the sky, and had covered the firmament of Makkah on the day of 'the Conquest of Makkah'.

instruction: What is the most popular view among the three opinions about the prophecy of the "visible smoke"?
output: The two views that the "visible smoke" is one of the portents of the Hour, which will occur very close to the Day of Judgment, and that this prophecy has already occurred, are the most popular views.

instruction: What is the meaning of the term "rajm" mentioned in the verse 44:20?
output: The term "rajm" means 'to stone to death'.

instruction: What is another possible meaning of the term "rajm" in verse 44:20?
output: Another possible meaning of the term is 'to revile or to make a verbal assault or to heap up insults'.

instruction: Why is it more likely that the word "rajm" in verse 44:20 refers to stoning to death?
output: It is more likely that the word "rajm" in verse 44:20 refers to stoning to death because Fir'aun's people must have been threatening Prophet Musa (علیہ السلام) with death.

instruction: What does the word "Rahwan" in the verse "And leave the sea in the state of stillness" mean?
output: Still/Calm/Motionless

instruction: What was Prophet Musa's (PBUH) desire as he and his companions were crossing the sea?
output: He wanted to strike the sea with his staff to form a barrier to prevent Fir'aun from reaching them.

instruction: Why did Allah command Prophet Musa to leave the sea as it was?
output: Allah commanded him to leave the sea as it was, quiet and divided, because it was a host to be drowned, and he should not fear either being overtaken by Fir'aun or drowning in the sea.

instruction: Who did Allah make inherit the land of Egypt, as mentioned in Surah Shu'ara' (44:28)?

instruction: What objection has been raised regarding the statement in Surah Shu'ara' (44:28) that the Children of Israel inherited Egypt?
output: It has been objected that there is no historical evidence to show that the Children of Israel ever settled again in Egypt.

instruction: How has the objection regarding the Children of Israel's return to Egypt been rebutted in Surah Shu'ara'?
output: The objection has been rebutted in Surah Shu'ara' by stating that the Children of Israel will return to Egypt again.

instruction: What does the phrase "So, neither the sky and earth wept over them" mean in the Islamic text?
output: It means that the deceased individuals did not perform any righteous deeds on earth which would weep for them when they died, nor did any of their righteous deeds ascend through the gates of heaven, so that the sky would weep on their death.

instruction: According to the Islamic text, what happens when a righteous person dies?
output: When a righteous person dies, the heaven and earth weep for him.

instruction: What does the verse (44:29) symbolize in the Islamic text?
output: In the Islamic text, the verse (44:29) symbolizes that when they died, neither the sky nor the earth wept over them, indicating that they did not perform any righteous deeds on earth which would weep for them when they died, nor did any of their righteous deeds ascend through the gates of heaven, so that the sky would weep on their death.

instruction: What does the verse "And We chose them, with knowledge above all the worlds" mean in the context of the Children of Israel and the Ummah of Muhammad ﷺ?
output: The verse means that the Children of Israel were given superiority over all the people of their time, not over the Ummah of Muhammad ﷺ.

instruction: What does the verse "women of the worlds" in reference to Sayyidah Maryam (علیہا السلام) imply?
output: The verse means that Sayyidah Maryam (علیہا السلام) was superior to the women of her time.

instruction: What does the phrase "with knowledge" in the verse "And We chose them, with knowledge above all the worlds" signify?
output: The phrase "with knowledge" signifies that every work of Allah has wisdom, and the wisdom underlying Allah's knowledge dictated that the Children of Israel be granted superiority, and they were granted accordingly.

instruction: What is the argument the people in the verse "Bring our fathers, if you are true (in your belief in resurrection) " (44:36) are making?
output: The people in the verse are asking the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to bring their fathers back to life, implying that if he is true in his belief in the resurrection, he should be able to do so in this world.

instruction: Why did Allah not provide an answer to this argument of theirs?
output: Allah did not provide an answer because it was too obvious to need explanation. The resurrection will happen on the Day of Judgment, not in this world.

instruction: What does the statement "Life and death in this world are bound by specific natural laws and wisdom" imply?
output: This statement implies that life and death in this world are subject to specific natural laws and wisdom, and they are not bound by the same laws and wisdom as the resurrection in the Hereafter.

instruction: Who were the people of Tubba' mentioned in the Qur'an?
output: The people of Tubba' were the kings of Himyar in Yemen, known by the title Tubba'.

instruction: Who is Tubba' in Islamic history?

instruction: Who is Tubba' Ausat mentioned in the Qur'an?
output: Tubba' Ausat is a specific king among the Tababi` ah of Yemen, whose name was As`ad Abu Kuraib Ibn Ma'dikarab Yamani, who ruled the longest among the Himyari Kings. He is believed to have ruled at least seven hundred years before the advent of the Holy Prophet of Allah ﷺ.

instruction: What is the purpose for which the universe was created, according to the text?
output: The universe was created with a true purpose, as revealed in the text, and it is to make it a domain of test-n-trial (dar-ul-imtihan) and the Hereafter is the domain of reward and punishment.

instruction: What is one of the realities that the universe manifests, as per the text?

output: If there is no retribution in the Hereafter, the very existence of the universe would be rendered purposeless or its purpose would be defeated, as the wisdom underlying the creation of the universe is to make it a domain of test-n-trial and the Hereafter is the domain of reward and punishment.

instruction: What is the significance of the tree of zaqqum in Islamic texts?
output: The tree of zaqqum is a tree mentioned in Islamic texts, particularly in the Qur'an, that unbelievers will be forced to eat in Hell as a form of punishment.

instruction: How is the feeding of zaqqum to the dwellers of Hell described in the Qur'an?
output: The Qur'an describes the feeding of zaqqum to the dwellers of Hell as their "entertainment" before being seized and dragged into the middle of the blazing fire of Hell.

instruction: What is the significance of the term 'nuzul' as used in the Qur'an in reference to the feeding of zaqqum to the dwellers of Hell?
output: According to some commentators, the term 'nuzul' originally refers to the starter food and provision served to guests before the main course of entertainment. In the context of the Qur'an, it refers to the zaqqum that the unbelievers will be forced to eat in Hell, which serves as their prelude to the greater torture that follows.

instruction: What is the dwelling of the inmates of Paradise according to verse 51 of Surah Al-Waqi'ah?
output: The dwelling of the inmates of Paradise is free from fear.

instruction: What is the best human dwelling according to verse 51 of Surah Al-Waqi'ah?
output: The best human dwelling is the one that is secure from all kinds of dangers.

instruction: What is the assurance of total security from grief and affliction mentioned in the verses as?

instruction: What does the word "Sundus" refer to in the Islamic text 44:53?

instruction: What does the word "Istabraq" refer to in the Islamic text 44:53?
