output: The text states that the dwellers of Paradise will not die again, and their only death will be the first one they faced at the end of their lives in this world.

instruction: How does the text compare the experiences of dwellers in Paradise and Hell regarding death?
output: The dwellers in Paradise will not experience a second death, while dwellers in Hell will experience a second death, which is the torment of Hell. However, the degree of their suffering differs significantly. The dwellers in Paradise will experience everlasting happiness, while dwellers in Hell will suffer eternal torment.

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "They will not taste death therein, except for the first death" in the context of this Islamic text?
output: "They will not taste death therein, except for the first death" means that those who dwell in Paradise will only experience death once, which was the death they encountered at the end of their lives in this world.

instruction: What is the difference in the experience of death between the dwellers of Paradise and the dwellers of Hell, according to the text?
output: The dwellers of Paradise will only experience death once, which was the death they encountered at the end of their lives in this world. In contrast, the dwellers of Hell will also experience death once at the end of their lives in this world.

instruction: What is the impact of the knowledge of their salvation from Hell and eternal life in Paradise on the dwellers of Paradise, according to the text?
output: The knowledge that Allah has saved them from the torment of Hell, that the gardens of Paradise are eternal, that they will enjoy the delights of paradise for ever and its blessings will never cease or be taken away from them, will enhance the degree of their happiness, never to diminish.

instruction: What does the text "They will not taste death therein, except for the first death" mean?
output: It means that the dwellers of Paradise will not experience death again, and they will only suffer one death, which is the death they had faced at the end of their lives in this world.

instruction: What is the difference in the suffering of death between the dwellers of Paradise and the dwellers of Hell?
output: The dwellers of Hell will suffer a greater degree of torture after experiencing the first death, as they will remain in a miserable state of punishment. In contrast, the dwellers of Paradise will not suffer any additional death, and their happiness will never diminish, as they will enjoy the delights of Paradise eternally.

instruction: What are the reasons that enhance the degree of happiness for the dwellers of Paradise?
output: The reasons that enhance the degree of happiness for the dwellers of Paradise are: Allah has saved them from the torment of Hell, the gardens of Paradise are eternal, they will enjoy the delights of Paradise for ever, and its blessings will never cease or be taken away from them.

instruction: What does the text "They will not taste death therein, except for the first death" imply about the dwellers of Paradise?
output: The dwellers of Paradise will not suffer any death other than the first death they had encountered at the end of their lives in this world.

instruction: What is meant by "the first death" in the text "They will not taste death therein, except for the first death"?
output: The "first death" refers to the natural death that the dwellers of Paradise had faced at the end of their lives in this world.

instruction: How does the thought of eternal Paradise and its blessings affect the dwellers of Paradise?
output: The thought that Allah has saved them from the torment of Hell, that the gardens of Paradise are eternal, that they will enjoy the delights of Paradise forever, and that its blessings will never cease or be taken away from them, will enhance the degree of their happiness, never to diminish.

instruction: What was the occasion of revelation of Surah Al-Muddaththir (Surah 74)?
output: The entire Surah Al-Muddaththir (Surah 74) was revealed at Makkah, except for one verse, which was revealed at Madinah.

instruction: What is the subject-matter of most Makki Surahs, including Surah Al-Muddaththir (Surah 74)?
output: The basic subject-matter of most Makki Surahs, including Surah Al-Muddaththir (Surah 74), is the basic beliefs of Islam, such as Oneness of Allah, Messenger-ship of the Holy Prophet ﷺ and the Hereafter.

instruction: Which verse of Surah Al-Muddaththir (Surah 74) is believed to be revealed at Madinah according to one opinion?
output: According to one opinion, the verse لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يَغْفِرُ‌وا لِلَّذِينَ لَا يَرْ‌جُونَ أَيَّامَ اللَّـهِ ("Tell those who believe that they should forgive those who do not believe in Allah's days...") is believed to be revealed at Madinah.

instruction: What is the purpose of the verse "إِنَّ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ لَآيَاتٍ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ "?
output: The purpose of the verse is to affirm the Oneness of Allah.

instruction: Who will be able to benefit from these signs mentioned in the verse?
output: Only those people will be able to benefit who have faith.

instruction: What do the stylistic variations in the verses mean?
output: The stylistic variations in the verses refer to the concluding statements of the verses, which vary between 'there are signs for those who have faith', 'there are signs for those who believe', and 'there are signs for those who understand'. The current verse points to the fact that only those people will be able to benefit who have faith, while the others may not immediately embrace the Faith, but they do develop certainty in their hearts, in that these signs do point to the Oneness of Allah. In the third case, it could benefit those who may not be immediate believers or firm in belief, but they do have sound heart to understand. However, people devoid of sound intellect or unwilling to use it will remain unconvinced.

instruction: Who were the three individuals believed to be the background of the revelation of the verse "Woe to every sinful liar" in the Qur'an?
output: The three individuals are Nadr Ibn Harith, Harith Ibn Kaldah, and Abu Jahl, according to different interpretations.

instruction: What is the general interpretation of the Qur'anic verse "Woe to every sinful liar"?
output: The verse is a general warning against sinful lying, and it is not necessary to refer to a particular person to understand its meaning.

instruction: How does the word "kull" (every) in the verse "Woe to every sinful liar" apply?
output: The word "kull" applies to every person who bears the characteristics of the three individuals who might have been in the background of the revelation of the verse.

instruction: What does the Arabic word وَرَ‌ائِ war' mean in the text?
output: The Arabic word وَرَ‌ائِ war' in the text means "front."

instruction: What is the interpretation of some commentators about the use of the word وَرَ‌ائِ war' in the text?
output: Some commentators interpret the word وَرَ‌ائِ war' in the text to mean that the fire of Hell is trailing behind/after those who are living in haughtiness and arrogance.

instruction: How does the text describe the location of Jahannam in relation to the people it mentions?
output: According to the text, Jahannam is in front of the people it mentions.

instruction: What does the phrase "seek His grace" in the verse 45:12 of the Qur'an generally refer to?
output: The phrase "seek His grace" generally refers to exerting oneself in seeking one's livelihood.

instruction: What is another possible meaning of the phrase "seek His grace" in verse 45:12 of the Qur'an?
output: Another possible meaning of the phrase "seek His grace" could be that man has been given the skill to move the boats or pilot the ships on the surface of the waters so that he may carry out his commercial activities across the globe.

instruction: What is a possible third interpretation of the phrase "seek His grace" in verse 45:12 of the Qur'an?
output: A possible third interpretation is that "subjugating the sea" has a special meaning, that is, Allah has created many useful things in the sea and subjugated the sea for the benefit of mankind so that they may exploit the minerals and other wealth hidden in the oceans and seas.

instruction: What is the cause of revelation of the verse "Tell those who believe that they should forgive those who do not believe in Allah's days"?
output: The verse was revealed in response to two incidents. The first incident occurred in Makkah when a pagan reviled Sayyidna ` Umar ؓ, and the second incident took place on the occasion of the battle of Bani-l-Mustaliq, when ` Abdullah Ibn 'Ubayy cynically quoted a proverb against Sayyidna ` Umar ؓ.

instruction: What is the term used to describe the occurrence of a verse being revealed twice?
output: The term used is called 'Nuzul Makkarr' or 'Repeated Revelation' in the technical parlance of Tafsir.

instruction: Who were the people addressed in the verse "Tell those who believe that they should forgive those who do not believe in Allah's days"?
output: The verse addresses the believers and instructs them to forgive those who do not believe in Allah, not necessarily idolaters. This probably signifies that the real punishment awaits them in the Hereafter, but because the unbelievers do not believe in the Hereafter, the punishment will be unexpected for them.

instruction: What does the verse "إِنَّ رَ‌بَّكَ يَقْضِي بَيْنَهُمْ" confirm?
output: This verse confirms that Allah will judge between the people on the Day of Judgment, in the matters in which they used to differ.

instruction: What does the verse imply about the Book of Musa (علیہ السلام)?
output: The verse implies that the Book of Musa (علیہ السلام) contains many clear prophecies about the advent of the Holy Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: What was the reason behind the Israelites rejecting the Prophet ﷺ?
output: The Israelites rejected the Prophet ﷺ not because there was any dearth of arguments, signs and Divine prophecies to support and establish his claim, but because of jealousy, love of the world, and personal desires.

instruction: What is the difference between the fundamental articles of faith and the laws relating to practical life in Islam?
output: The fundamental articles of faith are immutable and were imparted to every Prophet (علیہ السلام) and his Ummah since the inception of man. They include the Oneness of Allah, the Hereafter, etc. Laws relating to practical life were different for different Prophets (علیہم السلام) and their people and kept changing according to the needs of time and exigencies of circumstances.

instruction: What is the ruling of the Ummah of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ regarding the sacred laws of previous Shari'ahs?
output: The Ummah of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ must, of necessity, follow the sacred laws of the Shari'ah of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ . As far as the sacred laws of the previous Shari` ahs are concerned, this Ummah is not legally bound to them unless the Qur'an and Sunnah support or confirm them.

instruction: How can the Qur'an and Sunnah support or confirm a law of a previous Shari'ah for the current Ummah?
output: The Qur'an and Sunnah may explicitly say that a certain law of a certain Prophet (علیہ السلام) must be followed by this Ummah; or the Qur'an and Sunnah may speak highly and favourably about a certain law of a previous Ummah without hinting that it is abrogated for this Ummah. This indicates that the law is applicable in the Shari'ah of this Ummah also. In that case, the previous law becomes part of this Shari'ah, and as such this Ummah is legally bound to follow it.

instruction: Why is the concept of the Hereafter necessary according to the Islamic text?
output: The Hereafter is necessary because the reward and punishment for good and bad deeds in this world are not given in full measure, and it is unreasonable to believe that evil-doers should be placed on the same pedestal as the righteous persons.

instruction: What does the Islamic text mean by saying "And they will not be wronged"?
output: In the Islamic text, "And they will not be wronged" means that on the Day of Requital, everybody will be recompensed for what he (or she) earned, ensuring that no one will be wronged or injustice will be done.

instruction: Why is the Day of Requital important according to the Islamic text?
output: The Day of Requital is important because it is necessary to wipe out wrong and injustice, as the reward and punishment in this world are not given in full measure, and it is not in keeping with the Divine wisdom of creation to make this world the 'domain of deeds and test-n-trial' rather than the 'domain of requital'.

instruction: What does the verse "Have you seen him who has taken his desires as his god...45:23" imply?
output: The verse implies that anyone who undertakes to obey someone against the obedience of Allah makes him the object of his worship instead of Allah, and his desires are his god.

instruction: What does the Qur'an mean by the term 'worship'?
output: According to the commentary, the Qur'an means by 'worship' that anyone who obeys someone against the obedience of Allah makes him the object of his worship instead of Allah.

instruction: What does the poet in the couplet "My forehead has swollen by prostrating before the statues of beauty, although I claim to profess the religion of Islam" depict?
output: The poet depicts selfish desires as statues. He who takes his desires as his leader and follows them is as good as their worshipper.

instruction: What does the term dahr mean in the Islamic context?
output: Dahr means "time from the beginning of the world to its end" or "a very long period of time".

instruction: What was the atheists' view regarding life and death?
output: The atheists believed that life and death were not caused by Divine will and command, but were the result of natural causes, with death being the dissolution and destruction of the body due to the passage of time.

instruction: Why is it inappropriate to revile time, according to Islamic tradition?
output: It is inappropriate to revile time because, in reality, time is a manifestation of Allah's power. When people curse or revile time, they are actually directing their reproach towards Allah. The Messenger of Allah said, "Do not revile time because time actually is Allah."

instruction: What does the word 'jathiyah' mean in the context of the verse "And you will see every community kneeling down...45:28"?
output: 'Jathiyah' is derived from جُثُو juthuww. It means ` to sit with knees upon the ground' and it will be on account of awe, horror and fear during the Resurrection.

instruction: What do the words 'every community' signify in the verse "And you will see every community kneeling down...45:28"?
output: The words 'every community' mean that horrors of Resurrection will be felt by all on the plain - believers, non-believers, and righteous and unrighteous, all of them.

instruction: What does the word 'kitab' refer to in the verse "Every community will be called to its book (of record)...45:28"?
output: According to most commentators, 'kitab' refers to ` book of record' which the angels have been writing in the world. The record-books will be thrown on the Plains of Resurrection and each one will receive his respective record-book.

instruction: What does the word jathiyah mean according to the text?
output: The word jathiyah means 'to sit with knees upon the ground,' specifically in a way that only the knees and the toes of the feet rest on the ground.

instruction: What does the phrase 'كُلُّ أُمَّةٍ ' mean in the context of the text?
output: The phrase 'كُلُّ أُمَّةٍ ' means 'every community,' indicating that all communities will experience the horrors of the Resurrection.

instruction: What is the interpretation of the phrase 'كُلَّ أُمَّةٍ تُدْعَىٰ إِلَىٰ كِتَابِهَا' according to the text?
output: The phrase 'كُلَّ أُمَّةٍ تُدْعَىٰ إِلَىٰ كِتَابِهَا' means 'Every community will be called to its book (of record),' referring to the 'book of record' that the angels have been writing in the world, which will be thrown on the Plains of Resurrection and each person will receive their respective record-book to render an account of their deeds before Allah in the next life.

instruction: What types of arguments are refuted in the verses "Say, 'Tell me about those whom you invoke instead of Allah,...46:4"?
output: The verses refute three types of arguments: a rational argument, an argument that relies on the statement of an authority, and an argument based on the saying of a prophet.

instruction: How does the verse "Show me what they have created of the earth; Or have they a share in (the creation of the heavens)" (46:4) refute the rational argument of the polytheists?
output: This verse refutes the rational argument of the polytheists by challenging them to show their creation, suggesting that they have no power or knowledge to create anything like Allah.

instruction: How does the verse "Bring to me a book (revealed) before this one, (46:4)" refute the argument that relies on the statement of an authority?
output: This verse refutes the argument that relies on the statement of an authority by demanding a revelation before the Qur'an that permits idol-worship, implying that no such book exists.

instruction: What does the phrase "I do not follow anything but what is revealed to me" in the Qur'an mean?
output: It means that the Holy Prophet ﷺ does not have any knowledge about unseen things (like his own self, believers and disbelievers, or matters pertaining to this world or the Hereafter) which were not revealed to him through wahy (divine revelation).

instruction: What is the gist of the explanation given to Qur'an 46:9 by Imam Dahhak (رح)?
output: The explanation is that the Holy Prophet ﷺ's knowledge of unseen things is obtained through wahy, and he does not have any knowledge about those unseen things which were not revealed to him through wahy.

instruction: What does the Qur'an mean by "These are some reports from the unseen (events) which We reveal to you" (11:49)?
output: This refers to the knowledge of innumerable things from the unseen (events) that were given to the Holy Prophet ﷺ through divine revelation.

instruction: What is the meaning of arrogance and pride as described in the text?
output: The text describes arrogance and pride as a state in which a person considers his own opinions and deeds to be the criteria for determining right and wrong, good and bad. If he does not like anything, no matter how well it is believed to be by others, he considers all those people to be stupid, while he himself is stupid.

instruction: What was the attitude of the infidels towards Islamic faith?
output: The infidels considered Islamic faith as something worthless and believed that had it been a good thing, they themselves would have been the first to adopt it. They also used to say that one should not trust the choice of the weak and poor people who had embraced Islam.

instruction: Who was Zunairah and what was her significance in Islamic history?
output: Zunairah was a slave-girl of Sayyidna ` Umar Ibn Khattab ؓ. She embraced Islam when he was still a disbeliever. She was beaten up and threatened by him so that she might give up Islam. The kuffar of Quraish used to say that had Islamic faith been a good thing, such a worthless woman as Zunairah would not have preceded us in embracing it. (Mazhari)

instruction: What can we infer from the verse 12 of Surah Al-Ahzab regarding the status of the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ as a messenger?
output: The verse 12 of Surah Al-Ahzab implies that the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is not an unprecedented messenger, as Sayyidna Musa (علیہ السلام) came before him as a messenger.

instruction: What does the verse 12 of Surah Al-Ahzab tell us about the nature of the Qur'an?
output: The verse 12 of Surah Al-Ahzab suggests that the Qur'an is not a singular divine Book, as the Torah, which was revealed to Sayyidna Musa (علیہ السلام), also exists.

instruction: Who serves as a witness to the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ being the messenger of Allah and the Qur'an being Allah's Book, according to the verse 12 of Surah Al-Ahzab?
output: According to the verse 12 of Surah Al-Ahzab, Sayyidna Musa (علیہ السلام) and Torah themselves serve as witnesses to the Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ being the messenger of Allah and the Qur'an being Allah's Book.

instruction: What do the verses 46:13 and 46:14 in the Qur'an emphasize about faith and the virtuous deeds required by Islam?
output: The verses 46:13 and 46:14 emphasize that the admission that "Our Lord is Allah" is the whole of faith, and staying firm in it includes holding on to it till death, as well as carrying out all its obligations.

instruction: What are the three things promised to those who embrace faith and remain steadfast to it, according to the verse 46:13 in the Qur'an?
output: Those who embrace faith and remain steadfast to it are being promised freedom from anxiety and suffering in future, and dispelling of their grief and sorrow over past sufferings, and a matchless comfort that continues.

instruction: What is the connection between the verses 46:15-18 and the earlier verses in Surah Al-Ahqaf (46:13-14)?
output: The connection between the verses 46:15-18 and the earlier verses in Surah Al-Ahqaf (46:13-14) is that the usual style of the Holy Qur'an is to instruct man to behave beautifully, to serve and to obey his parents along with the call to obey and worship Allah Almighty. The verses are also connected in the sense that mention has been made of beautiful behaviour for parents alongwith the call to believe in the Oneness of Allah Ta’ ala.

instruction: What does "wasiyyah" mean in the given text?
output: "Wasiyyah" means 'emphatic order'.

instruction: What is the meaning of "ihsan" in the given text?
output: "Ihsan" means 'doing good' or 'behaving beautifully'.

instruction: What do the words "خر" and "كره" in the given text denote?
output: "خر" and "كره" denote the toil that one has to endure for some reason, and toil one has to undertake under compulsion from someone else, respectively.

instruction: What does the verse "Such are the people from whom We accept the best of what they did, and overlook their evils" refer to?
output: The verse refers to people who will be in Paradise.

instruction: Who are the people mentioned in the verse according to Sayyidna `Ali ؓ?
output: Sayyidna ` Ali ؓ said that those people were `Uthman and his companions.

instruction: Why did Sayyidna ` Ali ؓ repeat the statement about `Uthman three times?
output: Sayyidna ` Ali ؓ repeated the statement about `Uthman three times to emphasize the fact that he and his companions were examples of the verse.

instruction: What does the verse "And, [ contrary to this is the case on the one who said to his parents, 'Fie upon you both!'" mean?
output: This verse announces punishment for one who maltreats his parents and is impertinent to them.

instruction: What is the significance of the parent-child relationship according to this verse?
output: The verse emphasizes the importance of serving and obeying parents, especially when they are calling one towards Islam and virtuous deeds.

instruction: Who is the person mentioned in Marwan's saying, and is it supported by authentic narrations?
output: Marwan's saying refers to `Abdur Rahman Ibn Abi Bakr, but it contradicts the saying of Sayyidah `A'ishah and is not supported by any correct narration that this verse is specifically for him. The verse is general in sense and applies to anyone who maltreats his parents.

instruction: What does the verse "أَذْهَبْتُمْ طَيِّبَاتِكُمْ فِي حَيَاتِكُمُ الدُّنْيَا" mean?
output: This verse means that the infidels had already been awarded delights, luxuries, and enjoyment in their worldly life, and now there is nothing left for them in the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the significance of the good deeds of disbelievers in the Hereafter, according to the verse?
output: The good deeds of disbelievers do not have any worth in the Hereafter due to lack of belief or faith.

instruction: What is the rule that applies to Mu'mins (believers) regarding worldly delights and riches?
output: If they get any delights, riches, and wealth in this world, it does not mean they would be deprived of their right in the Hereafter.

instruction: What is another name of Surah Muhammad?
output: Surah Al-Qital [ Surah of war ].

instruction: When was Surah Muhammad revealed?
output: Surah Muhammad was revealed immediately after migration to Madinah.

instruction: What does the phrase "Allah's way" refer to in the verse صَدُّوا عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّـهِ "prevented (others) from Allah's way" (47:1)?
output: "Allah's way" refers to Islam.

instruction: What does the Islamic text explicitly establish as the basis of faith?
output: The Islamic text explicitly establishes that the basis of faith is to embrace all the teachings of the Last Holy Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.

instruction: What is the significance of the word "بال (bal)" in the verse "وَأَصْلَحَ بَالَهُمْ "?
output: The word "بال (bal)" in the verse "وَأَصْلَحَ بَالَهُمْ " can sometimes refer to state of affairs and condition, and at other times to heart. Here it could refer to both the senses.

instruction: In what two senses can the word "بال (bal)" be understood in the verse "وَأَصْلَحَ بَالَهُمْ "?
output: In the verse "وَأَصْلَحَ بَالَهُمْ ", the word "بال (bal)" can be understood in two senses: state of affairs and condition, and heart.

instruction: What two options does the verse of Surah Muhammad give regarding prisoners of war?
output: The verse of Surah Muhammad gives two options regarding prisoners of war: either confer favour on them and release them without ransom or compensation; or release them against payment of ransom.

instruction: In what ways can ransom be taken for prisoners of war according to this verse?
output: Ransom for prisoners of war can be taken by exchanging Muslim prisoners of war for non-Muslim prisoners of war or by setting them free after accepting pecuniary ransom.

instruction: What is the significance of the verse of Surah Muhammad in light of the verse of Surah Al-Anfal?
output: The verse of Surah Muhammad allows the release of prisoners of war without ransom or against ransom, which is in contrast to the verse of Surah Al-Anfal that prohibits setting them free against ransom. Therefore, most of the Companions and jurists express the view that this verse of Surah Muhammad has abrogated the verse of Surah Al-Anfal.

instruction: What are the two bounties mentioned in the Islamic verse "سَيَهْدِيهِمْ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَهُمْ"?
output: The two bounties are: Allah will guide them and improve their conditions.

instruction: What does the term "state of affairs" refer to in the verse?
output: The term "state of affairs" refers to the conditions of both the worlds - this world and the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the reward for a Muslim who did not become a martyr in this world?
output: The reward for a Muslim who did not become a martyr in this world is that he will receive the reward of a martyr in the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the third bounty of Allah mentioned in the text?
output: The third bounty of Allah mentioned in the text is admitting believers to Paradise and identifying gardens of bliss for them, making them familiar with such bounties as houris and mansions.

instruction: What is the role of an angel appointed for every single inmate of Paradise?
output: An angel appointed for every single inmate of Paradise introduces them to their abode and wives in Paradise.

instruction: How will believers in Paradise feel about their environment, if Allah did not make them familiar with such bounties as houris and mansions?
output: If Allah did not make believers in Paradise familiar with such bounties as houris and mansions, Paradise would have seemed a strange world, and they would not overcome the sense of unfamiliarity for a period of time.

instruction: What is the grammatical function of "alif lam" in the sentence "al-kafirina"?
output: The "alif lam" in "al-kafirina" is used to indicate some specific disbelievers, and refers to the infidels of Makkah.

instruction: Who does the sentence "al-kafirina" refer to?
output: The sentence "al-kafirina" refers to the infidels of Makkah.

instruction: What is the purpose of the sentence "وللكافرين أمثالها"?
output: The purpose of the sentence "وللكافرين أمثالها" is to warn the infidels of Makkah: as the previous generations were punished for their iniquity, so will you meet a similar fate for your iniquitous behavior. Do not be unconcerned!

instruction: What is the meaning of the word "mawla" in the Quranic verse 47:11?
output: In the verse 47:11, "mawla" means "protector" or "supporter".

instruction: What is another sense of the word "mawla" in the Quran?
output: Another sense of the word "mawla" in the Quran is "owner" or "master".

instruction: How is Allah referred to in the Quranic verse 10:30, using the word "mawla"?
output: In the Quranic verse 10:30, Allah is referred to as the "mawla" (Master/Owner) of all, including the infidels. This is because Allah's mastership/ownership extends over all, without any exclusion.

instruction: What is the quality of water in Paradise?
output: The water in Paradise is un-pollutable, it will not go bad in taste, smell or color, and will flow uninterruptedly without layers of dregs, scum or any other unpleasant-looking substances.

instruction: What is different about the milk in Paradise compared to worldly milk?
output: The milk in Paradise will never be spoilt, its taste will be eternally delicious, relishing and delightful.

instruction: How is the wine in Paradise different from worldly wine?
output: The Heavenly wine will give endless delight to the drinker, without causing intoxication or headache.

instruction: According to the text, why is the Holy Prophet ﷺ commanded to acquire the knowledge that there is no object of worship besides Allah?
output: The Holy Prophet ﷺ is commanded to acquire this knowledge so that he can fulfill its corresponding demands, particularly asking forgiveness for his faults.

instruction: What is the significance of knowledge according to the commentary?
output: Knowledge is significant because it demands action, and the Holy Qur'an often imparts knowledge first and then commands to fulfill its corresponding demands.

instruction: What does the phrase "وَاسْتَغْفِرْ‌ لِذَنبِكَ" in the text mean?
output: The phrase "وَاسْتَغْفِرْ‌ لِذَنبِكَ" means to ask forgiveness for your faults or sins. However, in this context, it refers to the "dhanb" or fault of the Holy Prophet ﷺ, which is not a sin but a mistake in Ijtihad.

instruction: What is the lexical definition of the term "muhkamah" as used in the Islamic text?
output: The lexical definition of the term "muhkamah" is "firm".

instruction: In what sense is the term "Surah" used in the Islamic text?
output: In the Islamic text, the term "Surah" is used in its technical sense, indicating an operative divine commandment that is not abrogated.

instruction: What does the phrase "So, destruction is very close to them" in the text mean according to Asma'i?
output: According to Asma'i, the phrase "So, destruction is very close to them" means that the causes of destruction have approached or drawn near to them.

instruction: Who are the individuals that Allah has cursed according to the verse (47:23)?
output: Those individuals who cause corruption in the land and break bonds of kinship have been cursed by Allah.

instruction: What is the term Ummul-Walad in Islamic law, and why was the sale of Ummul-Walad declared unlawful?
output: Ummul-Walad is a term used in Islamic law for a female slave who has borne a child to her master, and who is consequently free at his death. The sale of Ummul-Walad was declared unlawful because it would result in separating the child from the mother, and this would lead to severing kinship tie between mother and child, which necessitates the curse of Allah.

instruction: What is the majority view in the Ummah regarding cursing a particular person, and under what condition is it permissible?
output: The majority of the Ummah hold the view that it is not permissible to curse any particular person unless we know for sure that he died in the state of disbelief. However, we can use cursing phrases with general characteristics, such as the curse of Allah be upon the liars, the curse of Allah be upon the mischief-makers, and the curse of Allah be upon the breaker of kinship.

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "ام على قلوب اقفالوها" (or do they have locks on their hearts?) in the context of the Qur'an?
output: This phrase describes a state where the disbelievers refuse to employ their hearts for the comprehension of truth. Their hearts are "locked," or sealed, rendering them incapable of distinguishing right from wrong.

instruction: What is the consequence of committing sins all the time as per the Qur'anic text?
output: The consequence of committing sins all the time, as per the Qur'anic text, is the sealing or locking of the hearts, making the disbelievers incapable of distinguishing right from wrong.

instruction: How does the state of "locking" of hearts relate to the disbelievers' comprehension of truth according to the Qur'an?
output: The "locking" of hearts in the Qur'anic context refers to the disbelievers' refusal to employ their hearts for the comprehension of truth. This is a natural consequence of their habitual sinning.

instruction: What are the two acts ascribed to the devil in the given Islamic text?
output: Taswil (making evil works look good) and Imla' (giving respite).

instruction: How did the devil make the evil works look to the people mentioned in the text?
output: The devil made the evil works look good and beautiful to them.

instruction: What is the result of the devil's actions as described in the text?
output: The devil's actions result in far-fetched fancies that will never be fulfilled.

instruction: What does the word "adghan" in the Islamic text refer to?
output: The word "adghan" in the Islamic text refers to secret enmity, rancour, malice or spite.

instruction: What was the context in which the verse "Amm haseebu" was revealed?
output: The verse "Amm haseebu" was revealed in connection with the hypocrites to expose their bitter hatred and rancour against Islam which they were hiding in their hearts.

instruction: What does the Surah Fadihah mean according to Ibn Kathir?
output: According to Ibn Kathir, Surah Fadihah means exposing to shame or disgrace, because specific qualities of the hypocrites are set out in it.

instruction: What is the meaning of the Qur'anic verse "وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَأَرَ‌يْنَاكَهُمْ فَلَعَرَ‌فْتَهُم بِسِيْمَاهُمْ" (If We will, We would show them to you, so as you would definitely recognize them by their features)?
output: If Allah wishes, He could have revealed the hypocrites to Prophet Muhammad ﷺ in a way that the Prophet ﷺ could identify each hypocrite personally by their features.

instruction: Why does the Qur'anic verse "وَلَتَعْرِ‌فَنَّهُمْ فِي لَحْنِ الْقَوْلِ" mean that the Prophet ﷺ will recognize the hypocrites by the tone of their speech?
output: The Prophet ﷺ was given insight to perceive the inner nature and real character of the hypocrites by the style of their speech, since their speech would reveal their inner secrets.

instruction: What is the significance of the Hadith which reports that any person harboring a secret thought in his heart, Allah puts a cover on it; if it is good, it becomes manifest?
output: This Hadith signifies that when a person harbors a secret thought in their heart, Allah will make it evident either by concealing it or making it manifest, depending on whether the thought is good or bad.

instruction: What is the significance of 'knowledge' mentioned in the Islamic text?
output: The knowledge mentioned in the Islamic text refers to Allah's knowledge of things after they have actually happened, not before.

instruction: What is the difference between a priori knowledge and a posteriori knowledge in the context of the Islamic text?
output: A priori knowledge refers to knowledge about a thing before its occurrence, while a posteriori knowledge refers to knowledge about a thing after it has actually happened, as per the Islamic text.

instruction: What is the purpose of the verse according to the Islamic text?
output: The purpose of the verse, according to the Islamic text, is to distinguish sincere believers from hypocrites through their actions in the context of jihad.

instruction: What does the verse "إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُ‌وا وَصَدُّوا عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّـهِ (Those who disbelieve and prevent (others) from Allah's way ... - 47:32)" refer to?
output: The verse refers to those who disbelieve in Allah (including the hypocrites, the Jewish tribes of Banu Quraizah and Banu Nadir, and other infidels) who prevent others from following Allah's way.

instruction: What does the phrase "وَسَيُحْبِطُ أَعْمَالَهُمْ" (He will render their deeds vain - 47:32) mean?
output: The term "habt-ul-a` mal" (rendering deeds vain) means that the efforts of the disbelievers to undermine Islam will be unsuccessful and fail, and their good deeds, such as charity, free will offerings, philanthropic activities, and so on, will not be acceptable.

instruction: In the term "لَا تُبْطِلُوا أَعْمَالَكُمْ" (Do not nullify your own good works - 47:32), why does the Qur'an use the phrase "ibtal ul-a'male" instead of "habt ul-a'mal"?
output: The term "ibtal ul-a'male" is used instead of "habt ul-a'mal" because the scope of the former phrase is much wider than the latter phrase. Ibtal ul-a'male may be interpreted in two ways: 1) on account of disbelief, which was described in the foregoing verse as "habt ul-a'mal"; and 2) on account of the condition that some righteous deeds are sometimes conditional upon other righteous acts, and if the condition is not fulfilled, the righteous deeds will be rendered fruitless.

instruction: What is the difference between the warning in verse 32 and verse 34 of Surat Al-Ghafir?
output: The warning in verse 32 of Surat Al-Ghafir primarily concerns the loss of infidels in this world, while verse 34 describes their loss in the next world.

instruction: Who are the infidels referred to in verse 34 of Surat Al-Ghafir?
output: The infidels referred to in verse 34 of Surat Al-Ghafir are those who persisted in their disbelief and idolatry until their dying day.

instruction: What is the ruling regarding the infidels who embraced Islam after their disbelief according to the commentary of verse 32 of Surat Al-Ghafir?
output: According to the commentary of verse 32 of Surat Al-Ghafir, the good works done by infidels who later embraced Islam would go to waste, and they would not be rewarded for them.

instruction: What does the verse "Fala-tahinu wa-tad'uwa ila as-salmi" prohibit?
output: The verse prohibits Muslims from taking initiative for entering into a peace treaty with infidels based on cowardice and a desire for a life of luxury.

instruction: What does the verse "Wa'in jana'hu la-l-salmi fa-ajnach laha" allow?
output: This verse allows Muslims to enter into a peace agreement with infidels if the infidels themselves initiate the peace negotiations.

instruction: What is the ruling regarding Muslims taking initiative for negotiating peace with infidels?
output: It is permissible for Muslims to take initiative in negotiating peace with infidels, if it is in the best interest of the Muslims, not due to cowardice or involvement in a life of luxury.

instruction: What does the Arabic verse 47:36 mean in the context of Islamic teachings?
output: The Arabic verse 47:36 means that the worldly life is transient and temporary, whereas the rewards and blessings of the Hereafter are permanent and eternal. Muslims are encouraged to focus on the eternal rewards and not on the temporary pleasures of this world.

instruction: What is the apparent meaning of the phrase "and will not ask you your riches" in verse 47:36?
output: The apparent meaning of the phrase "and will not ask you your riches" in verse 47:36 is that Allah does not demand our wealth, but it is for our own benefit that sacrifices of life and money are demanded.

instruction: What does the phrase "and will not ask you your riches" mean according to some scholars?
output: According to some scholars, the phrase "and will not ask you your riches" means that Allah does not demand all of one's wealth, but only a nominal percentage for expending, such as 2.5% for zakah, 10% or 5% for agricultural produce, and one goat out of every hundred goats. This is imposed to ensure that people expend readily and happily, without feeling unhappy or being niggardly.

instruction: What does the verse "you are called upon to spend in Allah's way, but some of you withhold in miserliness" mean in the context of the Islamic text provided?
output: The verse "you are called upon to spend in Allah's way, but some of you withhold in miserliness" means that Muslims are encouraged to donate for Allah's cause, but some of them are miserly and unwilling to contribute.

instruction: What is the implication of the verse "and he who withholds in miserliness withholds against himself - 47:38"?
output: The verse "and he who withholds in miserliness withholds against himself - 47:38" means that any person practising miserliness will suffer loss or detriment because they will have to carry the burden of failing to fulfill their obligation and thus will be deprived of reward in the Hereafter.

instruction: What does the verse "And if you turn away, He will replace you by some other people, then they will not be like you" imply?
output: The verse "And if you turn away, He will replace you by some other people, then they will not be like you" implies that if Muslims stop acting upon Allah's injunctions, Allah will replace them with another people who will obey Him completely as long as Allah wants to maintain the religion of truth, Islam.

instruction: When was the Surah revealed?
output: The Surah was revealed when the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ was returning from the Treaty of Hudaibiyah, in the 6th year of Hijrah, in the month of Dhul-Qa`dah.

instruction: What was the purpose of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ's journey to Makkah during the event of Hudaibiyah?
output: The purpose of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ's journey to Makkah was to perform the 'Umrah, but he was stopped by the Quraish and a compromise was made that he must go back home that year and make up for the missed 'Umrah the following year.

instruction: What is the Treaty of Hudaibiyah described as in the Surah?
output: The Treaty of Hudaibiyah is described as "an open victory" because this Treaty was in fact the forerunner of the conquest of Makkah. The Pledge of Ridwan on the occasion of Hudaibiyah is also considered a real 'Victory' where the Companions ؓ [ some 1400] were asked by the Prophet ﷺ to declare on solemn oath that they would stand by him at all costs and would fight under his banner to the bitter end. The Pledge of Jihad is referred to later on in this Surah.

instruction: What are the three bounties that the victory in the 6th year of Hijrah granted to the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ?
output: The victory granted three bounties to the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ. Firstly, it bestowed forgiveness for his past and future shortcomings. Secondly, it guided him to a straight path. Thirdly, it provided him with an increase in reward.

instruction: What is the significance of guidance to the straight path for the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, given that he was already on the right path from the very outset?
output: Guidance to the straight path for the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ through the manifest victory in the 6th year of Hijrah signifies the attainment of higher degrees of spiritual and moral attainment, which is described by the clause yahdiyaka.

instruction: What is the definition of Hidayah (guidance) in Islamic terms?
output: Hidayah (guidance) has been defined as to show the path or to lead someone gently and kindly towards his destination, with the ultimate destination being Allah's pleasure and proximity. The degrees of pleasure and proximity are unlimited, and the need for such spiritual and moral attainment is not confined to any specific individual, Muslim, saint, or prophet.

instruction: What is the third bounty mentioned in the text?
output: The third bounty is the mighty support from Allah.

instruction: How does the third bounty manifest itself in the text?
output: The third bounty manifests itself as a large share of help from Allah.

instruction: What is the context of the third bounty in the text?
output: The context of the third bounty is the manifest victory that the Holy Prophet had achieved.

instruction: What event is mentioned in the beginning of this Surah?
output: The event mentioned in the beginning of this Surah is the victory of Hudaibiyah.

instruction: What did the participants of Hudaibiyah ask the Prophet about?
output: The participants of Hudaibiyah asked the Prophet about the favor bestowed upon him, and what was there for them.

instruction: Why were the participants of Hudaibiyah bestowed with good graces of Allah?
output: The participants of Hudaibiyah were bestowed with good graces of Allah because of their faith in, and obedience to, the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.

instruction: What is the significance of the Holy Prophet ﷺ in these verses?
output: The Holy Prophet ﷺ is the medium through which Allah bestows favors upon the Ummah, and the right of the Prophet ﷺ and the obligation of the Ummah to honor and revere him is entrenched.

instruction: What do the terms 'shahid', 'mubashshir', and 'nadhir' refer to in the context of the Holy Prophet ﷺ?
output: 'Shahid' means 'witness', 'mubashshir' means 'bearer of good tidings', and 'nadhir' means 'warner'. The Holy Prophet ﷺ gives glad tidings of Paradise to the believing and obedient sector of the community and warns those who rejected the message.

instruction: What are the three qualities that the believers must exhibit towards the Holy Prophet ﷺ and Allah according to the text?
output: The believers must "support him" (derived from the infinitive or verbal noun ta’ zir), "revere him" (derived from the infinitive or verbal noun tawqir), and "pronounce His (Allah's) purity morning and evening" (derived from the infinitive or verbal noun tasbih).

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "They wish to change the statement of Allah" in the text?
output: The phrase "They wish to change the statement of Allah" refers to the attempt by some Bedouin tribes to participate in the expedition to Khaibar, who were not part of the expedition to Hudaibiyah, despite an injunction from Allah that the right to participate in the expedition of Khaibar and receiving a share in its spoils is reserved exclusively for those sincere Muslims who were with the Prophet at Hudaibiyah.

instruction: What is the status of Wahy Ghayr-Matluww in Islamic law?
output: Wahy Ghayr-Matluww, or unrecited revelation, is one of the fundamental sources of Islamic injunctions, along with the Qur'an. It refers to the Hadith of the Prophet, whose wordings are from the Prophet and the meanings of which are from Allah.

instruction: What is the restriction mentioned in the verse "You shall not follow us" (48:15)?
output: The restriction mentioned in the verse "You shall not follow us" (48:15) is that the laggards who contrived to be left behind were prohibited from taking part in the expedition of Khaibar, but they would be allowed to fight other battles in the near future. This prohibition is restricted to the expedition of Khaibar.

instruction: Who are exempted from the injunction of jihad according to the verse 48:17 revealed in Islamic texts?
output: Blind, lame, and sick persons are exempted from the injunction of jihad.

instruction: Who reported the incident of sincere Muslims who were physically unable to fight and their concern about the warning in verse 16:48 of the Quran?
output: Sayyidna Ibn ` Abbas ؓ reported the incident.

instruction: What event occurred when some sincere Muslims who were physically unable to fight read verse 16:48 of the Quran?
output: They expressed their concern about the warning and verse 17:48 was revealed to exempt them from the injunction of jihad.

instruction: What is the significance of the oath mentioned in the verse 48:18?
output: The oath mentioned in verse 48:18 is called bai` at-ur-Ridwan (the pledge that earned Allah's pleasure). It was given by the companions at Hudaibiyah and is a symbol of their allegiance to the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ. This oath is significant as it demonstrates Allah's pleasure with the sincerity of the believers and emphasizes the obligation of fulfilling the covenant.

instruction: What did the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ say about the companions who participated in bai` at-ur-Ridwan?
output: The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ said, "You are the best of people living on the surface of the earth." This is recorded in Bukhari and Muslim.

instruction: What is the significance of the tree mentioned in verse 48:18?
output: The tree mentioned in verse 48:18 is known as the Tree of Ridwan. It is reported that after the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, some people used to take walks there and perform salah. However, the tree was later felled by Sayyidna ` Umar ؓ due to the fear that future generations might start worshipping it. The exact location of the tree is uncertain.

instruction: What does the phrase "many spoils" in Surah 48:20 refer to?
output: The phrase "many spoils" in Surah 48:20 refers to the sizeable spoils that fell into the hands of Muslims in the conquests which followed the victory at Khaibar, in the rest of Arabia and the neighbouring countries.

instruction: What does the verse "وَكَفَّ أَيْدِيَ النَّاسِ عَنكُمْ" (...and stopped the hands of the people from (harming) you.) mean in the context of the battle of Khaibar?
output: The verse "وَكَفَّ أَيْدِيَ النَّاسِ عَنكُمْ" in the context of the battle of Khaibar means that Allah did not allow the unbelievers of Khaibar the opportunity to show much strength or force in that battle.

instruction: What is the implication of the verse "وَيَهْدِيَكُمْ صِرَ‌اطًا مُّسْتَقِيمًا" (...And (He did this) so that He guides you to the right path.... 48:20)?
output: The verse "وَيَهْدِيَكُمْ صِرَ‌اطًا مُّسْتَقِيمًا" implies that Allah guides the believers to a higher degree of guidance, which they had not yet attained, that is, full reliance on Allah and increase in the power of faith.

instruction: What does the verse "And (there are) other (victories) that have not come within your power as yet, (but) Allah has encompassed them...." (48:21) refer to?
output: The verse refers to a prophecy that Muslims will achieve many more great victories after the victory of Khaibar.

instruction: What is the significance of the victory of Makkah in the context of the verse "And (there are) other (victories) that have not come within your power as yet, (but) Allah has encompassed them...." (48:21)?
output: Some scholars refer to the victory of Makkah as one of the victories that were prophesied in the verse.

instruction: What does the phrase "Allah has encompassed them" in the verse "And (there are) other (victories) that have not come within your power as yet, (but) Allah has encompassed them...." (48:21) imply?
output: The phrase implies that although these victories were not yet achieved by the Muslims at the time, Allah had already encompassed or planned them to happen.

instruction: What is the meaning of batn in the context of a city?
output: The center of the city.

instruction: What is the significance of Hudaibiyah in relation to Makkah?
output: Hudaibiyah is a place very close to Makkah, often referred to as its center or belly.

instruction: According to Hanafi view, which part of Hudaibiyah is included in the haram (sacred area)?
output: Hanafi view suggests that some parts of Hudaibiyah are included in the haram (sacred area).

instruction: What does ma'arrah mean in the context of the Islamic text 48:25?
output: Ma'arrah denotes "shame" or "embarrassment" in the given context.

instruction: Why did Allah protect the Companions ؓ from mistakes in a natural way?
output: Allah protected the Companions ؓ from mistakes in a natural way to avoid causing embarrassment, obloquy, and opprobrium to them.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "so that Allah may admit to His mercy whom He wills" in the text 48:25?
output: This phrase signifies that Allah infused patience in Muslims to avoid war, because He knew that many people in future would embrace Islam, and they would receive a large share of His mercy.

instruction: What does the phrase "Kalimah of Tauhid and Risalah" refer to in the given Islamic text?
output: The phrase "Kalimah of Tauhid and Risalah" refers to the declaration of faith in Allah's Oneness and in the Messenger-ship of Sayyidna Muhammad ﷺ.

instruction: What does the word "kalimat-at-taqwa" connote in the text?
output: The word "kalimat-at-taqwa" connotes the word of the pious persons, which is the foundation of piety, righteousness, and right conduct.

instruction: According to the text, who were the noble Companions and how were they related to the word of Islam?
output: The noble Companions referred to in the text are the companions of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They were more worthy of the word of Islam and better entitled to it, and Allah made them adhere to it firmly.

instruction: What was the Peace Treaty of Hudaibiyah?
output: The Peace Treaty of Hudaibiyah was a treaty between the Muslims and the people of Makkah, allowing the Muslims to return to Madinah without performing 'Umrah that year.

instruction: Why were the Muslims upset at the Peace Treaty of Hudaibiyah?
output: The Muslims were upset because the blessed Companions' determination to perform 'Umrah was on account of the Holy Prophet's vision, and it seemed as though the vision was not fulfilled.

instruction: What does the word 'sidq' mean in the Arabic language?
output: Lexically, 'sidq' is the antonym of 'kidhb', meaning truth. It is used for statements that conform to existing fact or reality.

instruction: Who sent the Messenger of Allah with Guidance and the religion of truth?
output: Allah sent the Messenger of Allah with Guidance and the religion of truth.

instruction: What was the purpose for which Allah sent the Messenger of Allah with Guidance and the religion of truth?
output: Allah sent the Messenger of Allah with Guidance and the religion of truth so that He makes it prevail over all religions.

instruction: What does the verse in Surah Al-Fath in the Quran emphasize about the Holy Prophet ﷺ ?
output: The verse emphasizes the need for strengthening the acceptance and obedience of the Holy Prophet ﷺ. It also denounces those who reject the messenger-ship of the Holy Prophet ﷺ.

instruction: What is the general style of the Qur'an regarding the Messenger of Allah and why is he referred to by his name only four times?
output: The general style of the Qur'an is that the Holy Prophet ﷺ is referred to by his characteristic or attributive names rather than his personal name. He is addressed four times in the entire Qur'an by his personal name because there was a special reason for it. This is because the pagan Quraish objected to the use of the characteristic or attributive name "rasulul-lah" (Messenger of Allah) with the personal name of the Messenger of Allah. However, Allah on this occasion, in the Qur'an, especially attached the characteristic phrase "rasulul-lah" to his personal name "Muhammad" and thus entrenched it permanently in His Last Book, the Holy Qur'an.

instruction: What does the Qur'an describe about the blessed Companions of the Holy Prophet ﷺ in the verse 48:29?
output: The Qur'an describes the blessed Companions ؓ as those who are hard against the unbelievers, and compassionate among themselves. Their distinguishing feature is on their faces from the effect of sajdah (prostration).

instruction: What does the Qur'an predict about the Companions of the Holy Prophet ﷺ in the parable of the sown crop in verse 48:29?
output: The Qur'an predicts that the Companions of the Holy Prophet ﷺ will be like a sown crop that brings forth its shoot, then makes it strong, then it grows thick and stands straight on its stem, looking good to the farmers, so that He may enrage the disbelievers through them. Allah has promised forgiveness and a huge reward to those of them who believe and do good deeds.

instruction: What does the verse 49:2 prohibit?
output: The verse 49:2 prohibits the believers from raising their voices above the voice of the Prophet ﷺ .

instruction: What was the consequence of neglecting this etiquette according to the verse 49:2?
output: Neglecting this etiquette may entail nullification of one's virtuous deeds, because this is a kind of disrespect to the Holy Prophet ﷺ .

instruction: What is the teaching of the verse 49:2 regarding the speech of the believers with the Holy Prophet ﷺ ?
output: The verse 49:2 teaches the believers that they should not raise their voices above the voice of the Holy Prophet ﷺ nor speak aloud to him as one speaks aloud to another in general discussions.

instruction: What is the third etiquette mentioned in the verse quoted about dealing with the Holy Prophet ﷺ while he is at home?
output: One should not call him from outside, particularly not by his name, as it is an unmannered attitude.

instruction: What is the literal meaning of the term 'hujurat' mentioned in the verse quoted above?
output: Lexically, it refers to a four-walled apartment or dwelling, comprising a courtyard and roofed building.

instruction: What was done with the apartments of the Mothers of the Faithful during the reign of Walid Ibn ` Abd-ul-Malik?
output: These apartments of the Mothers of the Faithful were included in the Holy Prophet’ s ﷺ mosque during the reign of Walid Ibn ` Abd-ul-Malik at his own command.

instruction: What is the background of the revelation of Surah Al-Hujurat?
output: The background of the revelation of Surah Al-Hujurat is a story about Harith Ibn Dirar Ibn Abi Dirar, the leader of the tribe of Banul-Mustaliq, who was one of the blessed wives of the Holy Prophet ﷺ, and his incident with the Holy Prophet ﷺ and the tribe of Banul-Mustaliq.

instruction: Who was Walid Ibn 'Uqbah and how was he involved in the revelation of Surah Al-Hujurat?
output: Walid Ibn 'Uqbah was a companion of the Prophet ﷺ who was sent to collect the Zakah from the Banul-Mustaliq tribe, but he feared that they might kill him, so he returned to Madinah and reported to the Prophet ﷺ that they refused to pay Zakah and wanted to kill him. This incident led to the revelation of Surah Al-Hujurat.

instruction: What is the ruling based on the verse of Surah Al-Hujurat regarding accepting information or evidence from a sinful person?
output: According to the ruling based on the verse of Surah Al-Hujurat, it is not lawful to accept any information or evidence from a sinful person unless it is investigated by other sources and confirmed. The verse contains the injunction "verify its correctness." In another reading, the word "tathabbatu" conveys the same meaning. The sense is: "Do not rush into taking actions or measures; be stable, and stand firmly in your place; and do not be easily moved or shaken. Wait until the news or information is confirmed by other independent sources."

instruction: Who reported that Banul-Mustaliq had turned apostate and refused to pay Zakah?
output: Walid Ibn 'Uqbah ؓ reported that Banul-Mustaliq had turned apostate and refused to pay Zakah.

instruction: What was the initial reaction of the blessed Companions when they heard the news about Banul-Mustaliq's apostasy?
output: The blessed Companions were disturbed and infuriated when they heard the news about Banul-Mustaliq's apostasy.

instruction: According to the Qur'an, what was not right and proper about the view expressed by the blessed Companions regarding Banul-Mustaliq's apostasy?
output: The Qur'an indicates that the blessed Companions' view, which was to declare jihad immediately, was not right and proper, as their decision was not in accordance with the Holy Prophet ﷺ's decision, which proved to be better.

instruction: What is the purpose of the set of verses in the Quran discussed in the text?
output: The purpose of the set of verses in the Quran discussed in the text is to establish manners, mores, injunctions, and mutual rights and obligations to be observed in individual and social life, with the common value being to avoid causing any inconvenience to the members of the society.

instruction: What was the occasion of revelation for the verses mentioned in the text?
output: The commentators have narrated several incidents as a background of the revelation of these verses. Among them is the clash that took place between two Muslim groups. It is not inconceivable that the totality of these incidents might have been the occasion of revelation.

instruction: Who are the immediate addressees of verse 9:9 in the Quran, according to Abu Hayyan in Al-Bahr and preferred by 'Alusi in Ruh-ul-Ma' ani?
output: The immediate addressees of verse 9:9 in the Quran, according to Abu Hayyan in Al-Bahr and preferred by 'Alusi in Ruh-ul-Ma' ani, are rulers and those in authority who have the means to fight and wage war.

instruction: What does the text 'Muhammad Taqi Usmani' discuss?
output: The text discusses the prohibition of calling others with bad nicknames in Islam.

instruction: What does the Quran prohibit in the verse 49:11?
output: The Quran prohibits ridiculing, finding fault with, and reviling one another with nicknames.

instruction: What is the legal maxim derived from the tradition of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ regarding passing judgments on people based on their overt actions?
output: In any matter, it is not proper to pass a categorical judgment on the basis of overt evidence or circumstances, as a person's overt actions might seem to be good but in the sight of Allah, on account of the insincerity and impurity of his heart, they could be bad, or vice versa.

instruction: What does the term Zann primarily denote in the context of Islamic jurisprudence, and what is it prohibited to do based on this term?
output: The term Zann primarily denotes assumption on probable evidence. It is prohibited to act on unfounded suspicion, that is, to accuse someone without strong evidence.

instruction: What is the meaning of the term tajassus, as mentioned in the text, and what is prohibited in relation to it?
output: Tajassus connotes spying or prying secretly into the faults of others. It is prohibited to spy on one another and look for other’s faults.

instruction: What is the meaning of the term ghibah, as mentioned in the text, and what is prohibited in relation to it?
output: Ghibah connotes backbiting, or speaking ill of a person behind his back which if he heard would hurt or injure his feelings. It is prohibited to backbite.

instruction: What does the Quran state about the creation of mankind?
output: The Quran states that all of Mankind are the children of 'Adam and Hawwa' (علیہما السلام), and have been declared equal in the sight of Allah.

instruction: What is the underlying Divine wisdom in the division of mankind into different tribes, nations, races, lineage, and language-speakers/linguistic groups?
output: The underlying Divine wisdom in such a division is identification, for example, for purposes of mutual identification, determining near and remote agnate heirs, and applying the law of succession or dividing the estate of a deceased.

instruction: What is the meaning of the term "Shu`ub" in the context of the verse?
output: "Shu`ub" refers to a large group of persons of the same origin, like a nation. It consists of clans and tribes, with the largest group being called "sa'b", and the smallest being called "`ashirah".

instruction: What was the purpose of the incident mentioned in the text?
output: The incident mentioned in the text was to deceive the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ by a few members of the Banu Asad tribe, who claimed to be Muslims in order to demand financial help from the Muslim Sadaqat funds, enrich themselves, and eradicate their poverty.

instruction: What is the literal meaning of Islam according to the text?
output: The literal meaning of Islam, according to the text, is to recite the kalimah of Islam, enter the fold of the religion, and surrender.

instruction: What is the technical meaning of the term "Iman" in Shari'ah?
output: In the technical sense of Shari’ ah, "Iman" refers to the belief by heart and thus connotes a firm and unshakable belief in the Oneness of Allah and in His ﷺ .

instruction: What subjects does Surah Qaf mostly contain?
output: Surah Qaf mostly contains subjects relating to the Day of Judgment, Resurrection, the Reckoning, Paradise, the Fire, Allah's reward and punishment etc.

instruction: What did Umm Hisham Bint Harithah Ibn Nu' man ؓ memorize from the Holy Prophet ﷺ ?
output: Umm Hisham Bint Harithah Ibn Nu' man ؓ memorized Surah Qaf from the Holy Prophet ﷺ .

instruction: Is it possible to observe the heaven?
output: According to the verse, it is possible to see the sky above us with the naked eye; however, the common perception is that the blue color we see above is the color of the atmosphere, not the heaven. It can also be interpreted that the word nazar (seeing) used in the verse could mean perceiving through reason, that is, thinking, pondering etc. (Bayan-ul-Qur’ an).

instruction: What does the word "Marij" mean in the verse "فِي أَمْرٍ‌ مَّرِ‌يجٍ" (so they are in a confused state... 5)?
output: The word "Marij" means something mixed up with different elements and generally becomes corrupt or spoiled. It can also mean "in disarray, in a confused state".

instruction: What is the state of those who deny the prophethood of the Holy Prophet ﷺ according to the verse "فِي أَمْرٍ‌ مَّرِ‌يجٍ" (so they are in a confused state... 5)?
output: According to the verse, the state of those who deny the prophethood of the Holy Prophet ﷺ is one of confusion. They are not consistent in their claims and their words are no more than confusion.

instruction: What are some of the claims made by the disbelievers about the Holy Prophet ﷺ according to the verse "فِي أَمْرٍ‌ مَّرِ‌يجٍ" (so they are in a confused state... 5)?
output: According to the verse, the disbelievers sometimes call the Holy Prophet ﷺ a sorcerer, at other times a poet; and yet at other times they refer to him as a soothsayer or an astrologer. They were so confused that they could not extricate themselves from their perplexity.

instruction: What is the meaning of the word furuj in the given text?
output: The word furuj is the plural of farj, which means a crack or an opening.

instruction: What does the text imply about the creation of the heaven?
output: The text implies that the creation of the heaven is flawless and has no cracks, patches, or stitching, which would not be the case if it was made by man.

instruction: Can we find any sort of patchwork or stitching in the sky according to the given text?
output: No, according to the given text, no one can find any sort of patchwork or stitching in the sky. However, the text does not negate the existence of doors in the heaven.

instruction: Who were the people of Rass?
output: The people of Rass were the remnants of the people of Thamud who survived the punishment.

instruction: Who were the people of Thamud?
output: The people of Thamud were the followers of Prophet Salih (علیہ السلام).

instruction: What happened to the people of Thamud, as described in the Qur'an?
output: The people of Thamud were punished by Allah for their disbelief and idol worship, leaving behind desolate wells and well-built castles.

instruction: What is the subject of the text?
output: The text discusses the concept of Allah's proximity to man, asserting that Allah is closer to man than his jugular vein.

instruction: According to the text, in what sense is Allah's power and knowledge 'nearer' to man than his jugular vein?
output: Allah's power and knowledge are 'nearer' to man in the sense that they encompass man from within and without, so that His power and knowledge are nearer to him than his own jugular vein.

instruction: What is the special type of contact or relationship between Allah and man that is discussed in the text?
output: The text discusses a special type of contact or relationship between Allah and man, known as ittisal, which is a reality and nature that is not known to anyone, but it does necessarily exist. This relationship is different from the general relationship between Allah and man and is attained through nearness of obligatory and supererogatory works and through man's efforts. This relationship is reserved exclusively for believers.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "idh yatalaqq al-mutalaqqiyani" in the Islamic text?
output: The phrase "idh yatalaqq al-mutalaqqiyani" signifies the moment when the two angels receive every human act to record it.

instruction: Who are the two angels that are mentioned in the Islamic text?
output: The two angels mentioned in the Islamic text are the two recording angels that accompany every human being all the time to receive and record the deeds of mankind.

instruction: What do the two angels do according to the Islamic text?
output: The angel sitting on the right records the good deeds, and the one on the left records the bad actions and sins.

instruction: What does the verse "Not a single word is uttered by one, but there is a watcher near him, ready [to record]" (50:18) mean?
output: The verse means that every single word spoken by a person is recorded by their supervising angel, who is responsible for recording all utterances.

instruction: What are the two different views regarding the recording of words as per Islamic texts?
output: The two different views are: (a) Every single utterance is recorded, whether or not it is sinful or rewardable. (b) Only those utterances are recorded that are sinful or rewardable.

instruction: What happens to one's recorded utterances once a week on Thursdays according to Islamic texts?
output: Once a week on Thursdays, the angels review the recorded utterances and retain only those that are sinful or rewardable, good or bad; the rest are discounted.

instruction: What does the phrase "sakrat-ul-maut" denote?
output: The phrase "sakrat-ul-maut" denotes the agony and the stupor or daze of death that a dying person experiences.

instruction: What did A'isha recite during her father's death?
output: A'isha recited the verse: "When the soul one day will be uneasy and the breast thereby will become narrow".

instruction: What was Abu Bakr Siddiq's response when A'isha recited the verse?
output: Abu Bakr Siddiq heard this and said: "You recited this verse inappropriately; why did you not recite the Qur'anic verse [50:19] instead?"

instruction: Who is the addressee of the verse "Now We have removed your veil from you; so your sight today is sharp" in the Quran?
output: The verse addresses mankind in general, including believers, unbelievers, the pious, and the wicked.

instruction: What is the analogy drawn between the world and the Hereafter in the given Islamic text?
output: The world is likened to the dream-world, and the Hereafter is likened to the state of wakefulness.

instruction: What is the aphorism formulated by scholars based on the given text?
output: The aphorism is: "People are sleeping in this world; when they die, they will wake up."

instruction: What is the meaning of the word "alqiya" in the Islamic text?
output: The word "alqiya" in the Islamic text means to cast or throw.

instruction: Who are the two persons to whom the word "alqiya" is grammatically addressed in the text?
output: The word "alqiya" is grammatically addressed to the Sa'iq and Shahid angels in the text.

instruction: Who is the subject of the verb "alqiya" in the text and why is he being thrown?
output: The subject of the verb "alqiya" in the text is a stubborn disbeliever, and he is being thrown into the fire of Hell.

instruction: What does the word qarin denote in the Islamic text?
output: The word qarin denotes a companion or one who accompanies or associates with another, often referring to a devil entrusted to every man.

instruction: What does the devil say about the human in response to being ordered that the person be thrown into Hell?
output: The devil says, "I did not lead him astray. In fact he himself was misguided, paying no heed to the truth".

instruction: What is the purpose of the devil in the Islamic context?
output: In the Islamic context, the purpose of the devil is to call human beings towards the commission of sins and thus lead them astray.

instruction: What does the verse "Do not quarrel before Me, while I had sent to you My threat well in advance" warn against?
output: The verse warns against quarreling or disputing.

instruction: What does the phrase "My threat well in advance" refer to in this verse?
output: The phrase "My threat well in advance" refers to the warnings given by past Messengers and the Divine Books sent down by Allah.

instruction: What is the implication of the verse "Do not quarrel before Me, while I had sent to you My threat well in advance" according to the explanation?
output: The verse implies that the evidences, signs, and proofs have been established against the people, and their flimsy excuses, arguments, and disputes will not work today.

instruction: What does the phrase "The Word is not changed with Me" in the Islamic text imply?
output: The phrase implies that God's decision, once made, will never be changed or altered.

instruction: What does the text suggest about God's role as a wrongdoer to His slaves?
output: The text suggests that God is not a wrongdoer to His slaves, meaning He does not unjustly punish or wrong them.

instruction: What is the purpose of establishing the proof against a person before they are punished for their sins?
output: The purpose of establishing the proof against a person before they are punished for their sins is to ensure a fair and just decision, as suggested by the text.

instruction: Who is referred to as Awwab in Islamic texts?
output: Awwab is a person who turns to Allah in repentance against sins.

instruction: What does the term 'Hafiz' mean according to 'Abdullah Ibn 'Abbas' interpretation?
output: According to 'Abdullah Ibn 'Abbas', Hafiz is one who remembers his sins, so that he may return to Allah in penitence and make amends.

instruction: What is the significance of the invocation "سُبحَانَکَ اللَّھُمَّ وَ بِحَمدِکَ لَٓا اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اَنتَ اَستغفِرُکَ وَ اَتُوبُ اِلَیکَ"?
output: This invocation is a supplication advised to be recited when dispersing. Allah will forgive all the sins that might have been committed in that session.

instruction: What does the first part of verse 50:35 of the Quran depict about Paradise?
output: The first part of verse 50:35 of the Quran depicts that the righteous in Paradise will have whatever delights they wish brought forthwith without any delay.

instruction: What does the second part of verse 50:35 of the Quran refer to?
output: The second part of verse 50:35 of the Quran refers to desirable delights which have not been conceived of by any man, and therefore, they could not wish or desire for them.

instruction: What does the Hadith recorded in Musnad of Ahmad on the authority of Sayyidna Abu Said Khudri ¶ state about children in Paradise?
output: The Hadith states that if anyone in Paradise wishes for children, the conception, delivery of the baby, and its growth will all take place in a short span of time.

instruction: What is the meaning of the verb نَقَّبُوا (naqqabu) in the given verse?
output: To go or go away through the distant land or country or journey or traverse.

instruction: What is the meaning of the word mahis in the given verse?
output: Asylum or a place of refuge.

instruction: What does the given verse imply about the unbelievers' search for a place of refuge?
output: The verse implies that the unbelievers searched the cities, but they could not find any place to escape their imminent torment, as no land could give them shelter.

instruction: What does the term "qalb" (heart) represent in the Islamic text as per Ibn ` Abbas?
output: According to Ibn ` Abbas, the term "qalb" (heart) represents "aql" (intellect) in the Islamic text.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Ilqa'-us-sam'" in the text?
output: The phrase "Ilqa'-us-sam'" signifies to listen to someone attentively and be present.

instruction: Who are the two types of people that benefit from the Qur'anic verses as per the text?
output: The two types of people that benefit from the Qur'anic verses are: a) A person who has mind, intellect, and understands the verses in his mind, accepting them. b) A person who gives his ears, listens to the Divine verses with an attentive heart, while his heart is present and not absent.

instruction: What is the original meaning of the Arabic word "tasbih"?
output: The original meaning of the Arabic word "tasbih" is to declare or proclaim the purity of Allah.

instruction: What do some scholars interpret as the meaning of "tasbih" before sunrise and before sunset in the verse 50:39?
output: Some scholars interpret "tasbih" before sunrise as referring to the morning prayer, and "tasbih" before sunset as referring to `Asr (late afternoon) prayer.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Subhanallahi wa bi hamdihi" according to a hadith reported by Bukhari and Muslim?
output: According to a hadith reported by Bukhari and Muslim, the phrase "Subhanallahi wa bi hamdihi" (Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him) is such that if one recites it one hundred times in a day, their sins will be forgiven, even though they may be more than the waves of the sea.

instruction: What does Mujahid interpret the phrase "at the ends of prostrations" in the verse "وَأَدْبَارَ‌ السُّجُودِ" (50:40) to mean?
output: Mujahid interprets "at the ends of prostrations" to refer to all those tasbihat which authentic ahadith encourage us to recite after every prayer.

instruction: What are the tasbihat that one is encouraged to recite after every prayer, according to Mujahid?
output: The tasbihat that one is encouraged to recite after every prayer, according to Mujahid, include 33 times subhanallah, 33 times al-hamdulillah, 33 times allahu 'akbar, and the phrase "لَا اِلٰہَ ِالّا اللہُ وَحدَہُ ، لَا شَرِیکَ لَہُ ، لَہُ المُلکُ و لَہُ الحَمدُ وھُوَ 'الیٰ کُلِّ شیʾ قَدِیر" - all his sins will be forgiven, even though they may be equal to the waves of the sea.

instruction: What does the Holy Prophet ﷺ say about reciting the aforementioned tasbihat after every prayer?
output: The Holy Prophet ﷺ said that whosoever recites after every obligatory prayer 33 times subhanallah, 33 times al-hamdulillah, 33 times allahu 'akbar, and once: "لَا اِلٰہَ ِالّا اللہُ وَحدَہُ ، لَا شَرِیکَ لَہُ ، لَہُ المُلکُ و لَہُ الحَمدُ وھُوَ 'الیٰ کُلِّ شیʾ قَدِیر" - all his sins will be forgiven, even though they may be equal to the waves of the sea.
